message:
“Happiness is a mysterious thing, to be found somewhere between too little and too much.” a beautiful quote by one of the most beloved children’s author of India, Ruskin Bond. This British descent Indian author will be celebrating his 85th birthday on May 19 this year. Neither age nor time has dwindled his charm and humour. He has penned down over 500 short stories, fiction, nonfiction, novels, some of which have even been adapted into successful Bollywood films. The Room on the Roof, The Blue Umbrella and the Rusty stories are some of his most popular and loved books.
He has been awarded by the Sahitya Akademi award, the Padma Bhushan and the Padma Shri. His attention to the minute details of everyday life encourages us to take time for small pleasures. He exhibits the tales of the hills and rains, people and trains. His stories are a window to life in the mountains and even outside them. He seems to think that beauty in the natural world is not limited to certain parts of nature but each moment of the year has its own beauty. His books make us wonder with delight of all the endless possibilities of life. His writing style is very simple because he thinks simplification doesn’t betray the nuance of life, it renders life more visible. The bonds that people share with his books have a profound impact on their life. His words touch our soul and unravel the emotions of his readers. He writes as if the episodes are unfolding right in front of his eyes. Looking at the world through his words, you can’t help but fall in love.

IIT Kharagpur's startup culture has always been a mammoth presence in the professional technical fields, and examples such as this are the ones which grant our campus its reputation in intellectual and technical prowess.
Four IIT Kharagpur graduates, Anisha Banka, Mukesh Kumar, Arpit Dwivedi, and Tanumoy Bar, from the 2017 and 2018 graduating batch launched MetnMat Research in October 2018. This startup has been very strategically launched to fill a gap in the metallurgical and materials engineering field which has existed for quite some time - R&D. Such heavy industries spend less than 2% of their revenues in R&D, and this is an excellent solution for them - to outsource R&D. MetnMat, an acronym for Metallurgy and Mathematics aims to bring cutting edge scientific advancements and solutions to the existent metallurgical and material sciences field.

MetnMat has been largely successful as well so far, having redesigned the R&D functioning of multiple industrial corporate entities. Their hard work over the larger part of the year has led them to file three patents in ceramic, copper alloys and composite applications.

R&D is a vital component in every field, and India definitely needs to step up its game in order to compete with the heavyweights in the international market and establish a significant economic presence. MetnMat and hopefully more startup initiatives of this nature are steps in the right direction.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is proud of our alumni for working hard to make our institute proud and to serve the interests of our nation by showing what our technical cream of the crop is capable of.

This startup has been very strategically launched to fill a gap in the metallurgical and materials engineering field which has existed for quite some time - R&D. Such heavy industries spend less than 2% of their revenues in R&D, and this is an excellent solution for them - to outsource R&D. MetnMat, an acronym for Metallurgy and Mathematics aims to bring cutting edge scientific advancements and solutions to the existent metallurgical and material sciences field.

MetnMat has been largely successful as well so far, having redesigned the R&D functioning of multiple industrial corporate entities. Their hard work over the larger part of the year has led them to file three patents in ceramic, copper alloys and composite applications.

R&D is a vital component in every field, and India definitely needs to step up its game in order to compete with the heavyweights in the international market and establish a significant economic presence. MetnMat and hopefully more startup initiatives of this nature are steps in the right direction.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is proud of our alumni for working hard to make our institute proud and to serve the interests of our nation by showing what our technical cream of the crop is capable of.

However, this has been beautifully interpreted and elaborated by Prof. Mrigank Sharad, Faculty at School of Engineering Entrepreneurship, IIT Kharagpur in his article “Key to Lasting Joy, Hidden in IIT's Motto". Here is the link to the article in which he takes a deeper look at the phrase and the verse of the Gita it is derived from: 

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/iit-kharagpurs-motto-revisited-mrigank-sharad/?fbclid=IwAR2SW916UQSxQMfEQ1DFMqpgQlG4kAlOmTxCV3adn2NE_m4Tj8O_ByLOtx8

Mubashshir Ali, KGP alumni doing Ph.D. in atmospheric dynamics in Institute of Geography & Oeschger Centre for Climate Change Research, University of Bern has been following Cyclone Fani closely and is sharing the recent forecast update of Cyclone Fani from GFS model run. 

One of the animations is the forecast of Peak Wind Gust from GFS model which shows that the intensity is likely to decrease as it reaches KGP to the range of around 100 km/h. Actual measurement could be a bit higher since the model is on a 0.25-degree resolution. Thankfully Fani is forecasted to lose much of its ferocity. However, it is advisable that those who are residing in the campus should take all precautions.

The animation of storm tracks KGP from the ECMWF model which shows the direction in which Fani is headed. The increase in core pressure signifies that the intensity would decrease as Fani moves further. Another animation shows IR satellite imagery of Cyclone Fani. The IR enhanced image is taken from the satellite Himawari operated by the Japan Meteorological Agency at 12:20 UTC in which Fani can be seen just around Kharagpur.

Here is the google drive link for all the animations: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1dcmsAEFaNWSBFXsVPSj5F5tVF7NOK-Pg

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the safe and sound being of everyone in the community and hopes that everyone will take full precautions.

message:
Mr. Siddartha Khastgir, an alumnus of IIT KGP (batch of 2011), honorable mention as a Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018 has recently given a TEDx talk on "How safe does a driverless car need to be?" in Leamington. He is currently a Research Head at the Connected and Autonomous Vehicle which is responsible for the testing of Driverless Cars at WMG-Uni of Warwick, UK. He is also presently pursuing his Ph.D. in Coventry, UK.

Here is the link of his TEDx talk: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KrOOXE3SW-A

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had earlier published about him, being a "Jewel" of KGP. The article can be read here: http://awaaziitkgp.org/siddartha.php

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared a Page. Cooking garnished with cultural cuisines is an integral part of almost every culture. For many, it’s an art of spreading love with mouthwatering delicacies, while for others, it’s a playground of creativity. The Technology Culinary Arts Society aims to encourage the culinary arts and allied activities among students. The society shall organize various workshops and events for the students' community and help the members to learn and practice culinary arts under Technology Students Gymkhana. The addition of events based on Culinary Arts into the Inter IIT Cultural Meet has further encouraged all the students across different IITs to take interest and participate in such activities. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates this eclectic initiative and wishes all the best to the Technology Culinary Arts Society for its vision and growth. https://m.facebook.com/profile.php?id=577211099355498

The 3rd Undergraduate Council came into existence yesterday with the farewell of the old members. The members of the UG Council for the academic session 2019-20 elected Tyss Santosh as their UG Representative. 
The list of Department Representatives for all the departments/schools have been attached below. Students are encouraged to convey their issues that pertain to the academic landscape of their departments or anything else in general, to their respective Department Representatives. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the newly elected members best for their tenure.

इतिहास सर्वदा से ही सामान्य नागरिक की रगों में, लेखकों की कृति में एवं वर्तमान के  वर्चस्व में बद्धमूल है। स्वतंत्रता-पूर्व भारत में एक ऐसी घटना - जिसने पूरे सभ्य समाज को मातम और शोक में भर दिया था; वह घटना जिसमें शहीद हुए लोगों की चीखें आज भी सभी देशवासियों के कानों में गूंजती है, और आने वाले समय में भी गूंजती रहेंगी - उसी दुर्भाग्यपूर्ण जलियांवाला बाग हत्याकांड की शताब्दी आज पूर्ण हुई।
1919 में भारतवासियों के बीच राजनैतिक गतिविधियों को दबाने के लिए भारतीय ब्रिटिश सरकार ने  "रॉलेक्ट" अधिनियम पारित किया जिसके अनुसार, किसी भी व्यक्ति को देशद्रोह के शक के आधार पर गिरफ्तार किया जा सकता था और उसे बिना जांच पड़ताल जेल में डाला जा सकता था।
हाल में शुरू हुए सत्याग्रह आंदोलन के तहत 6 अप्रैल को अमृतसर में  एक हड़ताल की गई जिसमे रॉलेक्ट एक्ट का कट्टर विरोध किया गया। लेकिन धीरे-धीरे यह आंदोलन हिंसक रूप ले चुका था। अमृतसर के बिगड़ते हालात पर काबू पाने के लिए भारतीय ब्रिटिश सरकार ने इस राज्य की कमान डिप्टी कमेटीर, मिल्स इरविंग से लेकर ब्रिगेडियर जनरल आर ई एच डायर को सौंप दी, और डायर ने हालात पर हिंसक रूप से काबू करने का निर्णय ले लिया। जनरल डायर नें अपने आने के साथ पंजाब में मार्शल लॉ लागू कर दिया जिसके तहत तीन से अधिक लोगों को इकट्ठे होने की इजाज़त नहीं थी अन्यथा उन्हें अंग्रेजी सैनिक गिरफ्तार कर ले जाते।
13 अप्रैल 1919 की सुबह जलियांवाला बाग में चल रहे शांतिपूर्ण बैशाखी मेले में  जनरल डायर अपने 150 फौजियों के साथ आये और बिना किसी चेतावनी के लोगों पर अंधाधुंध गोलियां बरसाने लगे। सारे रास्ते बंद कर उन लोगों पर अमानविक अत्याचार की सीमा लांघ दी। 10 मिनट के अंदर 1650 बार फायरिंग हुई, जिसकी वजह से उसी क्षण सैकड़ों लोग कुर्बान और हज़ारो की संख्या में घायल हुए।  
अंग्रेज़ो की इस कायरता पूर्ण हरकत की निंदा विश्व भर में हुई। गुरुदेव रवींद्रनाथ ठाकुर ने दुःख प्रकट करते हुए अपनी 'नाइटहुड' उपाधि त्याग दी। तदुपरांत हंटर कमेटी की रिपोर्ट में दोषी पाए जाने पर जनरल डायर को सेवानिवृत किया गया।
आवाज़, आई आई टी खड़गपुर जलियांवाला बाग हत्याकांड के शताब्दी दिवस पर उन शहीदो को नमन करते हुए श्रद्धांजलि अर्पित करता हैं । उन शहीदों की कुर्बानी आज भी हमें अहिंसा, न्याय और परिश्रम की राह पर चलते हुए इस देश को महान बनाने के लिए प्रेरित करती हैं।

कोमल बालक मरे यहाँ गोली खा कर,
कलियाँ उनके लिये गिराना थोड़ी ला कर।

आशाओं से भरे हृदय भी छिन्न हुए हैं,
अपने प्रिय परिवार देश से भिन्न हुए हैं।

कुछ कलियाँ अधखिली यहाँ इसलिए चढ़ाना,
कर के उनकी याद अश्रु के ओस बहाना।

तड़प तड़प कर वृद्ध मरे हैं गोली खा कर,
शुष्क पुष्प कुछ वहाँ गिरा देना तुम जा कर।

यह सब करना, किन्तु यहाँ मत शोर मचाना,
यह है शोक-स्थान बहुत धीरे से आना।

                                                           - सुभद्रा कुमारी चौहान

इतिहास सर्वदा से ही सामान्य नागरिक की रगों में, लेखकों की कृति में एवं वर्तमान के  वर्चस्व में बद्धमूल है। स्वतंत्रता-पूर्व भारत में एक ऐसी घटना - जिसने पूरे सभ्य समाज को मातम और शोक में भर दिया था; वह घटना जिसमें शहीद हुए लोगों की चीखें आज भी सभी देशवासियों के कानों में गूंजती है, और आने वाले समय में भी गूंजती रहेंगी - उसी दुर्भाग्यपूर्ण जलियांवाला बाग हत्याकांड की शताब्दी आज पूर्ण हुई।

हाल में शुरू हुए सत्याग्रह आंदोलन के तहत 6 अप्रैल को अमृतसर में  एक हड़ताल की गई जिसमे रॉलेक्ट एक्ट का कट्टर विरोध किया गया। लेकिन धीरे-धीरे यह आंदोलन हिंसक रूप ले चुका था। अमृतसर के बिगड़ते हालात पर काबू पाने के लिए भारतीय ब्रिटिश सरकार ने इस राज्य की कमान डिप्टी कमेटीर, मिल्स इरविंग से लेकर ब्रिगेडियर जनरल आर ई एच डायर को सौंप दी, और डायर ने हालात पर हिंसक रूप से काबू करने का निर्णय ले लिया। जनरल डायर नें अपने आने के साथ पंजाब में मार्शल लॉ लागू कर दिया जिसके तहत तीन से अधिक लोगों को इकट्ठे होने की इजाज़त नहीं थी अन्यथा उन्हें अंग्रेजी सैनिक गिरफ्तार कर ले जाते।
13 अप्रैल 1919 की सुबह जलियांवाला बाग में चल रहे शांतिपूर्ण बैशाखी मेले में  जनरल डायर अपने 150 फौजियों के साथ आये और बिना किसी चेतावनी के लोगों पर अंधाधुंध गोलियां बरसाने लगे। सारे रास्ते बंद कर उन लोगों पर अमानविक अत्याचार की सीमा लांघ दी। 10 मिनट के अंदर 1650 बार फायरिंग हुई, जिसकी वजह से उसी क्षण सैकड़ों लोग कुर्बान और हज़ारो की संख्या में घायल हुए।  
अंग्रेज़ो की इस कायरता पूर्ण हरकत की निंदा विश्व भर में हुई। गुरुदेव रवींद्रनाथ ठाकुर ने दुःख प्रकट करते हुए अपनी 'नाइटहुड' उपाधि त्याग दी। तदुपरांत हंटर कमेटी की रिपोर्ट में दोषी पाए जाने पर जनरल डायर को सेवानिवृत किया गया।
आवाज़, आई आई टी खड़गपुर जलियांवाला बाग हत्याकांड के शताब्दी दिवस पर उन शहीदो को नमन करते हुए श्रद्धांजलि अर्पित करता हैं । उन शहीदों की कुर्बानी आज भी हमें अहिंसा, न्याय और परिश्रम की राह पर चलते हुए इस देश को महान बनाने के लिए प्रेरित करती हैं।

कोमल बालक मरे यहाँ गोली खा कर,
कलियाँ उनके लिये गिराना थोड़ी ला कर।

आशाओं से भरे हृदय भी छिन्न हुए हैं,
अपने प्रिय परिवार देश से भिन्न हुए हैं।

कुछ कलियाँ अधखिली यहाँ इसलिए चढ़ाना,
कर के उनकी याद अश्रु के ओस बहाना।

तड़प तड़प कर वृद्ध मरे हैं गोली खा कर,
शुष्क पुष्प कुछ वहाँ गिरा देना तुम जा कर।

यह सब करना, किन्तु यहाँ मत शोर मचाना,
यह है शोक-स्थान बहुत धीरे से आना।

                                                           - सुभद्रा कुमारी चौहान

Accompanying the increased academic workload are the numerous fests and departmental or society related treats in the spring semester. These are the things that make Kharagpur life worth living, but it is important to take care of our health as well.

Two viruses have been identified as causing the chickens deaths which can lead to a chain of health issues in humans, though these do not include the highly contagious bird flu or avian influenza.

Some halls such as Rajendra Prasad Hall of Residence have begun to take preventive measures, such as removing chicken biryani from their mess timetable, and we urge all other halls to take similar measures.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges people to refrain from consuming poultry related delicacies in such treats or be very careful regarding the quality if consumed at all.

Source:
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/viruses-play-havoc-with-fowls-antibiotics-with-human-health/articleshow/68803235.cms

Accompanying the increased academic workload are the numerous fests and departmental or society related treats in the spring semester. These are the things that make Kharagpur life worth living, but it is important to take care of our health as well.
Bird Flu, caused by the H5N1 virus, has been killing poultry in southern Bengal and is expected to spread further as of now. The main reason for this is the antibiotic resistance the virus has now developed due to the former's excessive usage to further the livestock's mortality.
Some halls such as Rajendra Prasad Hall of Residence have begun to take preventive measures, such as removing chicken biryani from their mess timetable, and we urge all other halls to take similar measures.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges people to refrain from consuming poultry related delicacies in such treats or be very careful regarding the quality if consumed at all.

Source:
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/viruses-play-havoc-with-fowls-antibiotics-with-human-health/articleshow/68803235.cms

Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence celebrated Anton Pios day on April 10.
At first, this may seem like your regular grand dinner but it is much more than that. 
The actual story behind this day goes way back to 1990 when the mess workers of RK Hall were on an indefinite strike. The students had nothing to eat in the halls for quite some time until  Anton Pios, a senior student of the hall took matters into his own hands. He along with some other senior students of the Hall cooked food and fed everyone. The event proved once and for all that the KGP community will not be docile at any cost. The event showed everyone how capable the students are when the times are hard. The event became a hallmark of the culture of IIT KGP.

The gesture by Anton Pios truly had a deep impact and the borders of RK Hall have commemorated that event ever since by celebrating Anton Pios Day in the first half of  April every year since 1991. 
It is indeed a simple event in which seniors serve you food and 'way too many rasgullas for human capacity' but it has a much deeper aspect to it.
Events like this re-establish the sophisticated yet beautiful relationship between the seniors and juniors that have been ordained by generations of students over the decades. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur salutes Anton Pios for his contributions to the students and congratulates those who have helped in carrying on this legacy.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Harshit Nagar and 2 others.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Lawn Tennis
Finals | Results

As 4 teams participated in the competition, tennis Matches for Women's were conducted between these Halls of residence on a round-robin basis. MT hall bagged the Gold Medal by winning all 3 matches and was followed by Gokhale Hall which won 2 out of 3 matches to ensure a 2nd position finish. SN/IG hall grabbed the third position while SAM fought well but eventually ended up in fourth place in the competition.

Women's:
1. MT hall 
2. Gokhale hall 
3. SN/IG hall 
4. SAM hall

Men’s:-
1. MS Hall
2. MMM Hall
3. RP Hall
4. HJB Hall

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners.

P.C.- Manohar Manu

The Indian Institute of Technology(IIT), Kharagpur, was placed fifth in the national ranking of higher institutes released by the Ministry of Human Resources Development (HRD) on Monday. President Ram Nath Kovind declared the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF India Rankings 2019) on Monday at Plenary Hall, Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi. 

The NIRF rankings were released for a total of 9 categories - Overall, Universities, Engineering, Colleges, Management, Pharmacy, Medical, Architecture, and Law. In this year's NIRF rankings, IIT Madras was placed first, The Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore was placed second whereas IIT-Delhi and IIT Bombay were ranked third and fourth respectively. Of the top 10 institutes, seven are IITs. 

In NIRF 2018, IISC was ranked first, followed by IIT Madras, IIT Bombay, IIT Delhi, and IIT Kharagpur respectively. IIT Kharagpur remained at the fifth spot even though it improved its overall score from 71.39 to 74.31. In the engineering category, IIT Kharagpur was placed fourth with a score of 79.41, increasing its score from 77.78 from the previous year. The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law, IIT Kharagpur was also placed fourth in the national law institutions in India with a score of 69.81. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates KGP community for cementing its place in the top 5 elite institutions of India.

“Art is not what you see, but what others make you see.”
-Edgar Davis

Spectra, IIT Kharagpur organized Artbeat - the annual art exhibition. The theme this year was ‘Other Worlds’. 

The central art piece was an origami art of ‘The Thousand Cranes’. The idea was laid forward by Nastassja Rai, Head of Spectra, and is inspired by the enchanting Japanese folktale.
A thousand origami cranes hung with strings from the ceiling, forming a fantastic plethora of beauty. The ancient legend goes that anyone who folds a thousand cranes will be granted one single wish by the Gods.
Sadako Sasaki- A Japanese girl, who was exposed to radiation from the atomic bombing and was diagnosed with Leukemia, too strived to achieve this goal while bed-ridden. She could make fourteen hundred cranes before she passed away.

Another masterpiece, named 'The Big Picture', also a creation by Spectra, depicts a serenity in the midst of adventure and darkness. The idea was inspired by Abhishek Mhatre, Head of Spectra, in order to portray the chosen theme.

Various other artworks submitted by many members from within and outside Spectra were also displayed, treating us with a variety of beautiful artforms. Sketchbooks and canvasses of the members of Spectra were also displayed, which were filled some amazing artworks.

The team from Spectra was available to explain the significance of the various art pieces. Various origami pieces and tessellations, by Ketan Damle, Head of Spectra, were also on display, allowing the visitors to enjoy this age-old art of Japanese paper folding.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, congratulates Spectra, for their tremendous efforts and fabulous artworks and hope there are many more to come.

As the department change or Depc (in KGP's lingo) is around the corner with many of you confused about the relative preference order you should follow, here is something to bail you out of the trouble- the department change statistics for the previous academic session and the testimonials of some of the students who had successfully secured a department change. 

The change of branch is awarded to those applicants who have secured a rank within the top 1% (one percent), amongst all the first year students in terms of the CGPA scored at the end of the Second Semester without any constraint on the number of seats. The remaining applicants may be allowed a change of branch, though with the constraint that the branch to which the transfer is to be made does not exceed 110% of it's sanctioned yearly intake.

However, this must be kept in mind that the Cutoff CG for various departments vary a lot depending upon the average performance and the choices of those applying for a department change.
 
https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/department-change-statistics-2017-18-48376b3e022f?fbclid=IwAR0puGvKqYWYU621QseJRxpp5pnw5BNtGdflRnbtZtikA_Z-rMsYsehcxmo

https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/department-change-statistics-2017-18-48376b3e022f?fbclid=IwAR0puGvKqYWYU621QseJRxpp5pnw5BNtGdflRnbtZtikA_Z-rMsYsehcxmo

As the department change or Depc (in KGP's lingo) is around the corner with many of you confused about the relative preference order you should follow, here is something to bail you out of the trouble- the department change statistics for the previous academic session and the testimonials of some of the students who had successfully secured a department change. 

The change of branch is awarded to those applicants who have secured a rank within the top 1% (one percent), amongst all the first year students in terms of the CGPA scored at the end of the Second Semester without any constraint on the number of seats. The remaining applicants may be allowed a change of branch, though with the constraint that the branch to which the transfer is to be made does not exceed 110% of it's sanctioned yearly intake.

However, this must be kept in mind that the Cutoff CG for various departments vary a lot depending upon the average performance and the choices of those applying for a department change.

In yet another show of talent and supremacy, a team of 2 comprising Nikita Gautam and Ravi Sharma from IIT Kharagpur bagged the 1st Runners Up in the maiden, national level Engineering Campus event, Flipkart Grid.
Modeled on the lines of making machines smarter with AI/ML intervention, the competition saw a participation of more than 6000 students from premier institutes across India in the AI/ML challenge solving round for ‘Object Localization in Images’. 
The top 12 teams from across India then got a chance to present their innovation and solutions to the Data Sciences and Engineering Teams of Flipkart at its Bangalore Headquarter.
Team No-Mo from IIT Dhanbad were crowned the national champions taking home Rs 1,50,000 as cash prize while Team Dirty Bits from IIT Kharagpur were the National Runners Up bagging Rs 75000/- as prize money.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur extends its heartiest congratulations to the participants in anticipation of more such laurels in the days to come.

As an excellent initiative taken by Vishal Kumar Singh, Vice President and the Technology Students' Gymkhana, vending machines for sanitary napkins have been installed at various locations in the institute. These include Nalanda Complex (first floor), Vikramshila Complex (opposite V1), Gymkhana and Main Building (first floor). Not only this, incinerators have also been installed at these four places along with SN/IG hall for eco-friendly disposal of the same. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur applauds the initiative and looks forward to more of such initiatives in the future to make the campus more women inclusive.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the technology of the moment. And rightly so, as AI has started to sweep through industries and disrupt them. And it’s not stopping at the front gates of Universities and Colleges.

AI involves algorithms and data which improves over time, often known as machine learning. The benefits of this technology lie in pattern recognition, manipulating information and automating repeatable processes.  
Colleges and Universities clearly have lots of data and plenty of repeatable tasks. They also have customers with very high technology expectations - students.    Universities have started to adequately prepare students for a changing world by embedding AI into the education base which is definitely impacting careers.

IIT Kharagpur is no stranger into the scene as it takes help from its illustrious Alumni network to expand its Ai research capabilities.                                    

Pointing out that investment in AI would require a large sum and by approaching its billionaire alumni like Pichai, Gupta said that the institute can have the benefit of cutting-edge technologies like AI, “They need to scale it up much more than what they are doing now…. My suggestion was: they should go to Sundar Pichai because he is CEO of Google, he is a billionaire, he loves IIT, he is our alumni and they are the ones who are doing a lot of cutting-edge work in artificial intelligence.”

For the uninitiated, the institute has already been at the forefront to encompass Ai and another emerging tech into its academics and already has a dedicated Centre of Excellence (CoE) for AI. In addition to CoEs, the institute has also been accommodated AI and other emerging technology related course. Among the courses offered in the field of AI, the topics include financial analytics, industrial automation, digital healthcare, intelligent transportation system among others. Recently it signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Telangana government to set up its off-campus in the state.                            

Apart from that,  The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Rights (RGSOIPL) in IIT Kharagpur announced that it will offer a one-semester interdisciplinary course titled “Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Law”,  which aims to provoke a rethink on the modes of societal governance and law by AI capabilities.    

Coming to corporate partnerships, the Institute on March 28 announced that it will be collaborating with Indian IT giant, Wipro to bolster research in the field of AI and 5G technology. The joint partnership will see Wipro deploying the outcome of the research into their working, while IIT KGP is expected to benefit from the company’s high-end infrastructure and gain more research insight. “The two organizations will focus on AI research applicable in the healthcare, education and retail sectors as well as in domains such as climate change and cybersecurity. In addition, subject matter experts from Wipro and IIT Kharagpur will promote knowledge sharing through guest lectures, workshops, and seminars on 5G and AI,” Wipro said in a press release.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the Institute on its efforts and hopes it becomes a frontier of AI in the days to come.

https://www.analyticsindiamag.com/how-iit-kharagpur-is-strengthening-its-ai-research-with-the-help-of-its-illustrious-alumni-base/

As we all know that research scenario in our campus is getting better each and every day. Adding to the list, a team of researchers at the department of architecture and regional planning, IIT Kharagpur has come up with a dock-less public bicycle sharing system or PBS that could help even locals take on the might of multinational ride-sharing companies which run their own PBS.

The PBS devised at IIT Kharagpur uses a Bluetooth and GPS enabled electronic lock which could be fitted to a cycle. Another lock version using GPRS is also being tested. 

The research team is lead by Professor Debapritam Pandit of the architecture and regional planning department, he says "Anyone can start the system in a couple of hours with 25-30 bikes. A geo-fencing area has to be created to start operation. We have an administrative app for operators to create all this."

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates and congratulates Professor Debapritam Pandit and his team for their great step towards the betterment of Kharagpur community and wishes them for more future accomplishments.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/home/education/news/public-bicycle-sharing-system-devised-by-researchers-at-iit-kharagpur/articleshow/68664598.cms?fbclid=IwAR1V3BjzcgifLC2D0yA01HwnD4Q03d_Y4ft3r4LwA4FTMas14ZfM2tri-_w

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Lawn Tennis

Finals | Results

Gold medal match: MMM vs MS: MS won by 2-0

Singles: MS won 6-2, 6-0
Doubles: MS won 7-5, 6-4

MS started their quest for Gold by winning the first singles with relative ease. Prathamesh with his robust forehand and some impeccable court placement managed to defeat Nikhil 6-2 6-0 in the first rubber. With the momentum on their side, Prathamesh and Parush were looking to quickly finish off the business. However, Nikhil combined with Anshuman and gave them a tough fight. The doubles match was a closely contested encounter that was quite worthy of a final. Prathamesh was again in attacking mode, the favor was being returned by Anshuman with ballistic forehands. But in the end, it was MS who held their nerves on crucial points and sealed the victory with a scoreline of 7-5 6-4.

Bronze medal match: RP vs HJB: RP 1-1 HJB

Singles: Akhil (HJB) defeated Mihir (RP) 6-4,6-2
Doubles: Mihir and Satya Aditya (RP) defeated Akhil and Manish (HJB) 6-0,3-6,10-6
The reverse single was postponed due to bad weather.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the tennis teams for their consistent performance and wishes them best of luck for the future.

Prof Mrityunjoy Chakraborty, from the Department of E&ECE, IIT Kharagpur has been selected as an INAE Chair Professor by the Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE). He is also a fellow of National Academy of Sciences, India (NASI).
Dr. Chakraborty obtained his BE from Jadavpur University (1983), MTech from IIT Kanpur (1985) and Doctorate from IIT Delhi in 1994. He is serving in this institute since January 1995. 
His research interest lies in the area of Digital and Adaptive Signal Processing and VLSI Signal Processing.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Dr. Chakraborty for his achievement.

Gopali Youth Welfare Society celebrated 'Aashayein', the eleventh annual day of Jagriti Vidya Mandir which is a school run by the society that lighted the lives of 200 plus underprivileged children, on 30th March. The tiny tots of preschool put up a wonderful show on and enthralled their proud parents. In a colourful display of befitting costumes, they sang, danced, played and acted on stage. The well-coordinated events held the audience in awe as they relived their childhood, while the items unfolded onstage. 
Prof. Sriman Kumar Bhattacharya, Deputy Director graced the occasion as the chief guest and Prof. Sudhir Kumar Barai, Dean(UGS), IIT Kharagpur, Prof. H.R. Tiwari, Dean of Student Affairs, Mr. Dinen Roy, MLA Kharagpur and Mr. Mrinal Kanti Bhanja, Founder and President of Gopali Youth Welfare Society graced the function as guests of honour and praised the members of GYWS for their selfless work.

It's time for the decision! Do exercise your right and make an informed choice about who all you want to see as a representative of yours in the form of office bearers at Technology Students' Gymkhana. Have a say in what matters to YOU! Exercise YOUR Right! Cast YOUR Vote!
Have a look at this message from Gymkhana President Prof. William Mohanty where he appeals to the student community for the same.
Date - 30th March 2019 (Saturday)
Time - 9 AM-12:30 PM and 2 PM -5:30 PM
Venue - Technology Students' Gymkhana
Don't forget to bring your ID Cards.
#YourChoice_YourVote_YourVoice
#TSG_Elections2019

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Lawn Tennis

Semifinals | Results

Semifinal 2: MMM vs HJB: MMM won by 2-1

Singles: HJB won 6-3, 6-4 
Doubles: MMM won 6-2, 3-6, 10-5
Reverse Singles: MMM won 6-0, 6-0

MMM sailed into the finals of the inter-hall tennis championship after winning both doubles and reverse singles, though in distinct fashion as it came back from a 0-1 deficit to beat HJB by 2-1. Akhil won the first singles for HJB against Nikhil in straight sets to give his hall an upper hand before the most crucial doubles point. However, Nikhil combined with Anshuman to overcome Akhil and Manish Dutta in a tough encounter that witnessed the duo from MMM prevailing in a super tie-breaker. Anshuman, who was once again not able to serve properly in the reverse singles but had enough firepower in his groundstrokes to double bagel Manish and to guarantee at least a Silver for his team.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the MMM tennis contingent for their consistent performance and wishes them best of luck for the gold medal match.

The official Notice for Department Change for UG 2nd Years (currently First Year students) for the academic session 2019-20 has been released.
To apply for the same, the student must have a CGPA of not lower than 8.5 and no backlog subjects in semesters I & II, only EAA backlog can be waived only in case of serious medical reason, provided a hardcopy of medical certificate from BC Roy Technology Hospital is submitted.
Students are requested to submit their choices through ERP on or before 10th April (Wednesday) and submit a hardcopy generated through ERP to the Academic (UG) section.

As yet another event in the paradigm of Kgpians making the institute proud, The Debating Society of IIT Kharagpur's contingent overwhelmingly dominated NLUO British Parliamentary Debate Tournament, 2019.

With two cross teams, three seniors teams and three novice teams and 10 adjudicators, the debaters performed extremely well in the tournament.
Among the debaters, two out of three senior teams and two out of three novice teams broke into the knockout rounds' pre semifinals.
The novice teams being:
Tanay Raghavendra - Nesara R Swamy
Amay Varma - Aneeta James
The senior teams being:
Vignesh Vishwanathan - Suyash Ratna Tripathi
Aliya Jabbar - Gyan Darshan
The cross teams being:
Rohit Sar - Jalaj Panday (NUJS)
Rohan Khilnani - Vishal Chauhan (Kgp Alumnus)
The senior teams and the cross teams proceeded to the semifinals, with Rohit Sar's team and Aliya-Gyan team proceeding to the finals, where the senior team secured the fourth position and the Kgp-NUJS cross with Rohit Sar took the debate and won the tournament cup.
The titles of third best, two sixth bests and tenth best speakers were awarded to Rohan Khilnani, Rohit Sar, Vignesh Vishwanathan, and Suyash Ratna Tripathi.

Among the adjudicators, all ten in the contingent broke into the knockouts, with the titles of second through fifth best adjudicators being awarded to Partha Kadambi, Mirambika Sikdar, Saugandh Philkhana, and Pranav Krishnan respectively.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is extremely proud of the institute's debaters and extends them our heartiest congratulations.

Just when the potential candidates for the post of Vice President were gearing up, a sudden change in the rules for eligibility to contest upcoming elections shattered the ambitions and aspirations of two of them. The change in rules, having a substantial departure from the previous year’s rule, seemed tailor-made to suit vested interests as the changes made affected some particular candidates only. Since then, the accusations of foul play are in the air and speculations of the Vice President’s favoritism to a certain set of candidates have been rife. People have been questioning the timing and nature of changes in the rules. Awaaz, as a student media body, investigated into the issue. After making our best efforts to connect with the stakeholders involved, getting into the facts and turn of events, here are our findings, observations, and situational analysis. Here's the full read: https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/bending-the-election-rules-the-abuse-of-power-dd905cdba273?source=friends_link&sk=8d7bc3e2e5ef604402ced6ea0ccb878b

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball

Final: LBS vs NEHRU
LBS won the final match of the basketball tournament with the scoreline of 92-63.

The final score indeed shows how well LBS dominated the game. With a good start and some electrifying display of the game in the last few moments from LBS, helped them retain the Basketball trophy. Vikas (28 points) and Dipesh (27 points) took LBS to an easy win, well accompanied by Manoj(19 points) and its captain Deepak(12 points). Also, Captain of the basketball team of Nehru hall of residence, Hemant, scored 21 points but that could not be enough for his team to bag up the trophy. 
Throughout the Basketball GC, LBS anticipated in the game very well. Confident victories in the league matches helped them carry the same momentum into the finals to grab the trophy like a BOSS. 

Man Of The Match: Dipesh

Match for the Bronze medal: AZAD vs PATEL 
AZAD won the match by 49-42.

In the last match of the tournament, everyone got to witness a sensible game of basketball. In a close match, players of AZAD held on their nerves very well till the last seconds and grabbed the bronze medal in the tournament. Arpan from AZAD showcased a great game accompanied by the captain of the team, Philip. 

Final standings of the tournament are:
1.  LBS
2.  NEHRU
3.  AZAD
4.  PATEL

Highest scorer of the tournament: Vikas Yadav
Most three-pointer scorer:  Pushkar Agnihotri
Best feeder: Manoj Minny

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and wishes them great luck for upcoming matches of General Championship.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Anuj Pilania and 12 others.

Final standings of the tournament are:
1.  LBS
2.  NEHRU
3.  AZAD
4.  PATEL

Highest scorer of the tournament: Vikas Yadav
Most three-pointer scorer:  Pushkar Agnihotri
Best feeder: Manoj Minny

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and wishes them great luck for upcoming matches of General Championship.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Anuj Pilania and 12 others.

message:
General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball (M) 

Semi Final 1 || Results
Nehru won against Patel by a final scoreline of 44-40.

In a close contest that went right down to the final minutes of the last quarter, Nehru edged over Patel and booked their spots in finals. With a jam-packed basketball court and great support for both the teams, the score went either way for most of the match. In the final quarter, Nehru took the game away from Patel with a three-pointer and two more buckets. Hemant and Anurag were the leading scorers for Nehru, whereas Deven scored the most points for Patel. The semis were played with the 24-second rule which made the games even more exciting. 

Semi Final 2 || Results
LBS won against Azad by a margin of 94-60.

In a game where most of the Inter IIT basketball players were up on the court against each other, and a big crowd to support them, everyone expected a close contest. But it turned out to be a one-sided affair as LBS dominated the game right from the start. Unlike the last game of LBS where they were not able to score a single three-pointer, they were back to business as there were three-pointers flying all around from both teams. Vikas and Dipesh were the leading scorers for LBS whereas Jai and Philip scored heavily for Azad. The game saw many three-pointers, fast breaks and defensive overplays and beautiful drive-ins throughout the game and was a treat to watch. 

Nehru will play against LBS for the basketball GC gold whereas Azad will play Patel for the 3rd and 4th position. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the teams and wishes them for the upcoming two matches.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Lawn Tennis

Semifinals | Results

In the first Singles, Prathamesh Chavan of MS defeated Satya Aditya of RP with a convincing scoreline 6-3 6-1 in his favour. In the Doubles too, MS beat RP by 6-3 6-1. With this win, MS stormed into the Finals where it will meet the winner of 2nd semifinal which will be played today between MMM and HJB.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the MS tennis contingent for their consistent performance and wishes them best of luck for the gold medal match.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Lawn Tennis

Quarterfinals | Results

Quarterfinal 3: HJB vs Patel - HJB won by 2-0.

Akhil Andasu (HJB) defeated Siddharth Gandhi (Patel) in a three-setter game with a final scoreline of 3-6 6-0 6-3. Continuing its winning streak, HJB, with Manish Dutta - Akhil Andasu defeated Ankit Pardeshi - Siddharth in two straight sets 6-4 6-4 and made their way to semifinals.

Quarterfinal 4: RP vs VS - RP won by 2-1.
VS took lead after first singles with Ayush Shukla (VS) beating Mihir Kirloskar (RP) 6-4 6-1. But RP fought back in the Doubles and defeated VS leveling the score. Mihir - Satya Aditya Killada of RP beat Ayush and Yogesh Kumar of VS by 6-4 6-4. In the decider game, Satya Aditya of RP hall dominated the show by defeating Yogesh of VS by 6-1 6-2.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them best for Semifinals.

IMPORTANT NOTICE || MCM Scholarship

Accounts section has released the MCM scholarship to 174 out of 246 number of eligible students a long while ago. The Institute administration had taken several efforts with a request to the remaining 72 students to upload their SBI Account No./IFSC Code in their ERP profile so that accounts section may be able to prepare their scholarship bill immediately.

However, only 22 have complied to their requests and updated the same till date. This may create problems if so many part bill may be prepared against a particular order. They are ready to release the payment within 31st March 2019 but unable to process. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the concerned students to comply with the above and update their ERP profile.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Football
Finals || Results

Gold Medal Match: 
SN/IG clinched the Gold Medal by defeating SNV+VSRC in a penalty shootout. Despite efforts by both teams match ended in a tie with a score of 0-0. SN/IG won the penalty shootout by 4-1.

Bronze Medal Match: MT vs SAM+RLB 
MT bagged the Bronze Medal by defeating SAM+RLB with a final scoreline of 3-0. Shirin scored all three goals for MT.

Earlier in the Semifinals, 
SN/IG vs SAM+RLB: SN/IG won by 6-0.
MT vs SNV+VSRC:  SNV+VSRC won by 3-1.

Final standings
1. SN/IG
2. SNV+VSRC
3. MT
4. SAM+RLB

General Championship 2018-19 | Sports | Basketball | Women

Final Day | Results

Finale || Gokhale vs SN/IG
SN/IG registered a victory over Gokhale by the final scoreline of 51-31.

In a game where stakes were high and there was plenty to play for, SN/IG emerged victorious as they put on a clinical performance to outclass Gokhale by 51-31. Akshita from SN/IG hall was awarded player of the match as she balled her way to 21 points whereas Yukta from Gokhale was the leading scorer for her team. Gokhale settled for a well-deserved silver. 

Bronze medal match|| SAM vs MT
MT clinched bronze after defeating SAM by the final scoreline of 34-25.

In a close contest, MT overpowered SAM as they won bronze in GC basketball. 

Final standings :
Gold - SN/IG
Silver - Gokhale
Bronze - MT

Highest scorers. (Points scored) 
1. Yukti 82
2. Swati 72
3. Priyanka 59
4. Jyoti 58 

Best Defender: Taban
Player of the match in the final: Akshita Singh

Prof. William Mohanty, President,  TSG was the chief guest at the post-match presentation ceremony.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Chess

The chess tournament GC this year saw some brilliant games with extremely well thought out strategies. The competition was extremely fierce and all the players gave their very best to outwit their opponent. Every hall gave a tough fight to every other, but in the end, Azad hall contingent emerged victorious and lifted the GC Chess 2019 cup for their hall.
The results of the rounds 1,2,3,4 and 5 are as follows: 
Day 1 (9 March)

Round 1:

1)RP vs LBS1 - (3.5-0.5) - RP won
2)MMM vs Azad - (0.5-3.5) - Azad won
3)BRH vs LBS2 - (4-0) - BRH won
4)VS vs HJB - (0-4) - HJB won
5)MS vs  LLR(3-1) - MS won
6) Nehru vs RK (0-4) - Rk won
7) Patel - bye

Round 2:

1)HJB vs RP - (1.5-2.5) - Rp won
2)Azad vs MS - (3-1) - Azad won
3)Patel vs BRH-(2-2)- Draw
4)RK vs LBS1-(4-0) - Rk won
5)LLR vs MMM-(4-0)-LLR won
6)LBS2 vs VS-(3-1)- LBS2 won
7)Nehru - bye

Day 2(10 March)

Round 3:

1) RP vs RK - (2.5-1.5)- RP won
2) BRH vs Azad-(1-3) - Azad won
3) HJB vs Patel - (1.5-2.5)- Patel won
4)MS vs Nehru-(4-0)- MS won
5)LLR vs LBS2 - ( 4-0) - LLR won
6)LBS1 vs MMM-(2-2) - Draw
7)VS - bye

Round 4:

1)Azad vs RP -(2.5-1.5) -Azad won
2)Patel vs MS-(1.5-2.5) - MS won
3)RK vs LLR-(4-0)- Rk won
4)VS vs BRH-(0-4) - BRH won
5)Nehru vs HJB- (1-3) - HJB won
6)LBS2 VS LBS1-(1-3) - LBS 1 won
7)MMM - bye

Round 5:

1)RK vs Azad - (2.5-1.5) - RK won
2)RP vs MS - (2-2) - draw
3)BRH vs HJB -(2-2) - draw
4)LLR vs Patel-(0-4) - Patel won
5) LBS1 vs VS - (2-2) - draw 
6)MMM vs Nehru - (1-3) - Nehru won
7)LBS2 - Bye

The top three standings are as follows:
1. Azad Hall- 4.5/6
2. MS Hall- 4.5/6
3. RK Hall- 4/6

The positions for teams with the same points were decided using the tiebreakers. And to add spice to the tournament, RP Hall and Patel Hall also had the same points as that RK but tiebreaker declared RK as third.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams.

Finals 

LBS V/S RK
RK clinched gold in an epic game. LBS bagged a well-deserved silver after giving a tough fight to RK. 
 
The much-awaited clash between the two best teams of the campus lived up to its hype and everyone's expectations. It was as much a contest between the audiences as it was between the teams. LBS showed great hustle in defense, whereas RK was dominant in the attack. 

The scoreline stands : 
First set: 25-19, RK won the first set comfortably as it was in lead throughout the set.
Second set: 19-25, LBS won after a set which saw many twists and turns.
Third set: 26-24, The audience witnessed a truly phenomenal performance by both the teams but RK held their nerves to seal the deal.
Fourth set: 25-13, After a clinical performance in the last set, RK bagged the GC volleyball gold by a final scoreline of 3-1.

Bronze medal match 
RP Vs LLR
RP finished as second runners up bagging bronze as they defeated LLR after a great fight.
RP won the match by 25-18, 25-22, 22-25 and  25-13. RP clinched the first two sets easily after which a spirited comeback from LLR made the match interesting. But RP ran through LLR in the fourth set to bag bronze. 

Final standings
Gold- RK 
Silver- LBS
Bronze- RP

Stay tuned for standings of Women's volleyball competition.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams.

Gymkhana Elections are just a few weeks away and the KGP community is keeping social media abuzz with related content. The voters and their mindset play a major role in shaping up of the future of the institute, and the right mindset will be achieved if and only if everybody has the basic knowledge of the issues pertaining to the campus and the electoral process.

Common people don't get to share their viewpoints with the authority on those issues and this survey aims to reduce the gap and let the voices be heard. Here we present you the Pre-Election Survey constituting two parts, one about the electoral processes, and another about the campus-related issues. Your problems can only be solved if you state them. We are interested in learning your opinion through a few quick questions. So, give a minute or two to fill this form out, state your queries and suggestions and give yourself an opportunity to be a prominent part of the institute. Link to the form: https://goo.gl/forms/lJugDBXrAm30sMV03

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the student community to fill up the form before Wednesday [13/03/2019] midnight so that the survey report may be published early enough.

A contingent from Spats, IIT Kharagpur participated and triumphed in Technex 2019 - the annual Techno-Management Fest of IIT (BHU) Varanasi under the event subcategory "Supernova" comprising of Astro events.
The team consisted of Kshitij Anand, Himadri Saha, Jus Jaisinghani, Yashraj Motwani and Arnab Kundu which participated in three events and secured positions in each of them.

The Results are as follows-
1. AstroQuiz - 1st (with an astonishing margin of 37 points)
2. Exploring the Interstellar (Telescope based observational event) - Runner up 
3. Scientists of Utopia (Case Study event) - Runner up

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for their success and hope they'll bring more laurels for the Institute.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Volleyball 
Day 6 | Results 

Semi Final 2

LBS V/S LLR
LBS extended its winning streak with a 3-1 win over LLR. Both teams boasted of great support from the audience and the audience played a very crucial part in the match.

The scoreline stands : 
First game: 25-19, which was sealed comfortably by LBS.
Second game: 25-23, LBS won after a nail-biting match.
Third game: 19-25, LLR gave an exciting comeback.
Fourth game: LBS triumphed with a score of 25-16 to book a slot in the finals.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winner and wishes them great luck for the final.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Volleyball

Day 6|| Results

Semi Final 1

RK vs RP

A very awaited contest between the two stalwarts of KGP saw a good participation of crowd from the respective halls. RK stood out even after a tough fight from RP's end. RK won by 3-1.

The scoreline stands :

First game: 25-15, which was sealed comfortably by RK.

Second game:  28-26, won by RK keeping their nerves till the very end. 

Third game: 19-25, RP came back strongly in this game to save the match.

Fourth game: 25-15, RK finished RP's run in the Volleyball General Championship with this game. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes the best luck for the upcoming matches.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || 
Hockey || Final

LBS vs MS

LBS won the match with a score of 6-0
LBS dominated the match throughout. Although the team started slow but quickly picked up the pace, defending the opponent's goals tactically scored 3 goals in each half and took home the victory flag.

Bronze medal match - Patel vs Azad
Patel won the match with a healthy lead of 3-0 and thus bagged the bronze medal in the competition. 
Final standings in hockey were as follows:
1. LBS
2. MS
3. Patel
4. Azad
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates the winning teams.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Pulkit Kumar and Amardeep Kumar.

Employability of engineers in our country has been a major concern in recent times. Time and again, there have been attempts to tackle this issue but the problem still persists.

Here we present, opinions of two of our alumni, Dr. Ranajay Ghosh (Assistant Professor, University of Central Florida) and Dr. Aloke Kumar (Assistant Professor, IISc. Bengaluru) on the same topic. They have also suggested ways to improve situations and produce quality engineers! The link to the article: https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/96476354531f

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || 
Hockey || Semi-finals 

MATCH 1: MS vs PATEL
MS defeated Patel by 2-1
Himanshu Sharma of Patel got the scorer going first, giving a lead to Patel by 1-0. But MS came back strongly. Rishi Raj Vishal scored both the goals for MS. He scored the decider winning goal in the last quarter and guided his team into the finals.

MATCH 2: LBS vs Azad
 The scoreline remained 2-2 till full time and the match later saw the penalty round. LBS held their nerves to win 3-2 in penalty round. For LBS both goals were scored by Ashish Joshi guiding his team to keep in the game and then winning it through.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams and wish them for the best in the finals.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Narendra Mall and 3 others.

| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports & Games | Tennis |
Quarterfinal 2
MMM vs Azad
Singles: Azad won 6-1, 6-1 
Doubles: MMM won 7-5, 6-2
Reverse Singles: MMM won 6-4, 6-1
Arpan from Azad gave the lead to his hall with a victory over Nikhil of MMM hall. Later on, however,  Nikhil and Anshuman of MMM put up a tenacious fight against Azad, represented by Arpan and Aman, and emerged as the winner in doubles. The odds favoured MMM during the reverse singles, and despite the fact that Anshuman was suffering from a shoulder injury and wasn’t able to serve properly, he ousted Nishant in straight sets and ended victorious making MMM 2nd team to reach the semifinals.

message:
"To be a woman is to be unapologetically resilient despite everything."
-Anonymous
She comprises half of the world's population. She creates life inside her, beating against all the physical and mental toll on her health. She sacrifices so much for her family's well being. She constantly strives for what she deserves and to gain an identity. Yet, she faces so many difficulties in her life. As a girl, she faces restrictions which the boys don't. As a lady, she has lesser rights for being what she is - a woman. On the 8th of March every year, we celebrate her struggles and her womanhood. We celebrate our struggle to liberate her from the hackles that bind her and return her identity- she, who is a daughter, a sister, a wife, a mother, and above all a human being.
This Women's Day, let's join our hands together in celebrating a woman's life. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes you a very happy Women's Day.

| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports and Games | Tennis |
Quarterfinal 1 
MS vs LBS: MS won 2-1
Singles: LBS won 6-1, 6-2.
Doubles: MS won 7-5, 6-1.
Rev. Singles: MS won 8-0.
LBS had a great start with Krishna Chaithra defeating Duttatreya Das with a scoreline 6-1, 6-2. Retaliating back, in the Doubles Prathamesh Chavan - Parush Patel of MS overpowered Krishna Chaithra - Debjyoti Kar of LBS by 7-5, 6-1. In the third decider match, Parush Patel of MS dominated the show with a score of 8-0, against Ekansh Jain of LBS. With this win, MS became the first team to reach the Semi-final stage.

As the institute is in the moment of grief due to the loss of our students recently, most halls have come forward to celebrate Hall Days without DJ, lighting, decorations etc. and the amount saved shall be used for a noble cause in the near future. The Grand Finale of Smart India Hackathon (SIH) 2019, Software edition was hosted by Ministry of Human Resource Management (MHRM), Government of India and IIT Kharagpur on 2nd-3rd March. Teams working in IIT Kharagpur Centre presented work on dyslexia and augmented reality for science learning. Our Prime Minister Narendra Modi interacted live with the participants and for the most part, gave insightful comments and generous suggestions upon the excellent ideas presented by the students.

Teams from IIT Kharagpur displayed a splendid performance in Smart India Hackathon 2019 with three student teams bagging top prizes. 

They include:
Team Cybor (Leader: Rohit Jain ), at Rajpura, Punjab
Team Phi Beta Kappa (Leader: Lakshay Bansal), at Nagpur
Team Fight Forge (Leader: T.Y.S.S.Santosh), at Hyderabad

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates the winners and also to all participating teams in the software edition of Smart India Hackathon, 2019.

IIT Kharagpur's sports contingents have always been one of the finest, and their unstoppable saga of bringing glory to our institute continues in IIT Roorkee's Sangram 2019 as well.
The badminton contingent performed extremely well, with the Men's team dominating the tournament and securing the first position for IIT Kharagpur in the Men's Badminton final standings, through a thrashing 3-1 victory against IIT (ISM) Dhanbad. The best player of the tournament was Devanuj Deka from our contingent. The women's team displayed an excellent performance as well, securing the fourth position overall in the final Women's Badminton standings.
The athletics contingent showcased an amazing display of skill as well, bagging a total of seven gold, five silver, and seven bronze medals throughout the tournament. The women's team were overall second runner up in the final standings, securing the third position and the men's team lifted the overall championship, securing the first position overall in the final standings. The best athlete award went to Shivam Singh from the IIT Kharagpur contingent.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both contingents for their excellent performance.
P.C: Athletics IIT KGP

IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club has once again brought laurels to the institute, the Inter-IIT and Nihilanth champions have once again proved their mettle as the team of Piyush Kedia, Rupam Kumar Dubey and Girish Suranje bagged the runners up prize among 100+ teams in the Patna circle regionals of the SBI Numero YONO Quiz 2019 held on 1st March in a nail-biting finale. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team and wishes them luck in all their future endeavors.

MS secured its second victory by 1-0, thus qualified for the semifinals.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Hockey

Day 2| Results

Match 1: Patel vs VS

The first match proved to be the most nail biting one. Both sides were unable to score in the stipulated time and the match stretched to 8 second decider where patel managed to win 3-0.

Match 2: Azad vs RK

Azad played in their well known agressive style receiving two yellow and green cards. RK took the lead in the 35th minute but Azad levelled the score in the 41st minute with Himanshu Dang scoring through penalty.

Match 3: MMM Vs RP

Both the teams started well with MMM scoring two goals and RP one in 1st quarter itself. The score levelled to 2-2 at the end of 2nd quarter. But then, MMM managed to gain the victory with a lead of 3-2 in the other half of play.

Match 4: NH Vs BRH
Both the teams put up a good fight but couldn't score a goal. The match ended with 0-0 on the scoreboard. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winning teams and wishes best luck for the upcoming matches.

Day 1 -

1st match: 
LBS vs BRH: 
LBS won with a huge margin of 5-0.

2nd Match: 
VS vs HJB
VS won the match as HJB is no longer participating in the tournament due to some issues.

3rd Match: 
Azad vs LLR:

MS vs MMM:
MS finished the play with a lead of 1-0 against MMM.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winning teams.

Due to a very unfortunate incident in the early hours of today morning, the campus received the shocking news of demise of two students, Harshit Chahal and Abhinav Attri of Azad Hall in a road accident outside campus. Another student, Bhawani Singh Charan of MS Hall is seriously injured and is being treated in a critical condition in Kolkata. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur extends its deepest condolences to the family and friends and pray for the peaceful repose of departed souls. We pray dearly for the early recovery of our injured friend. The entire KGP Community stands together with their family in this moment of grief.

Phew...so the mid-sems are over with a storm. The temperatures that rose gradually through the examination days have been brought down by the relieving heavy downpours in the end. 

Well, mid-sems aren’t the only cause of heat, probably end-sems too! Actually, the ‘Load’ has not only and everything to do with examinations. The myth that ‘load’ exists only during the exams needs to be busted. Heaviness can come at any point in time and does not always have a major reason. But being vocal and interactive with your friends is the key to feeling better.

Keeping this in mind, this academic session a number of halls have organized cultural events to increasingly socialize the students. The most recent one was Aavhan – The Cultural Night of RP Hall. The event conducted just a week before the midsems, witnessed wide participation and excitement between students across halls. It had poetry, stand-up, singing along with various other cultural events. There were a series of other events leading into the cultural night like Intra-Hall Foosball and Career Assessment Workshops. 
On similar lines, BRH had also organized The Jam Utsav for greater bonding and community building amongst the most vibrant community of boarders which includes undergrads, postgrads and research scholars. LBS Hall organized the Shastrian week in autumn that had Golgappa Eating competition, Open-mic, and various other cultural events along with Internship Fundae session, to increase connections between the huge population of fresher boarding the hall.  Not far behind, LLR Hall also organized Inter-Hall painting and Golgappa Eating competitions.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur lauds the steps taken by various halls to enhance interaction and promoting better socializing amongst the students.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos — with Shivam Verma and Bhavishya Singh.

message:
Report | Mess Survey 2018

Why do mess services in various halls of residences remain consistent as one of the controversial issues pertaining to the campus for years? What are FMC and MMC? How does the quality of food differ in various halls of residences given every student pays the same mess fee? Is mess duty just a responsibility or a necessity? What power does a student with a mess duty have?

To answer all these questions, we bring to you a detailed report of the responses, the problems faced by the student community and the authorities, the reason we lag behind the other similar institutions and the possible solutions we can look for.

https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/mess-is-it-a-mess-49e6b86a0449

Dr. Koppillil Radhakrishnan, former Chairman of ISRO and a doctorate from IIT Kharagpur - one of the prime drivers behind the Mars (Mangalyan) & Chandrayan-1 missions, has been nominated as the chairperson of the Board of Governors (BoG), IIT Kanpur by the President of India.
Dr. Radhakrishnan is an Honorary Advisor to the Department of Space at present. In 2018, the Indian Government nominated him to provide consultancy and advise the UAE Space Agency at a special meeting.

A doctorate from the IIT Kharagpur in 2000, Radhakrishnan delivered the 46th Convocation address as Chief Guest at the IIT Kanpur in 2014. His career in the ISRO spanned 40 years, during which he served as Director of the National Remote Sensing Centre, founder director of the INCOIS, both in Hyderabad. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Dr. Radhakrishnan and wishes him all the very best for his tenure ahead.

Professor Sirshendu De from the Department of Chemical Engineering has been selected for National Societal Innovation Award–2018 awarded by the National Research Development Corporation (NRDC) for his invention “Low-Cost Arsenic Removal Filter for Drinking Water”.

Arsenic contamination of groundwater has been an issue of grave concern for at least 10 states in India. Being a carcinogen, long term exposure to arsenic in drinking water and food can lead to cancer and other diseases. The filter developed by Professor De is based on a mechanism that is already present in nature. Laterite soil acts as a natural filter for arsenic. A chemically treated variety of the soil was used to improve the ability of soil to adsorb arsenic. Moreover, the filter was made low cost and needs minimal maintenance.

It is indigenous inventions like these which hold the potential of creating impact in the lives of a large number of people. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Professor De on this achievement.

A candle march was organised by Samvaad to pay humble tribute to the braveheart CRPF Jawaans who were martyred in the Pulwama terrorist attack yesterday.
Many people from KGP community gathered for the march, which started at 6.30 pm from Gymkhana, and the march passed through Scholars' Avenue, Bidhan Chakkar (in front of Main Building), Gate 5, Tikka more, Nalini Sarkar Avenue and then back to Gymkhana.
People paid homage to the soldiers with their lighted candles and shared their deepest condolences to the families of the martyred Jawans.

message: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's album. A sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from Magic - Arthur C.Clark IIT Kharagpur is a premier technology institute of India which is widely known for its research culture. We bring out the Tech Tribune 2019 to update the students of our Institute on the same clause. It contains the technologies developed or progressed during the year 2018. The newsletter contains a detailed analysis of the Patents filed in the year 2018 along with six identified student inventors. It also contains articles from Mr. Manish Ayushman of Chemical Engineering and from Professor M.M. General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball

Day 7 | Results

Match 1 || LLR vs MS
MS registered a victory in a one-sided match with the final scoreline of 42-23.
Karan from LLR scored 18 points and was the highest scorer of the match. Mohit was the highest scorer for MS with 15 points and the second highest scorer of the match. Other players Kartikey, Kunal, and Pranay jointly scored 26 points for MS.

Day 9 | Results

Match 1 || Patel vs VS 
Patel won the match with the final scoreline of 57-40. 
Deven and Aakash Yadav from Patel scored 32 points and 14 points respectively. Adithya of VS also scored 18 points which included four 3-pointers but failed to take his team to victory.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

message:
जब देश में थी दीवाली,
वो खेल रहे थे होली।
जब हम बैठे थे घरों में,
वो झेल रहे थे गोली।
ऐ मेरे वतन के लोगों ज़रा आंखों में भर लो पानी,
जो शहीद हुए हैं उनकी ज़रा याद करो कुर्बानी।

While the world is complacent in the arms of love, there occurred a horrifying tragedy filled with hatred that shook the entire nation this evening. An army truck was attacked in the Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir by the terrorists of 'Jaish-e-Muhamad’ killing more than 43 of the CRPF personnel on the truck. The terrorist, identified by the officials as 'Adil Ahmad Dar’, dashed a car laden with explosives into one of the 78 trucks of the CRPF convoy on the J&K highway at Avantipora, 20km off the city of Srinagar.
What world, we need to ask, do some fancy with this state of war? What world, do they fancy, laden with the blood of innocent lives? 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur stands in solidarity with the armed forces in countering terrorism with all the might and with the families of the martyrs who laid their lives for their service to our motherland.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball

Day 7 | Results

Azad vs RP

Azad registered an easy win against RP with the final scoreline of 96-59. Both teams boasted of great support from the audience and the audience played a very crucial part in the match. Jai Singh Chandrawat was the leading scorer for the Azad with a total of 33 points with 3  three-pointers. Philip Jacob and Arpan Pallar showcased a great game and jointly scored 33 points for Azad. Pushkar once again led the points tally for RP with 28 points including a total of 5 three-pointers and was the second highest scorer of the match. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

Day  8 | Results

Match 3 | Patel Vs RK
Patel won the match against RK by the final scoreline of 35-33.

The match turned out to be the most interesting match of the league matches. Both teams boasted of great support from the audience and the audience played a very crucial part in the match. With less than 4 minutes remaining in the match and down by 9 points, RK showed great clutch performance as they took the game to 33-33 with half a minute remaining. And then a shot from Deven ended the match in a heartbreaking but hard-fought loss for RK. Deven dominated the game as he scored the most points for Patel whereas Apar scored the maximum points for RK. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

message:
| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports & Games | Badminton |

Final:

Azad defeated LLR by 2-1

1st Singles: Piyush (Azad) defeated Sandeep (LLR) 21-8, 21-3
Doubles: Akhilesh Gundu - Abhishek Velugu (LLR) defeated Devanuj Deka - Jay (Azad) 21-18, 21-18
2nd Singles: Devanuj (Azad) defeated Akhilesh (LLR) 18-21, 21-11, 21-17

Bronze match Result:

RP defeated MMM-2 by 2-0

1st Singles: Rohit Rao (RP) defeated Ketan Bapat (MMM-2) 21-10, 21-9
Doubles: Rohit - Ashutosh Kumar Verma (RP) defeated George- Sumit (MMM-2) 21-15, 21-17

Final standings:
1. Azad
2. LLR
3. RP
4. MMM-2 

The last match of Badminton GC 2019 saw a nail-biting game worthy of being the decider of the gold medal, with excellent gameplay and skillful rallies from both sides.
The first singles match was won by Azad where Piyush defeated Sandeep with relative ease, clinching the singles' for Azad with two under ten straight-set victories.
The doubles made the game infinitely more interesting with LLR making a comeback and giving a tough fight to Azad's duo and winning, shifting the tide of probability towards neutrality.
The first set of the second singles being won by LLR's Akhilesh made it look like that's where the title was headed, but Devanuj made a comeback in the second set and won the remaining sets, defeating Akhilesh and in turn, LLR, bagging Azad the gold medal.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Azad Badminton contingent for their much deserved gold medal in the Badminton GC 2019.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos — with Devanuj Deka and 4 others.

message:
General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball

Day 7 | Results

Match 1 | Nehru vs MMM 
Nehru won the match against MMM in a close contest by 48-40.

The match turned out to be one of the most interesting ones until now. The audience played as much a part as the players and was totally into it. It was truly a one-man show from Nehru as Hemanth single-handedly carried his team to victory. Hemanth was the leading scorer for Nehru whereas Dharmendra scored the most points for MMM. 

Match 2 | RP vs JCB 
RP won the match against  JCB comfortably by a margin of 82-34.

In yet another one-sided match RP balled their way to a dominating win over JCB. RP started strong and was in the driver’s seat throughout the match. At half time the score was 41-14 and the status quo was maintained thereafter. Pushkar led the points tally for RP whereas Abhay and Vaibhav scored most of the points for JCB.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Football

FINALS | Results

Azad v/s RP

Azad bagged the trophy by defeating RP with a scoreline of 1-0 in the night of the final.

The thrilling finals of Football GC had enough intensity to catch the attention of spectators till the last second. Both the teams played a magnificent game and the first half went goalless. In early minutes of the second half, Azad was lucky to get a penalty shot which was successfully converted by the reliable captain of winning team, Rishab Raja. Throughout the match, RP created chances but the exquisite goalkeeping skills from Devendra Patidar were too much for them to get through. 

The award for best defender went to Ritesh Mandal from MS whereas the Man of the match and Man of the tournament trophies were collected by the goalkeeper of Azad, Devendra Patidar.

Summary: 
1st: Azad
2nd: RP
3rd: MS

Best Defender: Ritesh Mandal (MS)
Man of the tournament: Devendra Patidar (Azad)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and players.

message:
Another moment of pride for all KGPians as Professor Subhasis Chaudhuri from the Department of Electrical Engineering, IIT Bombay and a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur has been appointed as the next Director of IIT Bombay. He will succeed the current Director, Professor Devang Vipin Khakhar.

Professor Chaudhuri completed his B.Tech. in Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering from IIT Kharagpur in 1985 and went on to complete his M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from the University of Calgary. He did his Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from the University of California, San Diego in 1990. Professor Chaudhari has been honored with the Distinguished Alumnus Award of IIT Kharagpur in the year 2017 and the prestigious Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize in Engineering Sciences in the year 2004, among several other honors to his name.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him and wishes him all the very best for his tenure ahead. We hope that IIT Bombay will continue to achieve greater heights under his leadership.

| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports & Games | Badminton |

Finals Result:

GKH defeated MT by 2-0

1st Singles: Nivedita (GKH) defeated Monash (MT) 22-20, 21-12
Doubles: Nivedita - Gauri (GKH) defeated Monash - Prashanti(MT) 22-20, 21-19

Bronze medal:

SAM vs SNV - SNV won by 2-0
1st Singles: Gurmeet(SNV) defeated Surbhi(SAM) 21-2, 21-7
Doubles: Gurmeet - Khushbu (SNV) defeated Sindhu - Surbhi (SAM) 21-6, 21-2

Final standings:
1.GKH
2.MT
3.SNV
4.SAM

The finals saw a nail-biting match with GKH Badminton team clinching a double straight-set victory by a close margin.
The singles' was a close fought match with the first set settling on a deuce, but Nivedita increased the margin in the second set, handing GKH the singles' in straight sets.
The doubles' was a closely contested match as well, which saw a brilliant performance from both sides. Both sets were closely fought for but ultimately won by Nivedita and Gauri.
A spectacular show of skill from GKH Badminton team has deservedly bagged them the Badminton GC 2019 gold medal.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates the whole GKH Badminton contingent for their spectacular performance throughout the event.

| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports & Games | Badminton |
Semifinal Result:

Semifinal 2: Azad defeated RP by 2-0

1st Singles: Devanuj (Azad) defeated Rohit (RP) 21-15, 21-16
Doubles: Devanuj - Piyush (Azad) defeated Rohit - Ashutosh (RP) 19-21, 21-15, 21-18

First singles' of this match was greeted by extending rallies and a spectacular performance from both sides. Both players fought tooth and nail but Devanuj emerged the victor, handing the first singles' to Azad by a straight set.
Azad lost the first set of doubles' by a close margin, but managed to turn the tide to their favor, winning the next two sets and hence the doubles' as well.
Winning this nail biter of a match has secured Azad a place in the finals, where they will be going up against LLR team, in the Badminton GC 2019 finals, to compete for the gold.

Semifinal Result:

The doubles proved to be more exciting with a brilliant performance from both sides, but Nivedita - Gauri emerged the victor in a straight set, winning themselves the doubles.
This victory has taken GKH to the finals where they compete against MT Badminton team for the Badminton GC 2019 gold.

| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports & Games | Badminton |
Quarterfinal Result:

Quarterfinal 2 ( B1 VS D2 ): Azad defeated RK by 2-0
Singles: Devanuj (Azad) defeated Shubham (RK) 21-1,21-9
Doubles: Devanuj and Piyush of Azad defeated Sumit and Chaitanya of RK 21-15,21-14

The second quarterfinal witnessed huge crowd support from both the sides, backing their team with full energy and enthusiasm. The atmosphere at the court was a sight to watch. Devanuj of Azad outplayed Shubham of RK in the singles match, winning by quite a large margin. Sumit and Chaitanya of RK did display some great game-play during the doubles, but they couldn't turn the game in their favor. The Devanuj-Piyush duo executed their plan well, held their nerves during the match and got their team through. Azad will now face RP in the semifinals, which have previously defeated VSRC in their quarterfinal match. Winner of this match will face LLR in the finals.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winner and wishes them luck for their upcoming matches.

Quarterfinal Result:

Quarterfinal 1 ( A1 VS C2 ): LLR defeated JCB by 2-0

Singles:  Akhilesh (LLR) defeated Sidhu (JCB) 21-5, 21-5
Doubles: Akhilesh Gundu and Abhishek Velugu (LLR) defeated Sidhu and Goutham (JCB) 21-6, 21-7

LLR dominated from the beginning, with Akhilesh registering an easy win over Sidhu in singles. Sidhu and Goutham had no answers for the duo of Akhilesh and Abhishek in the doubles game, as they went on to clinch an easy win and sealed the match and the semifinal slot for LLR. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them best of luck for the semifinals.

| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports & Games | Badminton |
Quarterfinal Result:

Quarterfinal 3 ( C1 VS A2 ): RP defeated VSRC by 2-0
Singles: Prerit(RP) defeated Devi Prasad(VSRC) 21-10, 21-7
Doubles: Ashutosh - Rohit Rao(RP) defeated Dibya and Rahul (VSRC) 21-8, 21-16

The match went roughly as was expected, with RP's team dominating the court for the most amount of time. Prerit sailed through the singles' and won in straight set, defeating Devi Prasad.
The doubles proved to be more of a competition, with Dibya and Rahul giving a tough fight in the second set after being beaten in the first, but were defeated, with Ashutosh and Rohit winning the doubles' in the straight sets as well.
The RP Badminton team hence secured a victory and a place for RP Hall in the semifinals, where they will be up against whichever team emerges victorious in the quarterfinals' match between RK and Azad.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them best of luck for the semifinals.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Rohit Rao and 2 others.

| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports & Games | Badminton |
Quarterfinal Result:

Quarterfinal 4 ( D1 VS B2 ): MMM-2 defeated LBS-1 by 2-1
Singles: Sayantan Sarkar (LBS-1) defeated Ravi Bhaskar (MMM-2) 21-11,21-5
Doubles: George J Mathew and Sumit Kumar defeated Sayantan and Pranay 21-17, 21-17
2nd singles: Ketan Bapat defeated Jashvant Neela 16-21,21-18,21-12

Sayantan lived up to expectations in his first singles as he gave LBS a 1-0 lead without much trouble but failed to deliver in doubles as he and Pranay lost to George and Sumit in straight sets. The third and the decider was played between Ketan and Jashvant where Ketan made a remarkable comeback after losing the first set. He won the second set by maintaining a slender lead but sailed through the last set and took MMM-2 to the semis.
MMM-2 will now meet LLR in the semis today in a repeat of the last year's final when LLR had emerged victorious even after Ketan had grabbed First singles.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them best of luck for the semifinals.
