General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Football

Semi-finals | Match 2 | Results

RP v/s MS

RP defeated MS by 2-0 to make their way into the finals. They would now be playing Azad in the finals of the Football GC on February 11.

In the second semi-final match, RP displayed an extremely well game throughout the match. They played an attacking game right from the start of the match. In the first half, Gauraang Kothari provided his team a lead of 1-0. Again, in the second half of the match, Apoorve Singhal scored a goal to consolidate the lead to 2-0. Although MS showed some intensity in the last few minutes of the second half it wasn't good enough to get them back into the game. Avakash Kumar Sahoo, the captain of winning team said that the team had played confidently and they would carry forward this momentum into the finals too.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them great luck for the upcoming match
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Apoorve Singhal.

Day 6 results:

Pool B: MS 1-2 Patel
Singles: MS 8-1 Patel 
Doubles: MS 6-8 Patel
Reverse Singles: MS 4-8 Patel
Parush Patel earned MS their first win by a final score of 8-1 during singles, against Ankit Pardeshi of Patel hall. However later on Patel, Siddharth along with Ankit Pardeshi, gave MS, Duttatreya and Parush Patel, a tough fight and emerged as winners in doubles. Siddharth Gandhi then won the reverse singles against Duttatreya Das with a score of 8-4 to finish the match in favour of Patel.

Pool D: RK 0-2 HJB
Singles: RK 1-8 HJB
Doubles: RK 1-8 HJB
Akhil Andasu, BRH, brushed aside his opponent Shaurya Shrivastava who was playing from RK in the first singles. In the doubles match, RK, Shaurya along with Shailesh Mishra, competed but yet again lost to HJB as Akhil and Manish Dutta won easily and closed out the match.

Pool C: MMM 2-0 BRH
Singles: MMM 8-1 BRH 
Doubles: MMM 8-1 BRH
Naseeb of BRH lost easily to Anshuman who was playing from MMM. During doubles, Anshuman along with Nikhil again sailed MMM towards victory with a final score of 8-1 against Naseeb and Abhid.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball

Day 6 | Results

Match 2 | RK vs VS 
RK won the match against VS by the final scoreline of 40-26.
The match started on a rather interesting note as both teams struggled at the start to convert. The score after half time was 18-13 in favor of RK. But in the third quarter, RK found form as they balled their way to a 20-0 run to reach 38-13 and ended the game at 40-26. Sadgun was the leading scorer for VS followed by Dhanraj and Aditya. Apar scored the most points for RK with significant contributions from Shubham, Rohit and Pankaj. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Football

Semi-finals | Match 1 | Results

Azad v/s LBS 

Azad won in the penalty shootout by 3-2 to grab a spot in the finals.

In the electrifying contest of today's evening, both the teams played extremely well. The match went goalless in both the halves. As a result, the game was extended to extra time but no team could manage to score a goal. Consequently, spectators got to witness a thrilling penalty shootout where Azad held their nerve, specifically their goalkeeper Devendra Patidar who saved 3 out of 5 shots.
 
Earlier in the first half of the match, Azad played an attacking game, led by KhakChang Debbarma. In the second half, LBS started off with attacking intent but was not able to penetrate through the opposition's defence. The winning captain Rishab Raja seemed to be quite confident of his team and praised everyone's efforts.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them good luck for the upcoming match.

Day 6 | Results

Match 1 | LBS vs MS 
LBS registered an easy win against MS with the final scoreline of 115-43.
The entire LBS team performed up to the expectations of the audience that they created in their last match against LLR. Vikas Yadav was the leading scorer of the match with a total of 30 points including 4 three-pointers. Second among the leading scorers was Dipesh Madan with 29 points including a total of 5 three-pointers. Deepak Foujdar and Manoj Minny contributed a total of 31 points with 16 and 15 points respectively. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball

Day 6 | Results

Match 1 | Gokhale vs MT
Gokhale won the match with the final scoreline of 30-15. 
Yukti Richharia from Gokhale played extremely well and ended up being the highest scorer of the match. Yukti scored two-thirds of the total points for her team including a 3 pointer. MT played with the threshold number of players and this weak bench strength in numbers might have been a major reason of this defeat.

Match 2 | SNV vs SN/IG
SN/IG won the match with the final scoreline of 48-16.
The entire SN/IG team displayed a great game. The trio consisting of Anjali Singh, Swati Rawat and Radhika Gupta totally crushed the opponents scoring 42 points which is a major chunk. The remaining 6 points were scored by Taban Salam. In this match too, the bench strength of the losing team was just threshold.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

| Results | General Championship 2018-19 | Sports & Games | Tennis |
Day 5 results:

VS defeated Azad by 2-0
Pool A: VS 2-0 Azad
Singles: VS 8-7 Azad
Doubles: VS 8-4 Azad
Ayush Shukla eventually came out on top against Arpan Pallar in a tightly contested match that saw several shifts in momentum. At one stage, Ayush was leading 5-2 although lost the next five games to trail 5-7. Then he won the next two games as well as the tiebreaker to hand VS a 1-0 lead. Ayush and Yogesh Kumar then defeated Arpan and Aman 8-4 in the doubles to seal the match for VS.

MS defeated LLR by 2-0
Pool B: MS 2-0 LLR
Singles: MS 8-5 LLR
Doubles: MS 8-0 LLR
Parush Patel defeated Shashank Jaipuria 8-5 in the singles and then later combined with Duttatreya Das to complete a 2-0 win for MS as the LLR pair of Shashank and Manish failed to win a single game.

Ayush Shukla eventually came out on top against Arpan Pallar in a tightly contested match that saw several shifts in momentum. At one stage, Ayush was leading 5-2 although lost the next five games to trail 5-7. Then he won the next two games as well as the tiebreaker to hand VS a 1-0 lead. Ayush and Yogesh Kumar then defeated Arpan and Aman 8-4 in the doubles to seal the match for VS.

MS defeated LLR by 2-0
Pool B: MS 2-0 LLR
Singles: MS 8-5 LLR
Doubles: MS 8-0 LLR
Parush Patel defeated Shashank Jaipuria 8-5 in the singles and then later combined with Duttatreya Das to complete a 2-0 win for MS as the LLR pair of Shashank and Manish failed to win a single game.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Football

Quarter-finals | Match 3 | Result

RP v/s LLR

In the third quarter-final, RP defeated LLR by a score of 1-0 to enter the semi-finals. The sole decisive goal came for RP in the second half, where Gauraang Kothari successfully converted the penalty kick for his team.

RP played with attacking intent right from the beginning. Despite this, an extremely good display of defence from LLR restricted them from scoring any goal in the first half. However, in the last few minutes of the game, LLR gifted RP a penalty kick which was converted successfully by Gauraang. "The team successfully dominated, and created chances at regular intervals which were the major reason for our win", said Vivek Malik, captain of the winning team.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes it best of luck for the upcoming matches.

Quarter-finals | Match 2 | Result

LBS v/s BRH

In the second match of the day, LBS defeated BRH by a score of 3-2 to enter the semi-finals.

In the first half, LBS dominated the show, with Abhinav Mishra scoring two goals, and Chetan scoring one goal. Despite a big lead of 3-0 at the half-time, BRH retaliated strongly in the second half. Abhik Jana scored a goal, and Ritabrata Dobe scored a goal in a penalty kick for BRH. Despite the fightback, LBS stormed into semifinals by a final scoreline of 3-2.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes best of luck for the upcoming matches.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Football

Quarter-final | Match 1 | Result

RK vs AZAD:

AZAD won the match with a final scoreline of 2-0 and qualified for the semi-finals.

In the thrilling match of quarter-final, RK started off well creating some good opportunities in the beginning, but the winning team made a comeback through the first goal scored by Avnish Ranjak in first half of the match. Thereafter the whole team played dominantly and sealed their win with second goal by Mridupon Kutum in the second half.
"Everyone presented a good game and the whole team anticipated very well to win the match", said the winning captain Rishab Raja. Overall, both teams showcased a good game of football in the first quarter-final.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them good luck for upcoming matches.

In the decider reverse singles, Siddharth defeated Abhijeet with a 5-0 win, hence finally sealing the game for Patel.

Pravah: Hindi Technology Dramatics Society - HTDS, has, yet again set up the bars of the dramatics culture of IIT Kharagpur. IIM Calcutta witnessed the grandeur of the street play 'Being Animal' staged by the group and awarded it the third position in the nukkad event, Halla Bol during the annual cultural fest, Carpe Diem 2019. The play also made it to the finals of the street play event, 'Nukkad', while the stage play 'Perfect Strangers' bagged the 3rd position and the Best Direction Award in the stage play event, 'Rangmanch', both held during Spring Fest 2019.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team and wishes them luck in all their future endeavours.

2. VSRC vs MS - VSRC won by 2-1
1st Singles: Siddhant (MS) defeated Prasad (VSRC) 21-12, 22-20
Doubles: Dibya - Archisman (VSRC) defeated Siddhant - Saitya (MS) 25-23, 21-19
2nd Singles: Archisman (VSRC) defeated Mahendra (MS) 21-8, 21-13

3. LBS-1 vs HJB - LBS-1 won by 2-0
1st Singles: Jashvant (LBS-1) defeated Rohit (HJB) 21-3, 21-1
Doubles: Pranay - Jashvant (LBS-1) defeated Roopesh - Nikhil (HJB) 21-6, 21-13

4. Azad vs LBS-2 - Azad won by 2-0
1st Singles: Devanuj (Azad) defeated Siddhant (LBS-2) 21-5, 21-12
Doubles: Devanuj - Jay Ganesh (Azad) defeated Abhilash - Chandrakant (LBS-2) 21-13, 21-18

5. MMM1 vs JCB - JCB won by 2-0
!st Singles :  Sahil(JCB) defeated Sumit Sheoran (MMM-1) 21-8, 21-9
Doubles: Sahil - Sidhu(JCB) defeated Akhil - Himanshu (MMM-1) 21-15, 21-19

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is glad to announce that one of our reputed Professors Mr. Sudip Misra of the Computer Science and Engineering Department has been selected for the conferment of prestigious "Abdul Kalam Technology Innovation National Fellowship" by INAE.

It has been endowed to him in recognition of outstanding contributions in the fields of Internet of Things and Wireless Sensor Networks as well as a leadership role in the growth of the engineering profession in the country.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur once again congratulates our beloved Professor for his eminent fellowship and convey our best wishes for success in all his endeavors.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball 

Day 4 | Results

Match 2 
AZAD vs JCB
Azad won the match with the final scoreline of 47-38. Boosted up with the lead in the first quarter, Azad carried it in the entire match to seize the win. 
Though the entire team of Azad played its part well still Arpan Pallar and Saurabh Sihag were the ones who caught the eyesight scoring 18 and 16 points respectively. Saurabh's 3 pointers were of great help in this victory.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball 

Day 4 | Results

Match 1

LBS vs LLR
LBS won the match by a huge margin with the final scoreline of 132-10. The winning team undoubtedly dominated all the quarters and achieved this humongous victory in an extremely one-sided match while the other team seemed to struggle throughout the match.
Dipesh Madan scored a major chunk of this score which included three consecutive 3 pointers, a total of 42 points were scored by Dipesh. Vikas Yadav showcased a great game scoring a total of 31 points whereas Deepak Foujdar scored 22 points and defended the post really well.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

The famous physicist, Dr. Albert Einstein once remarked that "If you can't explain something to a six-year-old, you don't understand it yourself." Researchers indulge themselves in this quest for a simple explanation to an immensely complex problem. In this article, we present one such quest of discovery, by one of IIT Kharagpur's Alumni from the 2005 Batch, Dr. Aloke Kumar. This article describes the phenomenon of biomineralization and his study of the same on bacteria, the "Bacteria that turns to stone"! Dr. Kumar currently works as Assistant Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. We thank him for enlightening us with this article and opening up the way to such interesting research opportunities. The link to the article: https://thedrashta.blogspot.com/2019/01/bacteria-that-turns-to-stone.html

Yet another convivial moment for KGPians turned out after the declaration of The Fred E. Schwab Education Awards. 
Prof Anil K Bhowmick, Professor of Eminence and former Head of Rubber Technology Centre has been selected as the recipient of the prestigious 2019 Fred E. Schwab International Education Award of the Society of Plastics Engineers, USA. He is the first person working in Asia to have been selected for this award. Professor Bhowmick has also been the Dean, Postgraduate Studies and Dean SRIC at IIT Kharagpur. He is also the former Director of IIT Patna.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur expresses it's heartiest congratulations to him for his achievement.

Tennis competition in this year's general championship started on Thursday with first two league matches being played between MMM & RP and Azad & Nehru. Here are the pools, fixtures and day 1 results: 
1. Pool C - MMM vs RP
MMM 2-0 RP 
Nikhil defeated Satya Aditya Killada 8-4 in first singles match while Nikhil and Anshuman Kumar combined in the doubles encounter to prevail 8-7(7-4 in tiebreaker) against Satya Aditya and Mihir Kirloskar
2. Pool A - Azad vs Nehru
Azad 2-1 Nehru
Harshvardhan Srivastava of Nehru bagged the first point for his hall by defeating Shubham Maheshwari 8-3  but Azad won the next two matches quite comfortably. Aman Gupta and Arpan Pallar of Azad defeated Nehru's pair of Harshvardhan and Kaustabh 8-0 while Nishant won his match against Kaustabh by a similar score.

message:
|| Results || General Championship 2018-19 || Sports & Games || Tennis ||

Tennis competition in this year's general championship started on Thursday with first two league matches being played between MMM & RP and Azad & Nehru. Here are the pools, fixtures and day 1 results: 
1. Pool C - MMM vs RP
MMM 2-0 RP 
Nikhil defeated Satya Aditya Killada 8-4 in first singles match while Nikhil and Anshuman Kumar combined in the doubles encounter to prevail 8-7(7-4 in tiebreaker) against Satya Aditya and Mihir Kirloskar
2. Pool A - Azad vs Nehru
Azad 2-1 Nehru
Harshvardhan Srivastava of Nehru bagged the first point for his hall by defeating Shubham Maheshwari 8-3  but Azad won the next two matches quite comfortably. Aman Gupta and Arpan Pallar of Azad defeated Nehru's pair of Harshvardhan and Kaustabh 8-0 while Nishant won his match against Kaustabh by a similar score.

Disclaimer: The schedule is tentative and is subject to change as notified by Secretary Tennis, Gymkhana

Update | General Championship 2018-19 | Football

Inter-Hall Football GC has entered the exciting knockout stage. The group stage ended with MS defeating VSRC by 3-0 in the last match to remain at the top in Group D. Azad, RP and BRH are at the top in Group A, B and C respectively. The top two teams in each group have qualified for the knockouts. We now have the fixtures for Quarter-Final matches to be played on 4th and 5th February

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the qualified teams. Watch out for your teams as they play the knockouts and stay tuned to us for further updates.

message:
Results || General Championship 2018-19 || Sports || Basketball || 

Day 2 | Results

Match 1: SN/IG vs Gokhale
SN/IG won the match by a final scoreline of 28-20.
The match between the two teams resulted out in the favour of SN/IG which dominated the first and the final quarter. Akshita and Taban from SN/IG played  important roles in the win while Yukti from Gokhale also presented a great game.

Match 2: SN vs SAM
SAM won the match by a final scoreline of 27-02.
SAM registered an easy win against SN. The entire match was dominated by SAM as their players Jyoti and Shivangi took them to a comfortable win.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and wishes them great luck for coming matches.

Hilarious problems of villages found the way to their solutions in the event of Panch Parmeshwar, organised by Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur at Spring Fest 2019. Pairs of teams fought against each other, each trying to justify themselves and the winning sides were picked by the honourable Panch considering the arguments put before them. This impromptu debate witnessed insane conversations, obligations, proposals and arguments.  Here are a few glimpses of the event.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 11 new photos — with Swapnil Waghmare and 19 others.

message:
Results || Cricket || General Championship || Sports and Games

The final match between MMM2 and Azad was a nail-biting encounter as expected although Azad hall of residence avenged their last year's defeat to MMM as they won the match by 10 runs. Batting first, Azad made a total of 137 for the loss of four wickets. Chasing 138, MMM2 looked quite comfortable as they were 109/4 after 16 overs. With 29 required off 24 balls, the two pacers came back for their second spell and ran through the batting line up of MMM2. The batting team could only score 2 runs when 13 was needed in the final over.
The third-place match between RK and RP was a low scoring affair with RK winning comfortably by 4 wickets.
Senior Sports Officer S K Panda distributed the prizes as Vikas Kumar of MMM2 bagged both the crown of being the highest run scorer as well as the man of the series award. Ashish Agarwal of Azad was the leading wicket-taker with a total of 12 scalps in the tournament.

Final
MMM2 vs Azad
Azad- 137/4(20)
MMM2- 127/9(20)
Azad won by 10 runs

3rd place 
RP vs RK
RP- 86/10(13)
RK- 88/6(14.4)
RK won by 4 Wickets

Final standings
1. Azad
2. MMM2
3. RK
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winner!!!

message:
Results || Cricket || General Championship || Sports and Games 2018-19
Semifinals

The cricket final in this year's general championship will be a repeat of the last edition as both MMM2 and Azad won their respective semifinals in convincing fashion. Playing side by side on the two different grounds in Tata sports complex, both the eventual winners batted first and gave an almost same target for their opponents. The chasing teams never looked promising and both the fixtures eventually resulted in lopsided contests.
Supporters of both the teams as well as cricket enthusiasts will be again hoping for a nail-biting encounter as the previous year's final between these two teams which was decided in super over after resulting in a tie.

1. Azad vs RP
Azad- 158/5(20)
RP- 103/10(17)
Azad won by 55 Runs

2.MMM2 vs RK
MMM2 - 157/4(20)
RK- 86/10(18)
MMM2 won by 71 runs

Final - MMM 2 vs Azad
3rd place - RK vs RP
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and hopes for an interesting contest tomorrow.

Remember the times when you loved going to your grandparents’ village in your childhood? 
The place where some of your funny, as well as interesting memories, belong to. Those aimless wandering in between unripened mangoes, the sight of older ones gossiping at a tea stall or solving scuffles between the villagers under the big banyan tree. Feeling Nostalgic? Don’t worry! Panch Parmeshwar is all set to drive your nostalgia away bringing to you some of those funny and interesting situations which you encountered in your village. 

सही और गलत के पार, 
बरगद के पेड़ तले,
 मुकदमों को सुलझाते हुए, 
पंच परमेश्वर है, हम वहीं मिलेंगे। 

Panch Parmeshwar is a fun event in which two teams are provided with a slightly complex & funny case (depicting a situation of a village) to fight on verbally in front of the panchayat of the village. The team presenting more funny and relevant arguments is decided to be the winner. Be there in front of the HSS department on 25th January, 10 am onwards to have a burst of laughter and loads of fun.

पंच परमेश्वर है, हम वहीं मिलेंगे। 

Panch Parmeshwar is a fun event in which two teams are provided with a slightly complex & funny case (depicting a situation of a village) to fight on verbally in front of the panchayat of the village. The team presenting more funny and relevant arguments is decided to be the winner. Be there in front of the HSS department on 25th January, 10 am onwards to have a burst of laughter and loads of fun.

Remember the times when you loved going to your grandparents’ village in your childhood? 
The place where some of your funny, as well as interesting memories, belong to. Those aimless wandering in between unripened mangoes, the sight of older ones gossiping at a tea stall or solving scuffles between the villagers under the big banyan tree. Feeling Nostalgic? Don’t worry! Panch Parmeshwar is all set to drive your nostalgia away bringing to you some of those funny and interesting situations which you encountered in your village.

The KGPian Quizzers are absolutely on a roll! They end the last year with winning the Quiz Cup in the Inter-IIT Cultural Meet and now, they have started the year with a bang! They have recorded their best ever performance in one of the most elite quiz competitions and have been crowned champions at Nihilanth 2019 - the Annual Inter IIT-IIM Quiz championship. 16th edition of Nihilanth, hosted by IIM Calcutta this weekend saw strong teams from IITs and IIMs battling for the championship. This championship featured over seven quizzes for the institutes to slug it out for the coveted championship with the active participation of 450+ students from over 39 contingents (19 IITs, 20 IIMs). Here're the final standings:
IT Kharagpur - 53 
IIT Bombay - 49 
IIT Madras - 46 
IIT Delhi - 42 
IIT BHU - 16 
IIM Calcutta - 16 
IIM Shillong - 9 
IIT Roorkee - 8 
IIM Indore - 5 
IIT Guwahati - 2
IIT Kharagpur team's performance in individual quizzes was as follows:
Sci-Tech Quiz - 3rd (Abhimanyu Bharade, Piyush Kedia and Shubham) and 6th (Baibhab Pattnaik, Mihir Shrivastava and Sourav Kundu)
India Quiz - 1st (Harsh Agarwal, Shubham and Piyush Kedia)
Biz Quiz - 1st (Abhimanyu Bharade, Piyush Kedia and Shubham)
MELA Quiz - 3rd (Shubham, Hemansh Kashyap and Mihir Shrivastava)
Sports Quiz - 3rd (Piyush Kedia, Deepanshu Sinha and Kaniska Ghosh) and 4th (Abhimanyu Bharade, Baibhab Pattnaik and Shubham)
Lone Wolf Quiz - 3rd (Piyush Kedia) and 10th (Baibhab Pattnaik)
General Quiz - 6th (Varun PD, Devika Narayanan and Kaustav Mandal) and 8th (Hemansh Kashyap, Baibhab Pattnaik and Amit Kumar Ram)
The meteoric rise of Quiz culture in KGP campus and subsequent string of impressive consistent performances at the national level is attributed to the strong culture of  IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club. And a part of the credit also goes to the current governers Mohit Tulsyan, Harsh Agarwal and Amit Kumar Ram for the thumping wins round the year.
The 30 member team for Nihilanth included Abhimanyu Bharade, Agnimitra Anand, Amit Kumar Ram, Anshuman Agrawal, Baibhab Pattnaik, Bhutwala Raj, Deepanshu Sinha, Devika Narayanan, Girish Suranje, Hardik Tibrewal, Harsh Agarwal, Harsha Vattem, Hemansh Kashyap, Kaniska Ghosh, Kaustav Mandal, Mihir Shrivastava, Mohit Tulsyan, Piyush Kedia, Rupam Kumar Dubey, Samarth, Sangeeta Roy, Saswata Banerjee, Shreyans Sadangi, Shubham, Soumya Acharya, Sourav Chirania, Sourav Kundu, Varun P D, Venkatesh Jaiswal and Pratik Zaware. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire Quiz team for making us all proud!
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Devika Narayanan and 10 others.

IIT Kharagpur's team of Siddharth Singh, Prajwal Singhania and Buridi Sree Aditya have won the third prize in the finals of first Pan-IIT AI Hackathon 2019, organised at IIT Delhi this weekend (19-20 January). They built a model for 'Early detection of Parkinson's Disease' which fetched them podium finish and prize money of 1.5 lakh rupees. All three students are 4th year students of the Department of Computer Science & Engineering IIT Kharagpur. 
The PanIIT organisation was formed as an umbrella organisation to evolve a brand that would provide strong fraternity among Indian Institute of Technology alumni. This hackathon aimed to promote AI and ML among the wider community of software and IT professionals and showcase the talent among them.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates them on their success.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Siddharth Singh and Buridi Sree Aditya.

message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur, brings to you, an interaction with one of the best umpires of this generation,  Mr. Simon Taufel. He was invited as a guest speaker on the inauguration of Kshitij 2019.  He is the man who witnessed Yuvraj's six sixes at Kingsmead in Durban during ICC World T20 and who saw the iconic finish of Dhoni at the Wankhede in 2011 ICC World Cup. He won five consecutive 'ICC Umpire of the Year' award between 2004 and 2008.

Watch the interview to know more about the great Australian umpire and his take on various aspects of the game such as DRS and technology in cricket, and his experience umpiring high tension matches.

Peer Assisted Learning (PAL) is a prestigious student mentorship program flagged off under the aegis of the office of the Dean, Undergraduate Studies, IIT Kharagpur with the help of the Undergraduate Students' Council to help students academically in subjects with a high number of failures/low average performance.
After continuous efforts, the program is ready for the first time implementation in the session Spring 2019 for which 9 subjects have been shortlisted (can be seen in the image below). 
In this program, senior undergraduate students who have scored well in the particular subject shall tutor the current batches for a certain fixed period of time in return for honorarium and certification from the office of Dean, UGS.
3rd, 4th and 5th year UG students to kindly apply to be the tutors at the following link:

Research scholars from across the country staged a protest outside the Union Human Resource Development Ministry in New Delhi on Wednesday demanding an increase in their fellowship allowances. Sharing this cause, research scholars here at IIT Kharagpur also staged a protest in front of the main building and then held a march from Bidhan Chowk to Technology Students Gymkhana.
We talked to one such student sitting in front of Gymkhana where he stated that their aim is also to show solidarity with those who are on hunger strike in front of MHRD and to those who were protesting peacefully but have been forcefully abducted by police.
Their key demands included a hike of at least 80% in the current research fellowship amount, uniform distribution and regular disbursement of fellowship and the sudden release of arrested students. Also, they appealed that the annual increment in the fellowship amount should be in accordance with the inflation and the revised fellowship should be applicable from new financial year, i.e, April 2019.

The first phase of the placement session started on the 1st of December and went on for the next 13 days. IIT Kharagpur created a new record in this first placement phase of 2018-2019 by bagging more than 1270 offers (including PPOs) by more than 170 companies. Top recruiters in this phase were EXL Services (30), Quantiphi Analytics (27), Barclays GSC (22), OYO (20), Mastercard(18), etc. 

Dual degree students had a considerable share with a total number of 350 offers. While Department of Computer Science once again dominated in the CTC analysis with an average of around 30 lacs, many of the other departments had their average CTC in the range of 10-20 lacs. While the Department of Mechanical engineering bagged the highest number of offers, Departments of Metallurgical and Material Science Engineering and Chemical  Engineering had the best placed to the registered number of students conversion ratio.

Maximum companies offered jobs in Software development and Data Science profiles. Also, a fairly higher number of CTCs lied in 7-15 lacs zone.

Disclaimer: The numbers in the graphs do not include PPOs and is based on information obtained from the CDC notice board.

message:
IIT Kharagpur's team of Mayank Khetan, Pranjal Shankhdhar and Sumeet Shirgure have qualified for coveted ACM-ICPC World Finals 2019. All three are students of the Department of Computer Science & Engineering IIT Kharagpur. The finals will be hosted by University of Porto from 31st March to 5th April. They are one of the seven teams from India to qualify for the World Finals. 
The ACM ICPC is considered as the "Olympics of Programming Competitions". It is quite simply, the oldest, largest, and most prestigious programming contest in the world. The ACM-ICPC (Association for Computing Machinery - International Collegiate Programming Contest) is a multi-tier, team-based, programming competition. Headquartered at Baylor University, Texas, it operates according to the rules and regulations formulated by the ACM. The contest participants come from over 2,000 universities that are spread across 80 countries and six continents.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team for their splendid performance and wishes them best for the finals.

As an outstanding result of the series of efforts made to bring about a change in the Netaji Auditorium, the current sound system of Netaji Auditorium will be completely replaced, and new Dolby Digital Sound System will be installed in the Auditorium. The process has passed all the stages of the paperwork, and the closing date of the tender, for now, is set to be 24th January 2019. This was done to bring the auditorium one step closer to the state of the art technology.
Awaaz congratulates and thanks all the members of the TFS Executive Committee members, Prof. Somesh Kumar (Chairman TFS), Prof. Amreesh Chandra (Vice-Chairman TFS),  Devang Upadhyay (Secretary Films), Mr. Akhilesh Singh (Manager TFS), and all the members of the purchasing committee, and other people involved in the whole process for their commendable efforts.
As we spoke to the Secretary Films and other concerned authorities, on the issue of Hollywood movies not being screened in the Netaji Auditorium, we found out that the current projection system is based on the Qube Cinema Technology, and right now is unfortunately incompatible with Hollywood movies. Efforts were being made to change it, to 2K or 4K system of projections but huge amount of money to be invested and a metaphorically similar amount of paperwork posed as a barrier. The concerned authorities are still struggling to find a way out of the deadlock that this proposal had met.  
Changing the sound system was a part of the big plan to change the whole projection system and revolutionize viewing experience in the Auditorium. We hope that this dream soon changes into reality.

बात उस समय की है,
जब अकबर शासन करता था,
कन्याओं का लेन-देन हुआ करता था,
हर जगह उस वक्त धर्म की हार थी,
देवी रूपी कन्या बाजारों में लाचार थी,
संदलबार में वो बाजार सजाया जाता था,
अपहरण कर कन्याओं को बिकवाया जाता था,
हर जीव का खून उस वक्त जैसे नीर था,
मगर कोई था, वो दुल्ला भट्टी जैसा वीर था,
बिना किसी परवाह के वो अकबर से जा टकराया,
संदलबार से एक एक कन्या को वो वापस लाया।
मान-इज्जत के संग सबका घर बसाया था
लोगों ने तब जाकर लोहड़ी का त्यौहार मनाया था।

आवाज़, आई. आई. टी. खड़गपुर की ओर से सभी को लोहड़ी की ढेर सारी शुभकामनाएँ।

Waking up early for a 2.2km run plucks many strings in the hearts of KGPians, be it the concern for health or be it a reunion with friends. Imagine coming back, after several years, to the same old laps of the 2.2 with friends who became family members. The freshers, who returned as the alumni, took a nostalgic lap at the event of 'Run for KGP: 2.2 Marathon' and remembered one of the most happening days of their lives. 

The results are as follows:
Alumni
1st position: Prof. Kingshook Bhattacharyya
2nd position: Chidambaran
Students
1st position: Sujith Kumar
2nd position: Satayender
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the winners, hearty congratulations and, all the participants a good health and a splendid future ahead.

"Arise, awake, and stop not, till the goal is reached." Swami Vivekananda's personality is as dynamic as are his words relevant to this day. On this Youth day, that commemorates his 156th birth anniversary, let us follow his message to the youth, "Strength is life. Weakness is death."

Youth are an integral part of our society and are pivotal to the nation’s development. We form an essential part of the national workforce, and this is where the potential of the future of society lies. The day celebrates majority of India's population, whether it be an entrepreneur trying to make it big, a college student cycling to his class early in the morning or staying up till five in the night to meet a deadline. These are the people who will contribute the most to our society and be instrumental in the progress of our country. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a happy National Youth Day!

"हिंदी है हम वतन है हिन्दोस्तान हमारा।" 
विश्‍व हिंदी दिवस को मनाये जाने का उद्देश्य, विश्व में हिंदी भाषा के प्रचार-प्रसार हेतु जागरुकता पैदा करना तथा इसे अंतरराष्ट्रीय भाषा के रूप में मजबूत करना है। इसकी शुरुआत पूर्व प्रधानमंत्री डॉ. मनमोहन सिंह ने 10 जनवरी 2006 को की थी एवं पहला विश्‍व हिंदी सम्‍मेलन 10 जनवरी 1975 को नागपुर में आयोजित किया गया था। 
आवाज़ आई आई टी खड़गपुर की ओर से सभी को विश्व हिन्दी दिवस की हार्दिक शुभकामनाएं।

Politics is an art. What all goes behind a candidate preparing to contest elections is something which certainly not all people observe. On the front what appears as candidate putting efforts to attract votes with his promises is backed by a well-developed strategy based on many factors.

"Your Perspective", a platform provided by Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, provides each and every person an opportunity to pen down his opinion regarding any issue and have his voice heard by the common people. With TSG General Elections due at the end of this semester, Ksheera Sagar K N, an alumnus from the class of 2018  writes in our column about "KGP Elections and Student Bodies". The articles highlights the lesser known aspects about the election process and describe the politics and equations behind the election of Student Representatives at Gymkhana.

Disclaimer: Article under "Your Perspective" is the perspective of the students of IIT Kharagpur on the prevailing issues and the incidents. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur has no take on this.

You may read the entire article in the link below:
https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/your-perspective-kgp-elections-and-student-bodies-3ef9b989c8f6?fbclid=IwAR0ngRklFPrfj9SPW10vi3sxbyxplDVyWVXMdbq9G2mb598w97yWo8B6DPA

Smart India Hackathon 2019 is a nationwide initiative to provide students with a platform to solve some of pressing problems we face in our daily lives, and thus inculcate a culture of product innovation and a mindset of problem-solving. In order to make development a comprehensive mass movement and innovate on all fronts, MHRD, AICTE, i4c and Persistent Systems have come together to organise Smart India Hackathon (SIH) 2019. The deadline to submit ideas is 20th January. For more details please visit https://sih.gov.in/
In SIH 2019, the students would also have the opportunity to work on challenges faced within the private sector organisations and create world-class solutions for some of the top companies in the world, thus helping the Private sector hire the best minds from across the nation.

Researchers from IIT Kharagpur have achieved a breakthrough in the development of carbon microneedles.The tiny needles, less than 1mm in size,  when arranged on a patch can be used for painless drug delivery.
Last year the team had developed microneedles from a widely used photosensitive polymer(SU-8), which on further modification using pyrolysis produced glassy carbon needles which were almost 300 times stronger than the original ones and were biocompatible.
The needles showed no toxicity when tested on mice models, says Prof. Bidhan Pramanick who completed his post-doctoral research from the institute and is one of the authors of the work published in Nature Microsystems & Nanoengineering.
Further, another author of the work, Tarun Kanti Bhattacharyya from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication at the institute says, “We are now working on developing a drug reservoir and micropump which can be attached to the patch for controlled drug delivery. Just like a band-aid, we can fabricate a dia-aid that can be used by diabetic patients for painless insulin administration. Though we cannot bring down the cost of insulin, the patch can reduce the device cost by 50%.”
Further commenting on the durability of the needles, Richa Mishra, Ph.D. scholar at the institute and first author of the work says, “We found that the new carbon microneedles overcame the resistive forces of our skin and was able to successfully pierce the skin. And as the needles are only 400 micrometers long, it will be completely painless. ”

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for their success.
https://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/science/carbon-microneedles-low-cost-painless-injections/article25920342.ece?fbclid=IwAR2vm3qsOT0y-No1DaTbm8QgsmAVbc4uQyOrqt0VZVxiUyAFMznMcqJ1MPo

Technology Students' Gymkhana has launched a complaint portal on its website a few days ago where an institute student can register a complaint regarding any issue in the campus under its purview. The link for the same is http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/complaint/
The student has to provide details like name, roll number, e-mail, subject and the person to whom it is addressed to.
The message will be directly forwarded to the VP or the respective G.Sec. to whom it is addressed, in order to ensure quick action.
Furthermore, one can always turn up to ERP complaints portal for registering complaints. We would like to encourage students to register their complaints over there as well.

Third Inter IIT Cultural Meet | Final Results 

Finally, the cut throat competition among the indefatigable participants who worked tirelessly for so many days and nights to achieve the best came to an end. The most exciting 3rd inter IIT cultural meet ended on a good note for the contingent. KGP bagged yet another bronze in yet another inter IIT Cultural meet held at IIT  Roorkee in which 21 IITs participated. IIT Bombay finished first in a clinical display. IIT Roorkee finished second in the meet and barely managed to beat KGP by a margin of just 4 points. 
KGP clinched gold in both quiz and music cup whereas silver in  Filmmaking, Culinary, Literary and Speaking Arts Cups as the team managed to finish fourth in the Dramatics Cup.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners for their victory and everyone else who has made IIT Kharagpur proud.

Disclaimer: Even after two days of the concluding ceremony, this result stands tentative owing to a conflict regarding the results of some events. The difference between the first runner up and the second runner up being marginal, there are chances of change in the standings.

There is nothing more charming than embellished trees, lights, serenity in hearts, presents, family and friends to decorate up one's life. Amidst the Christmas carols, eggnog, cookies, and mounds of presents, may your heart be filled with contentment and the unique feeling of joy that the season brings. Let's have something special for everyone on this holy day. To your enemy, forgiveness; to an opponent, tolerance; to a friend, your heart; to everyone, charity and yourself, patience and respect.
With a little smile, a word of cheer a bit of love from someone near a little gift from one held dear, let's have this realisation that Christmas is not just about opening our presents but also to open our hearts. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a splendid Christmas filled with lights, songs, and cheer.

Mr. Puran Dang (BTech/1959), has been named as ‘Lifetime Trustee’ by IIT Kharagpur Foundation. He also won the First Distinguished Service Gold Medal Award by his alma mater in 2011, chosen out of 45,000 graduates.
Mr. Dang is the founder of the first IIT Alumni Society of the world (IIT-SINE), which has grown as PAN-IIT worldwide. He serves as the Chairman Emeritus of the organization now. He is also Chairman Emeritus of MIT Heritage of The Arts Of South Asia as well as of Ekal Vidyalaya Foundation, USA, Not only this, he is the Chairman of Board of Advisors of Vision Aid.

“It is a very high honour for me. I am very fortunate to be a Lifetime Trustee of the IIT Kharagpur Foundation,” Mr. Dang said. “My institute, IIT Kharagpur, has been repeatedly rated as one of the top universities of the nation. To be inducted to the Foundation is all because of my education at my alma mater. I have been blessed with so many honours but being a Lifetime Trustee of the Foundation tops all of them.”

Source:
https://indianewengland.com/2018/12/puran-dang-named-lifetime-trustee-at-iitkgp-foundation/

| Department Change 2017-18 |

Semester results were out just a few days back and with half of your first year already completed, you know where you stand. Now it's the time when you need to analyse your performance so far and plan your upcoming semester accordingly.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur takes this opportunity to present the department change statistics for aspiring DepC freshers who, by now, must have realised how they should step their ante up. Scale the path that is left to be traversed, plan smartly learning from your past mistakes and prepare well for the future.

We would also like all the aspirants to note that the cut-off CGPAs for various departments are not constant and tend to change every year based on the relative performance and relative order of department choices filled by students. Hence, please don’t get disheartened if you could not perform up to your expectations.

All the best!

| Placement Phase 1 |

The Placement Phase 1 ended with a total of 1270 offers by more than 170 companies across more than 200 profiles. Departments of Computer Science & Engineering and Electronics & Communication Engineering bagged a high percentage of offers which stands at more than 80% when compared to registered vs. placed. Departments of Industrial & Systems Engineering and Electrical Engineering also witnessed more than 70% placed to the registered percentage. Mechanical, Civil and Chemical departments are among the other departments who stood out in the number of offers. 
Adding to it, six offers were given by Public Sector Undertaking companies including ONGC and ISRO.
Students placed belonged to different courses including B.Tech (309), Dual Degree (350), M.Tech. (233), M.Sc. 5 years (95), M.Sc. 2 years (4),  Ph.D. (14) and MS (6). 
Further detailed analysis will be published on our website soon.

Numbers are as per data available on CDC notice board. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and encourages rest of the students to whip up for the next placement session. We wish them all the best.

Numbers are as per data available on CDC notice board. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and encourages rest of the students to whip up for the next placement session. We wish them all the best.

Summary | Points table | Inter IIT Sports meet 

After a bunch of gritty display from athletes filled with determination, intense rivalry between opponents and a host of nail biting contests over a period of 8 days, Inter IIT Sports meet finally culminated in IIT Guwahati on Friday afternoon with IIT Kharagpur finishing as 2nd runner-up of the event.
IIT Delhi bagged the top honour with 106.8 points in the points table maintaining quite a significant lead of 26.4 points over IIT Roorkee, runner-up in the meet. IIT Kharagpur was placed at third position with a total of 80 points lagging behind Roorkee by just 0.4 points, thanks to the 0.4 extra points awarded to IIT Roorkee in the march past. Both the teams were on even terms with 72 points a piece, if compared only in the sporting events. IIT Madras too gave a tough fight to IIT Kharagpur although eventually ended up at fourth place with 78.2 points while IIT Bombay was placed fifth with a total of 62.5 points in its pocket.

IIT Kharagpur finished on top in men's badminton as well as in men's water polo conducted earlier in October while it emerged as runner-up across six different disciplines. A bronze in men's tennis and three fourth-place  finishes also made remarkable contributions to the points table.

IIT Kharagpur ended up securing the second position in both men's and women's athletics with a rich combined medal haul of 5 gold, 10 silver and 13 bronze medals in track and field events. Earlier, it was second-best in men's swimming discipline in the aquatics meet. IIT Kharagpur also bagged silver medal in men's squash, men's table tennis and women's badminton.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire contingent for their exceptional performance in this edition of the meet and hopes that this bronze will be soon converted to much coveted gold and KGP will soon bag the general championship crown.

A research team led by Dr. Ram Babu Roy, Assistant Professor at Rajendra Mishra School is developing a prototype of sensor-based activity tracking kit which can monitor the activities in daily lives along with the smoking habits which will help smokers quit this habit.
The research team also plans to build an application for the device which could be integrated with a fitness band or a smartphone that would analyze the tracking kit data and send alerts for the unhealthy lifestyle with suitable recommendations. 
In near real-time approach, an intervention in the form of a text/audio/video message or a phone call from family members/friends/doctor will convince the smoker to stop smoking while he lights a cigarette.

Source:
https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/science/iit-kharagpur-developing-app-to-help-smokers-quit/articleshow/67135030.cms?fbclid=IwAR3WmcQeL-FyEl-8Bv_jNAtWaDHusXKAQHVdt5di6X9vMtgwF9lOET_X7vE&from=mdr

With the athletics team bagging medals one after the other, why would have the weight-lifters stayed back when it came to proving their mettle?

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for his exceptional performance and wishes great luck to the sports contingent.

Discus Throw Men's | Inter IIT Sports meet

Abin Devassia continued his fine run of form as he won the 2nd gold medal in as many events after bagging yet another Gold for IIT Kharagpur in Men's Discus Throw. He hurled the discus to a distance of 36.86m and emerged the winner in an emphatic fashion as he was a clear 38 cm ahead of the silver-winning athlete, G Balamurgan of IIT Kanpur. Yesterday, he had brought delights to KGP camp after winning gold in Men's shot put event. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for his excellent performance this year and wishes best of luck to all the athletes vying for medals.

In a recent unfortunate accident of IIT Kharagpur alumnus Mr. Raghava Komal Polishetty, he has suffered traumatic brain injuries. He has undergone several surgeries in past 45 days, and is in coma, currently kept at the ICU. With insurance coverage and personal funds running out, a fundraising campaign has been organised for him. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur prays for his well being and urges all the students to help save a life by donating as generously as possible for them.

Placement Phase 1 | Day 10, 11, 12 and 13

The Placement phase 1 ended with the total of 118 offers made on Day 10, 11, 12 and 13 by 34 companies. L & T Constructions was the biggest recruiter recruiting 12 students. Other major recruiters included IEM (11), John Deere (7), Cubastion Consulting Pvt Ltd (7), CGI (6), Vignan Institute (6), Tata Steel Ltd (6), and Affine Analytics (5). With this, the total number of job offers stands at a total of 1261(PPOs included). Students placed belonged to different courses including B.Tech (23), Dual Degree (27), M.Tech (45), M.Sc. 5 years (9), Ph.D. (12) and MS (2).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and encourages rest of the students to whip up for the next placement session. We wish them all the best.

Other major recruiters included IEM (11), John Deere (7), Cubastion Consulting Pvt Ltd (7), CGI (6), Vignan Institute (6), Tata Steel Ltd (6), and Affine Analytics (5). With this, the total number of job offers stands at a total of 1261(PPOs included). Students placed belonged to different courses including B.Tech (23), Dual Degree (27), M.Tech (45), M.Sc. 5 years (9), Ph.D. (12) and MS (2).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and encourages rest of the students to whip up for the next placement session. We wish them all the best.

IIT Kharagpur alumnus Arjun Malhotra has been awarded the "Lifetime Achievement Award" at the recently held Dataquest Digital Leadership Conclave for his exceptional contribution in building and grooming the Indian IT industry.

Arjun Malhotra completed his B.Tech(Hons.) in 1970 from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications Engineering at IIT Kharagpur.

He is the co-founder of HCL and gas also led several IT entrepreneurial ventures. His vision towards telecom industry led to the foundation of GS Sanyal School of Telecommunication at IIT Kharagpur.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur presents the 12th edition of Know Your Entrepreneur (KYE) on the Telecom giant and a great entrepreneur Arjun Malhotra in which he speaks about the role that IIT KGP played in framing his personality, he also spoke about the major aspects of entrepreneurship and the problems that he faced in building the Indian IT sector.

Update on League Matches | Inter IIT Sports

Cricket:

IIT KGP defeated IIT Dharwad by 55 runs in the very first match of IIT KGP. IIT Dharwad won the toss and chose to field but they stumbled in the steep run chase with the required run rate going higher and higher which ultimately led to a massive defeat. 
IIT KGP will face IIT Bombay in the next match tomorrow.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, congratulates Prof. Gargi Das, Department of Chemical Engineering,  for being selected for the prestigious Padma Shri Dr. G. P. Kane Chemcon Distinguished Speaker Award by Indian Institute of Chemical Engineers (IIChE) and Prof. Pradip K. Ray, Department of Industrial & Systems Engineering, for being awarded Prof. P C Mahalanobis Award for the year 2018 by the Operational Research Society of India.

Prof. Gargi Das joined the Institute in 2001 and is also the current Head of the Department of Chemical Engineering. She has several internationally renowned publications and has won numerous international awards during her academic career, till date.

Prof. Pradip K Ray joined the Institute in 1989 and is a fellow of respected organisations like The Institution of Engineers (India), World Academy of Productivity Sciences (WAPS) and has many publications under his name.

message: A circular has been issued by Registrar, IIT Kharagpur appealing students, staffs and everyone else in the campus to cooperate in making KGP campus plastic free. Shops at Tech Market and other shops elsewhere have been asked to stop selling plastic bags. We have also experienced a few canteens and hall shops refusing to give plastic bags after purchase. This initiative taken is visionary but its impact depends on how we all are likely to contribute towards this cause.

Months spent in practising a sport, weeks of training to reach your form, days of hardwork to refine your techniques and hours of sweat soaking your jerseys; coming after a day of training hard, crashing on your bed with almost zero energy left, but your mind still buzzing with the fulfillment of training and the excitement of being able to prove your mettle.
It all leads up to moments like these, one of which is the 53rd inter IIT sports meet.
For the first time in inter IIT history, being provided is a level playing ground for our differently abled peers as well, making the tournament more inclusive than ever.
So lace up your shoes and polish your equipments, to prove the mettle of IIT Kharagpur's sports teams and players, this year in Guwahati.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone the best of luck and hopes they perform their very best and bring the trophy home.

Pic credits- Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti

The fourth Inter IIT Chess Meet concluded on 10th December with IIT Kharagpur bagging the silver medal this time. The competition was neck to neck between IIT Bombay and IIT Kharagpur both of which won 5 matches and played 2 draws till the last round with a total of 12 points each. The final positions were decided in the tie breaker where IIT Bombay bagged the gold medal. IIT Guwahati (10 points) and IIT BHU (8 points) stood at third and fourth positions respectively.
The team members from IIT Kharagpur were Gajendra Kumar, Koustav Chakraborty, Desai Saurabh, Sankalp Baliarsingh, Hemanth Kumar and Prithwi Sinha. 

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire KGP Community on this achievement and wishes that it continues in the Sports Meet ahead .

IIT Kharagpur has won the DSCI Excellence Award 2018 for Cyber Security Education by NASSCOM's Data Security Council of India (DSCI).
DSCI Excellence Award serves the purpose of recognizing and honoring individuals and organizations for research work and spreading awareness in cybersecurity and associated fields. Due to its excellent research work in the areas of cybersecurity, IoT security and associated areas in Artificial Intelligence, and also due to its excellent curricula in cryptography, hardware security, and network security, IIT KGP has been adjudged the winner. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire KGP community and hopes that the excellent work continues further and brings more accolades and honor to the institute.

Picture Credits: The KGP Chronicle

Placement Phase 1 | Day 5 and 6

The number of offers made on Day 5 and 6 of the current Placement session stood at a decent total of 150 with offers being made by 28 companies. Quantiphi Analytics was the biggest recruiter on Day 5 recruiting 29 students. The biggest recruiter of Day 6 was HSBC – EDPI which recruited 13 students. Other major recruiters included Reliance Jio Infocomm (12), Axtria (9), HCL Technologies (8), ZS Associates (8), Delhivery (7), Genpact (6), TVS Motors (6), Futures First (5), Infoworks (5)  and Robert Bosch (5). Students placed belonged to different courses including Dual Degree (60), B.Tech (53), M.Tech (20), M.Sc. 5 yrs (16) and MS (1). At the end of Day 6, the total number of offers made this placement session crossed the mark of 1000 including the 260 PPOs also offered.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and encourages rest of the students to keep on trying. We wish them all the best.

message:
The number of job offers crossed 1000 in just 6 days of this ongoing placement session (including Pre-Placement Offers). This has been the fastest that IIT Kharagpur has got 1000+ job offers. Last year, it took 8 days to achieve the same feat, it took only 6 days for the same this year. First 6 days of the placement session saw 179, 213, 122, 85, 99 and 54 job offers being made respectively. And there were 260 Pre-Placement Offers already in the bag even before the placement session started. 
This couldn't have been possible without the relentless efforts of the entire CDC team including student placement committee members, professors, vice-chairman, chairman and other staff members. A thousand students have been placed so far with many more to come. Prof. G. P. Raja Sekhar, Prof. Debashis Deb, Prof. Parag Arvind Deshpande, Prof. Uday Shankar, Prof. Mamata Jenamani were instrumental in mentoring student members. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the CDC placement committee members, staffs, professors and everyone else who contributed. We congratulate placed students as well. We would like to advise the students who haven't been placed yet to keep on trying and fighting hard.

Researchers of IIT Kharagpur have developed a decision support system to diagnose malicious lung tissues and other interstitial lung diseases (ILD), said an official statement on Wednesday. The mapping of disease is performed by doctors based on the ILD pattern and clinical inputs.

The tool detects the lung nodule, segments it, and provides a way to modify segmentation, retrieve similar nodules from the database with their report and assess the chance of malignancy of the query nodule based on the retrieval results, the statement added.

Both the software systems have been tested in AIIMS Delhi, and currently the success rate is above 80% in identifying both cases. The medical image scan database used for reference is sought from the Indian patient population; bringing the novelty of India-centric reference.

"The other system will help identify interstitial disease patterns in HRCT images depicting the lung tissue texture," explained lead researcher Prof Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering.

It further mentioned that the budding radiologists will be highly benefited in learning from the previous images stored in the Picture Archival and Communication System (PACS) and reports in the Radiological Information System (RIS) on their own. It would also help the practising radiologists in differential diagnosis using the CBIR based Computer Aided Diagnosis (CAD) system.

Placement Phase 1 | Day 4

The fourth day of the placement session witnessed 84 students getting recruited by a total of 17 companies that offered jobs. ExxonMobil was the biggest recruiter of Day 4 with the recruitment of 10 students, followed by Sterlite Technologies who recruited 9 students. Other recruiters included  Honeywell (7), Societe Generale (7), TCG digital, and Udaan (6 recruitments each). Capillary Technologies, PayU, and Vedanta recruited 5 students each. At the end of day 4, the total number of job offers stands at 589 in this placement session. Students placed belonged to different courses including  B.Tech (31), Dual Degree (27), M.Tech (17), M.Sc. (9).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and encourages rest of the students to keep on trying. We wish them all the best.

ExxonMobil was the biggest recruiter of Day 4 with the recruitment of 10 students, followed by Sterlite Technologies who recruited 9 students. Other recruiters included  Honeywell (7), Societe Generale (7), TCG digital, and Udaan (6 recruitments each). Capillary Technologies, PayU, and Vedanta recruited 5 students each. At the end of day 4, the total number of job offers stands at 589 in this placement session. Students placed belonged to different courses including  B.Tech (31), Dual Degree (27), M.Tech (17), M.Sc. (9).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and encourages rest of the students to keep on trying. We wish them all the best.

Amidst a recent incident where cruel inhumane measures were alleged to be taken to capture dogs on the campus, a circular has been issued by Registrar directing the campus community to deal with all animals in humane and legal way. It also includes protocols for capturing, neutering, vaccination, and sterilization under Animal Birth Control Program in accordance with the Animal Birth Control Rules  2001 under Section 38 of the PCA Act of 1960.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur contacted CIC and inquired about the improper internet connectivity in the campus especially in various Halls of residence. As per CIC, the connectivity problem was due to the video conferences going on in Nalanda Classroom Complex. Though the internet connectivity in the academic section has not been affected, some of the Halls are still facing problems in internet connectivity. "The issue will be resolved within a couple of days", CIC officials added.

The very first day of the Placement session started with a bang! On the first day itself, a total of 171 job offers were made to the students. The day witnessed 30 companies visiting the campus from software development, analytics, machine learning, hardware, financial management, and other domains. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the selected students and encourages rest of the students to keep on trying. We wish them all the best.

A research team from IIT Kharagpur has come up with new data confirming that the Antarctic Ozone Hole in the atmosphere is on a healing path. The researchers collected data from 1979 to 2017 from stations across Antarctica situated on different altitudes, including measurements from Indian station Maitri, which showed that there was a loss in Ozone saturation over the Antarctic since 1987 which got significantly reduced at 12-21 km(20% to 60%) level over the period from 2001 to 2017. The research clearly revealed the emergence of ozone recovery even at the altitudes where the near-complete ozone loss occurs.
The study was conducted by Prof Jayanarayanan Kuttippurath along with Pankaj Kumar, Prijitha J Nair, and PC Pandey from the Centre of Oceans, Rivers, Atmosphere and Land Science (CORAL), IIT Kharagpur. Their study got published in Springer Nature’s Climate and Atmosphere Science journal. Prof J Kuutippurath believes that the Montreal Protocol of 1987 has definitely saved the ozone layer and climate of the Southern hemisphere.

IIT Kharagpur has announced the winners of Distinguished Service Awards 2018 (DSA). As IIT KGP wishes to recognize its Alumni for providing outstanding service to the institute, it confers these awards each year. A total of ten Alumni of the Institute have been declared the recipients of the award this year.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the recipients and wishes that they carry on the great work.

The much-awaited placement process has arrived again and we at Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur would like to extend our best wishes to all the final year students sitting for placements. We firmly believe that the KGPians will be coming out with flying colours. Though the competition involved is inevitable, it's bound to be healthy one. We sincerely hope that students will be supporting each and help out their colleagues whenever required.
Also, it should be kept in mind that not being selected by a company is not the end of everything. A rejection teaches you a lot more than success. This wonderful world provides us with an infinite number of opportunities in life and one should always keep on trying without loosing enthusiasm. Everyone is unique and hence their life paths and careers will also be different. 
Finally, "Success is not final, failure is not fatal. It is the courage to continue that counts".
Once again, we would like to extend our best wishes to all the students and hope that everyone would be rewarded for their efforts.

In yet another achievement for IIT Kharagpur, the Tri-Institute Programme on Business Analytics (PGDBA) by IIT Kharagpur-ISI-IIM Calcutta has been ranked 14th in the world by QS. We are 2nd in Asia and the best in India. Congratulations to the entire KGP community on this achievement.

The Post Graduate Diploma in Business Analytics (PGDBA) – jointly offered by IIM Calcutta, IIT Kharagpur, and ISI Kolkata – aims to help shape the emerging profession of business analytics by delivering a cutting-edge interdisciplinary educational experience to graduate applicants with an aspiration of building a career in this field. This programme is designed for those who have an analytical mindset, are interested in tackling challenging business problems, and possess an inclination towards mathematics. Some of the salient features of the programme include courses taught by reputed faculty members at the campuses of three globally renowned institutes, hands-on business analytics training at a related company, continuous interaction with industry leaders throughout the course of the diploma programme, and the availability of placement opportunities at all the three institutes jointly offering this programme.

Source: https://www.topuniversities.com/university-rankings/business-masters-rankings/business-analytics/2019?fbclid=IwAR2I3h767xG9gRZMd22yowhmhnrfVxkwGj99BXmSSrdikXr2KSk48AnYsxw

message:
This is to inform all the students, professors and other staff members of IIT Kharagpur that all SBI ATM-cum-Debit cards not having EMV Chip (shown within blue square below) will be blocked after 31st December. SBI has asked its customers to get their ATM cards with magnetic stripe replaced with the one with ‘Europay MasterCard Visa’ (EMV) chip before December. 31st. Hence, the concerned people are suggested to get their ATM Cards replaced by applying for the same. It can be done offline as well as online. 
For offline mode, you would get an application form at the front desk. After filling it, submit it to the counter between counter number 4 and 5. The new ATM cards are expected to be delivered within next 15 days by post. 
For online mode, open the official website of SBI. Log in using your user ID and password. After login, you will see an e-services tab, click on it. Now select 'ATM card services' from the drop-down menu. Under 'ATM card services' tab, select 'Request ATM/Debit Card. Now select the savings account for which you wish to replace the ATM card, enter your name to be printed on the card and the type of ATM card you wish to receive. Click on the Submit button.

From one's hall to the department and library, and then back to hall late night, this is what defines the life of around a quarter of KGP's student population- The Research Scholars. This section of the student population is the most important contributors to the research quality index of the institute. 

Research Scholars' Council had a meeting with the director to discuss the issues pertaining to the research scholars in the campus, the most prominent being request for a hike in fellowship. The director has agreed to forward the collective request of research scholars from IIT Kharagpur to the Ministry of Human Resource and Development. Although the grant for Prime Minister Research Fellows (PMRFs) is considerably higher (INR 70,000 monthly) but they are very less in number. Currently, the Junior Research Fellows (JRFs) receive a fellowship grant of INR 25,000 per month while the Senior Research fellows receive 3,000 more. A hike in fellowship is the need of the hour to boost the confidence and improve the financial security of the research scholars and this is a welcome move from the director.
We are yet to receive information about the outcome of other discussions on other issues since the final decisions will be taken after a few more meetings with the concerned deans as conveyed by the RS Representative Moumita Roy Chowdhury. We shall be posting about the same as soon as we get the confirmation about the initiatives. Stay tuned!

IIT Kharagpur is set to get its first supercomputer and also the first one under the National Supercomputing Mission (NSM). In the first phase, IIT Kharagpur will get a 1.3 petaflop machine and IISER Pune and IIT-BHU will have a 650 teraflop computer each. These would be assembled locally in Chennai by Atos, while it would source the components from France. The deliveries of first phase are expected to start in the first quarter of next year. 

Atos, the French IT services firm has been selected to build the supercomputers. It will work jointly with the Center for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC). The NSM was announced three years ago with an aim to build a grid of 73 supercomputers across academic and research institutes in India, working on a wide range of applications, from weather forecasting to disaster management. It is being jointly implemented by the Department of Science and Technology (DST) and Department of Electronics and Information Technology (DeitY) at an estimated cost of Rs.4500 crore over a period of seven years.

Recently, one of our former professors, Prof. A. S. Davis, Department of Mechanical Engineering, has been honored with Chair Professorship by one of our famous alumni, Mr. Vinod Gupta (B.Tech./AG/1967/RK), who has donated USD 100,000 to set up the same. The endowment for Prof. A. S. Davis Chair Professorship will be used to pay a top-up salary to a senior professor from the Mechanical Engineering Department in the area of Thermodynamics to carry out excellent research, teaching, and development in the department.

Prof. Davis was the warden of Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence when Mr. Gupta met him first. Mr. Gupta took courses from him, and they came to know each other personally.

In Mr. Gupta’s words, “Prof. Davis emphasized that process was more important than results. His teachings have influenced my life in a significant way. He used to spend a lot of time in the hall, mentoring students through long hours of socialization. His practical nature, matching with his brilliance, is what I adored the most.”

“Gurudakshina has been a long-run culture at IIT Kharagpur, with our esteemed alumni such as Vinod transforming the Institute”, remarked our Director, Prof. P. P. Chakrabarti.

Professor G.P. Raja Sekhar of the Department of Mathematics has been selected for the JB Shukla Gold Medal by Indian Academy of Mathematical Modeling and Simulation (IAMMS). He came to the institute in the year 2000 as Visiting Faculty after which he joined as an Assistant Professor in the year 2002. Currently, along with being a Professor, he is also the Chairman of Career Development Centre (CDC), IIT Kharagpur.

Jang Bahadur Shukla is an Indian mathematician who specialized in mathematical modeling of ecological, environmental, physiological, and engineering systems. In the year 1982, he was awarded the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology, the highest science award in India, in the mathematical sciences category. The IAMMS, based in IIT Kanpur, has instituted the Gold medal in his honor.

The tentative team list of IIT Kharagpur's Contingent for the 53rd Inter IIT Sports Meet to be held at IIT Guwahati has been declared. The final list of players will be declared in December, based upon their performance in the camp.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the selected students best of luck and hopes that the hours and days of perseverance devoted shall turn fruitful.

message:
IIT Kharagpur has come up with a solution to determine the authenticity of posts and pass on relevant information in case of disasters. Fake news can thus be detected and segregated by mapping the information emanating from authorities in that region. 

The system develops AI methods to extract the specific type of critical and actionable information from social media content posted during disasters such as resource needs, resource availability and information about the trapped people. Dr. Saptarshi Ghosh of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering is heading a team developing algorithms for this task. This solution can also be used to glean information that can help victims of disasters along with identifying fake news and rumors. The institute along with its collaborators at Qatar Computing Research Institute (QCRI) has submitted a proposal to Microsoft Research India. Next, the institute plans to collaborate with Microsoft Research and QCRI to develop systems for aiding post-disaster relief operations. The project was jointly funded by IIT Kharagpur’s Institute Scheme for Innovative Research and Development grant, Microsoft Research India and ITRA, Media Labs Asia and Department of Electronics and Information Technology.

Source: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/software/iit-kharagpur-develops-tech-to-filter-fake-news-about-disasters/articleshow/66699717.cms

LPG distribution has always been an issue of vital importance both for the people and the government in the country. It is essential to ensure that all the households get the benefits of the government schemes.

A team of researchers from IIT Kharagpur led by Prof. Manoj Kumar Tiwari of the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering devised a decision support system (DSS) to help in maximizing LPG connections in BPL (below poverty line) households. It is the first of its kind for analysis of national-level energy focused on the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY).
PMUY, launched in May 2016, which initially aimed to provide five crore LPG connection by 2019 in BPL households, has now been revised to provide eight crore connections by 2020.

The DSS at IIT uses mixed linear programming to mathematically formulate the policy using input parameters, decision variables and their relationships that help in ascertaining proper functioning of the system towards the goal.
The IIT team has done sensitivity analysis with the mathematical model and can predict the number of household connections to be increased and also the critical region that contributes most in each zone of LPG distribution.  

Source: https://www.financialexpress.com/india-news/iit-kharagpurs-research-to-boost-lpg-distribution/1383517/?fbclid=IwAR1SV2fYrw4t5kzi11vCCRXs3sH-gFkWtRtSZkI0HXrklDI7Csu6qfLXRrk

IIT Kharagpur students have yet again stamped their authority on the International platform by winning the first Singapore-India Hackathon, a 36-hour competition to develop creative and innovative solutions focused on the theme "Smart Campus". Winning team of Pranjal Shankhdhar, Madhav Datt and Anurag Bharadwaj provided a Map Learning and Augmented Reality based solution without using the floor plan or any other kind of input for navigating indoors, thereby taking SGD 10,000 to their home as the winning prize. The demo of their Augmented Reality navigation App 'Skywalker' for users to find their way indoors and outdoors, which can also be integrated with Google Maps can be found here: https://youtu.be/0hwkiIbIJuI
The hackathon had 20 teams of three university students each from India and Singapore, participating in a 36-hour challenge at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) from 12th to 14th November. Out of these only 5 teams from each country reached to the finals where they had to pitch their solutions. The other winning teams from India were NIT Trichy, and MIT College of Engineering Pune securing second and third place respectively. Winners were awarded the prizes by Hon'ble Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for this innovative solution and winning the competition.

Professor Baidurya Bhattacharya of the Civil Engineering Department has been elected a fellow of the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE). ASCE Fellows have made celebrated contributions and developed creative solutions that change lives around the world. It is a prestigious honor held by only 3% of the ASCE members.

Professor Baidurya Bhattacharya is an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur of the 1991 batch of Civil Engineering Department. He completed his BTech from IIT Kharagpur and did MS and PhD. in Civil Engineering from Johns Hopkins University, USA. His main areas of research include Computational Materials Science (Nanomechanics) and Probabilistic Mechanics. He has also been the Associate Dean, Alumni Affairs and International Relations and currently is the Dean, International Relations at IIT Kharagpur. Before joining IIT Kharagpur as an Assistant Professor in the year 2006, he has also been an Assistant Professor at the University of Delaware and Visiting Assistant Professor at Stanford University.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for his future endeavors.

Before joining IIT Kharagpur as an Assistant Professor in the year 2006, he has also been an Assistant Professor at the University of Delaware and Visiting Assistant Professor at Stanford University.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for his future endeavors.

Professor Baidurya Bhattacharya of the Civil Engineering Department has been elected a fellow of the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE). ASCE Fellows have made celebrated contributions and developed creative solutions that change lives around the world. It is a prestigious honor held by only 3% of the ASCE members.

Professor Baidurya Bhattacharya is an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur of the 1991 batch of Civil Engineering Department. He completed his BTech from IIT Kharagpur and did MS and PhD. in Civil Engineering from Johns Hopkins University, USA. His main areas of research include Computational Materials Science (Nanomechanics) and Probabilistic Mechanics. He has also been the Associate Dean, Alumni Affairs and International Relations and currently is the Dean, International Relations at IIT Kharagpur. Before joining IIT Kharagpur as an Assistant Professor in the year 2006, he has also been an Assistant Professor at the University of Delaware and Visiting Assistant Professor at Stanford University.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for his future endeavors.

Childhood is an enchanting vista, an era of imagination, an artistic journey, an ode to love and a happy moment.  Memories of childhood are the dreams that stay with us even when we are awake. Every single day we wish to take a single childhood memory and blow it up into a bubble and live inside it forever.
This day of 14th November 2018,  celebrates the 130th birth anniversary of a freedom fighter, a visionary, an architect of modern India and a firm believer in the light of India's future - aptly embodied in his love for children, Pt. Jawaharlal Nehru. It is this love we commemorate today as children's day & his legacy we honor.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy Children's Day.

Don't let the child inside you fade away.
