Most of you might remember security guards for making you cycle through the cycle lanes but admittingly, we need to recognise the efforts they put in for our service. There is a lot more to them than what meets the eyes. They are also involved in some initiatives for the betterment of our campus and most recent of them is the cleanliness drive taken under 'Swacch Bharat Mission. Apart from the regular duty assigned to them, they have now voluntarily come together to make the campus cleaner and plastic free.
This cleanliness drive was initiated this October on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti and since then, security guards have been devoting one hour from 4 o'clock to 5 o'clock every Saturday to clean some of the public places in the campus such as Nalanda, Vikramshila complex etc. This initiative of campus cleanliness is planned to be continued for next one year and the schedule for next three months has been already chalked out. This Saturday, they cleaned Technology Guest House premises.
In addition to this, they also conducted a bicycle drive in a nearby village to spread awareness about Gandhiji’s teachings, cleanliness and the effect of drug abuse among the villagers. Cycle Yatra team halted at village Purbapatri and carried out a cleanliness and sanitation drive as part of Swachh Bharat Abhiyan. 
The inauguration of this drive on Gandhi Jayanti saw the presence of Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti (Director), Prof. S. K. Bhattacharya (Deputy Director), Prof. Bhrigu Nath Singh (Registrar), Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean, SA), Prof. Sudhirkumar Barai (Dean, UGS), Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG), Mr. S. S. Jha (Head, Security Section) and many others. Cleaning kits were also distributed to the security personnel. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur applauds the voluntary involvement of Security guards contributing towards a cleaner and plastic free campus.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents to you the November 2018 edition of the newsletter. The newsletter covers the Startup Culture in IIT Kharagpur (Page 1), the status of Open Source at IIT Kharagpur (Page 2) along with the interviews of Professor Amrish Chandra and the co-founder of HCL Technologies, Mr. Arjun Malhotra (Page 5). Not only these, go through a series of amusing Bhaats and chucklesome cartoons in our Bhaat section (Page 3) and Awaaz-e-Imtehaan (Page 6 and 7). 
You can mail us at editor@awaaziitkgp.org for any forms of comments or suggestions regarding the newsletter and in general.

Continuing the tradition of excelling in every field, this time, too, four of our KGPians* have passed the UPSC Engineering Services Examination (IES) 2018 with flying colours.
Their names along with their All India Rank and department are as follows-

Shrichand Pooniya: AIR 10, Civil Engineering, 
2017 Batch (B.Tech).

Prabhat Kumar: AIR 21, Civil Engineering, 
2017 batch (Dual Degree).

Vivek Chaudhary: AIR 87, Civil Engineering, 
2017 Batch (Dual Degree)

Ashish Dubey: AIR 89, Civil Engineering,
2016 batch (B.Tech).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes them good luck for their journey ahead and also hope for a continuous rise in the number of such people.

*This number is based on our information and is not based on official data.

Just a couple of days ago, we KGPians celebrated the festival of Diwali in our own traditional way in the form of "Illumination". Though each one of them was a brilliant example of dedication, hard work,  and perseverance, some stood out from the others, according to the judges. Many of you might not have got a chance to have a glance at them due to several reasons. So, we at Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur present you the podium-finishing Illuminations along with their theme. 

Gold- RP

Eminence, excellence, and intensity of Gangaputra Bhishma was shown from his birth to death-

पितृइच्छा पूर्ति हेतु ली ब्रह्नचर्य की शरण,
हुए गुरुखिलाफ भी, धर्मरक्षा के कारण,
मृतशया पर भी कृष्ण-नाम में लीन,
बलिदान, प्रतिज्ञा, भक्ति के सर्वोत्तम उदाहरण |

Silver- LBS

Rising out from the ashes- Encouraging to rise out from fears and failures and to become a better person forming a healthy legacy that lasts forever just like the Mysore Palace which stood up after a series of destructions turning more magnificent than ever

Bronze- RK

Prahlad's Undying Faith- By recounting the ballad of Narasimha,  we narrate the victory of Prahlad's devotion to omnipresent Vishnu over Hiranyakashyapu's worldly desires, revealing the power of faith.

Photos Credits: RK and LBS Illumination- William Mohanty Sir and RP Illumination- Click Kgp

message:
Beefed up security on the Campus
In a conversation with Mr. S. S. Jha, Head of the security section, we have got to know about the various measures taken by the security section of IIT Kharagpur to ensure better safety of the students and overall peacefulness on the campus. Some of these measures are:
1) Installation of over a hundred CCTV cameras across the campus including Halls, exit and entry gates, crossover positions like Tikka and many more. This ensures tracking of the happenings on the campus in a better way and enables the security team to spot the situations where emergency measures are needed to be taken. This would help in cases like cycle thefts, inappropriate incidents etc. A proposal of installing extra three times more the CCTV cameras installed right now is underway and is soon to be procured within next one month. Earlier, Awaaz had communicated the need of CCTV cameras in the campus to the authorities based on our survey on Basic Amenities. And we are happy to see this getting implemented. 
2) Formation of Quick Response Teams (QRTs). There are 4 sets of QRT teams strolling around campus all the time and students, in case of any emergency, can call them 24 x 7 and they would be there to help you out within two to three minutes. QRT team is equipped with motorbikes and wireless sets. QRTs can be called on two numbers: 03222-281002, 03222-281003
3) Entry Passes for non-IIT students and staffs. Non IIT members now have to take a three month valid entry pass in order to cross through the campus. Once the validity is over, they need to renew the same. Without getting their entry passes checked, they can't go through the gates. 
4) More Wireless sets to security personnel. More than four dozens of Wireless sets have been procured and distributed to security personnel to enable effective communication and hence, quicker actions.
5) Proposal of Women Cell. A proposal for having Women QRT teams and more women security personnel is underway. 

Besides beefing up the security, they have also been actively involved in smooth conduction of Illumination, Durga Puja celebrations and other events happening in the campus. This, for sure, indicates that the security measures have been strengthen over recent months and we hope that it’s going to get better in future.

This, for sure, indicates that the security measures have been strengthen over recent months and we hope that it’s going to get better in future.

Beefed up security on the Campus
In a conversation with Mr. S. S. Jha, Head of the security section, we have got to know about the various measures taken by the security section of IIT Kharagpur to ensure better safety of the students and overall peacefulness on the campus. Some of these measures are:
1) Installation of over a hundred CCTV cameras across the campus including Halls, exit and entry gates, crossover positions like Tikka and many more. This ensures tracking of the happenings on the campus in a better way and enables the security team to spot the situations where emergency measures are needed to be taken. This would help in cases like cycle thefts, inappropriate incidents etc. A proposal of installing extra three times more the CCTV cameras installed right now is underway and is soon to be procured within next one month. Earlier, Awaaz had communicated the need of CCTV cameras in the campus to the authorities based on our survey on Basic Amenities. And we are happy to see this getting implemented. 
2) Formation of Quick Response Teams (QRTs). There are 4 sets of QRT teams strolling around campus all the time and students, in case of any emergency, can call them 24 x 7 and they would be there to help you out within two to three minutes. QRT team is equipped with motorbikes and wireless sets. QRTs can be called on two numbers: 03222-281002, 03222-281003
3) Entry Passes for non-IIT students and staffs. Non IIT members now have to take a three month valid entry pass in order to cross through the campus. Once the validity is over, they need to renew the same. Without getting their entry passes checked, they can't go through the gates. 
4) More Wireless sets to security personnel. More than four dozens of Wireless sets have been procured and distributed to security personnel to enable effective communication and hence, quicker actions.
5) Proposal of Women Cell. A proposal for having Women QRT teams and more women security personnel is underway. 

Besides beefing up the security, they have also been actively involved in smooth conduction of Illumination, Durga Puja celebrations and other events happening in the campus. This, for sure, indicates that the security measures have been strengthen over recent months and we hope that it’s going to get better in future.

Earlier, Awaaz had communicated the need of CCTV cameras in the campus to the authorities based on our survey on Basic Amenities. And we are happy to see this getting implemented. 
2) Formation of Quick Response Teams (QRTs). There are 4 sets of QRT teams strolling around campus all the time and students, in case of any emergency, can call them 24 x 7 and they would be there to help you out within two to three minutes. QRT team is equipped with motorbikes and wireless sets. QRTs can be called on two numbers: 03222-281002, 03222-281003

message:
As directed by the MHRD, the institute will be celebrating "National Education Day 2018" on 11th November 2018 on account of the birth anniversary of Maulana Abul Kalam Azad, the first Education minister in the Indian Government. A floral tribute will be paid to him on the Institute Main Building Foyer at 10:45 am followed by a workshop on the topic "Curriculum Looking Ahead". This workshop is scheduled to be held in the Bhatnagar Auditorium from 11 am to 12 noon and will be organized and coordinated by the Dean, Planning and Coordination. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges all the students/ faculties and staffs to attend/ participate in these events.

Results | Illumination and Rangoli 2018
Continuing the distinctive tradition of celebrating Diwali with uniquely weaved 'Illumination' and colourfully created 'Rangoli', KGPians have today presented an extraordinary example of relentless effort and perseverance that spanned over the last two months demanding each ounce of blood and sweat from the students. Enormous were the efforts, and so has been the outcome! Not a single pair of eyes were left undazzled with the elegance of Illuminations and Rangolis. Though each and every hall produced best of the Rangolis and Illumination with the collective efforts of boarders, still the results are as follows:

Illumination:
Gold - RP Hall
Silver - LBS Hall
Bronze - RK Hall
Honourable Mention (4th Position) - MS Hall 

Rangoli:
Gold - RK Hall
Silver - LBS Hall 
Bronze - RP Hall 
Honourable Mention (4th Position) - Azad Hall

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning halls and applauds the efforts put in by students to make this celebration successful.

Deepawali, 'a row of lights', a festival celebrated with fervorous gaiety, is the period of time to attain full inner illumination and inexhaustible spiritual wealth of the self. As the holy occasion of Diwali is here and the atmosphere is filled with the spirit of mirth and love, it is the right time to enlighten one's understanding with the help of supreme light of lights. Let's lighting up the candles to enjoy life, have decorations to light life and have presents to share success. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone to prosper gloriously on the material as well as spiritual planes and urge everyone to celebrate the festival in the true sense by spreading joy and light up the world of others.

Considering the risks involved activities during Illumination right from climbing on and swiftly descending from the tables at considerable heights to put diyas on the chatai including involvement of a lot of oil and fire, we believe that the students' safety should be of foremost importance. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had voiced its concerns with the administration regarding the safety measures as we had an email correspondence with the Gymkhana president and proposed that some concrete guidelines be given to all the halls to be followed apart from some safety and security measures from the institute. The administration was quick to respond and many of our suggestions were incorporated in the recently released security guidelines (attached below).
We had a talk with Prof William Mohanty, president TSG about the same and he agreed that we shall have some safety standards to be followed strictly as the set of rules in the competition, and train some students from the halls beforehand for swift action in case of accidents next year onwards.
Security Advisory Notice: https://erp.iitkgp.ac.in/InfoCellDetails/resources/external/groupemailfile?file_id=266&fbclid=IwAR2qO6S63ipF2VnLZL2hludltSdalKWa8UrdEmeoLl8RU3kIq6cbjd9UuKc

The MHRD initiative for "Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat" will be celebrated for the states of Jharkhand and Goa this weekend. 
The celebrations will start with the food fest which will be having delicacies of both the states. It will be held at Kazi Nazrul Community Centre on 9th of November from 4 pm. The event will be continued on the next day with a Cultural Programme showcasing the cultural heritage of both states. This will be held at Kalidas Auditorium on 10th November from 6 pm.

Prof. Mrigank Sharad, one of the most celebrated young professors at IIT Kharagpur is often flooded with the questions pertaining to whether the students should go abroad for higher studies, and if yes, one should opt for MS or for PhD during his interaction with students. In the following article, he has aptly explained the intricacies involved in taking decisions for one's future as he concludes, "The key is NOT to fall for fanciful ideas, which excite you initially, without understanding the BIG Picture and the overall scheme of things. Don't freeze your choices too early during your UG studies. Keep looking, keep listening and keep reading to improve your understanding and maturity level."
The students are advised to have a look at this article. Please be informed that Prof. Mrigank Sharad has been President of India Gold Medalist at IIT Kharagpur and he wishes to write a series of articles addressing similar issues.
https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/bright-engineering-grads-india-grad-school-admits-i-mrigank-sharad/?fbclid=IwAR0zf6WxXzTiiDMow_ClcRU8biIHWFZ5GoiGMyHOOU3Bp_Fi0o3vxVvvVQU

Prof. Mrigank Sharad, one of the most celebrated young professors at IIT Kharagpur is often flooded with the questions pertaining to whether the students should go abroad for higher studies, and if yes, one should opt for MS or for PhD during his interaction with students. In the following article, he has aptly explained the intricacies involved in taking decisions for one's future as he concludes, "The key is NOT to fall for fanciful ideas, which excite you initially, without understanding the BIG Picture and the overall scheme of things. Don't freeze your choices too early during your UG studies. Keep looking, keep listening and keep reading to improve your understanding and maturity level."

Diwali, the festival of light, demarcates the return of Lord Rama and happiness in the lives of the people of Ayodhya. Joy and happiness spread like the light of diyas as more people join hands to understand each other's misery and help each other out. This Diwali, SARTH has taken an initiative to lend a tint of happiness to the faces of underprivileged children going to an open school in the village of Khesihari by collecting school bags and clothes for them. The collection drive operates via the collection boxes kept at suitable places at every hall of residence. Let us join hands in this initiative and help in giving someone a reason to smile this Diwali.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes them best of luck for their kind initiative

As part of the Unity Drive, to mark the occasion of Sardar Patel's 143rd birth anniversary, the boarders of Patel Hall visited an orphanage named 'Ambassador Child Home' which is a shelter to 61 girls and 32 boys on Saturday. The children presented a small dance performance for the visitors. Some books, notebooks, board games like Ludo, etc were donated by the boarders of Patel Hall. A Blood Donation Camp was also organized in Patel Hall on Sunday, which saw an overwhelming participation of students from all halls of residence. A team from Calcutta National Medical College was invited to conduct the camp. A total of 160 units of blood was donated which is the highest in the last 5 years.

message:
'Run for Unity' was organised today morning at Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur around 6.30 AM to mark the birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabh Bhai Patel. Since 2013, October 31 is celebrated as the ‘Rashtriya Ekta Diwas’ (National Unity Day) to commemorate the legacy of Sardar Patel, who is credited for bringing India's princely states under one flag after independence. The run was organised to pay tribute to the Iron Man of India Vallabhbhai Patel, who was instrumental in keeping India united.
The event saw a good turnout from the students, staffs and faculties. Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG) and other dignitaries were present on the occasion and participated in the run.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 21 new photos — with Shivam Gupta and 7 others.

message:
Conducting Inter IIT Sports Meet is a subject of great honor as well as responsibility. As we all know, IIT KGP will be hosting Inter IIT Sports Meet ‘19. For the very same and to boost the sports infrastructure on the campus, new playgrounds are under construction. 
There are 2 basketball and 2 volleyball courts being made in the PAN loop. Also, numerous workers have been employed for renovating Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The construction work was supposed to be over by 24th November but there is a delay and it is now expected to be over within a couple of months and we would be having new playgrounds and renovated Jnan Ghosh Stadium in the next semester. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur believes that this would be a huge boost for the sports' enthusiasts and would go a long way in defining KGP's sports culture.

The IIT Kharagpur round of Hult Prize 2018 was held today at Kalidas Auditorium. Over 50 teams from IIT Kharagpur pitched their ideas on social enterprise before a panel of 6 judges at Hult Prize Foundation at IIT Kharagpur. The winners are as follows:

Winner:
Team ‘Mettle’: Harshit Garg, Priyank Sangani, Rajat Maheshwari and Shivendra Gautam  

Runner-up:
Team 'Tillagers': Gaurav Kumar Singh, Garvit Anand, Rishab Nahata and Sauvik Pal.

Team 'Mettle' will represent IIT Kharagpur in the regional round of Hult Prize to be held in March 2019.

We congratulate the teams for their success!

As our world becomes ever more complex and stressful, developing our capacity for dynamic balance in our lives, work, and relationships becomes ever more vital to understand and embody in our own lives and to model for others whose lives we influence. It is now time when we students and staff realize that institute wellness cannot be brought forth just by certain groups of people but each and every person must need to play their role in it. We need to get out of our comfort zones and mingle with strangers to lend a helping hand to those who depress themselves with loneliness and other thoughts bothering them. We need to stand up for our fellow mates and that is what Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur requests from the masses.

Students of IIT Kharagpur have made us all proud again by securing the third position in TMUxMIT Hackathon 2018, organized at Taipei Medical University Da'an Campus - B2 on Hackathon on October 19 - 21, 2018. The team of Pradeep Poddar (15MT3EP01), Ipsita Praharaj (15AR10022), Akhil Raj (15MA20057) and Ajay Kumar Singh (15MI31021) achieved this feat in this hackathon on Health IoT (HiOT), thereby bagging a cash prize of NT$ 40,000. 
Many industry leaders from across the MIT, Harvard, and TMU participated in this Hackathon. Teams were asked to help the doctors and medical students with data modeling and presentation. Teams were provided with data from eICU Philips and MIMIC III. 
KGP team secured the third position on the prototype i.e. Maintaining Blood Sugar Level in ICU and were awarded 40KNT$ for the same. They have been further invited for a research project by Dr. Shabbir at TMU. They were invited by Dr. Shabbir Syed-Abdul(Associate Professor, Taipei Medical University) to attend the TMUxMIT Hackathon on the recommendation of Dr. Ram Babu Roy Sir (Assistant Professor, Rajendra Mishra School of Engg. Entrepreneurship, IIT Kharagpur)

Awaaz. IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team on their success!

Awaaz. IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team on their success!

Students of IIT Kharagpur have made us all proud again by securing the third position in TMUxMIT Hackathon 2018, organized at Taipei Medical University Da'an Campus - B2 on Hackathon on October 19 - 21, 2018. The team of Pradeep Poddar (15MT3EP01), Ipsita Praharaj (15AR10022), Akhil Raj (15MA20057) and Ajay Kumar Singh (15MI31021) achieved this feat in this hackathon on Health IoT (HiOT), thereby bagging a cash prize of NT$ 40,000. 
Many industry leaders from across the MIT, Harvard, and TMU participated in this Hackathon. Teams were asked to help the doctors and medical students with data modeling and presentation. Teams were provided with data from eICU Philips and MIMIC III. 
KGP team secured the third position on the prototype i.e. Maintaining Blood Sugar Level in ICU and were awarded 40KNT$ for the same. They have been further invited for a research project by Dr. Shabbir at TMU. They were invited by Dr. Shabbir Syed-Abdul(Associate Professor, Taipei Medical University) to attend the TMUxMIT Hackathon on the recommendation of Dr. Ram Babu Roy Sir (Assistant Professor, Rajendra Mishra School of Engg. Entrepreneurship, IIT Kharagpur)

“You don’t have to be a Doctor to save lives. Just donate blood, it’s safe, it’s simple and it saves lives too”

Patel Hall of Residence is organizing a Blood Donation Camp as part of its Unity Drive which was launched earlier in this week to honor Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel on his 143rd Birth Anniversary.

Date: 28th Oct’18 (Sunday)
Time: 11.30 AM Onwards
Venue: Patel Hall

Please take note of the following-
1. Girls/Women can also participate in this camp.
2. Donors are requested to have an early breakfast at least 2 hours before the donation as it is a strict medical requirement.
3. Refreshments will be provided after the donation.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the entire student community to be a part of this social initiative.

In order to develop innovative programmes which could cooperate core curricula in science and engineering disciplines with philosophy, reasoning, and liberal arts, IIT Kharagpur is all set to establish India’s first of its kind Academy of Leadership envisioning the advancement of education. The Partha S. Ghosh Academy of Leadership will be seed funded for USD 1 million by distinguished alumnus, a renowned management consultant and philanthropist Partha S. Ghosh. The initiative has been facilitated by Mr. Ron Gupta, President, IIT Kharagpur Foundation USA along with Prof. Subrata Chattopadhyay, Dean, Alumni Affairs, IIT Kharagpur.

Source: https://www.dailypioneer.com/2018/state-editions/alumnus-to-give--1-million-for-leadership-academy-at-iit-kharagpur.html

After the thrilling response and acceptance to the previous sessions of Talk with the Director, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents its next installment where the director spoke about his most difficult times as a director of an institute (00:00) and about the Medical facilities inside the campus (03:40). After speaking on the medical facilities, he expressed his take on the Open house conducted last year (04:45). After these sensitive topics, the director spoke about the protests regarding fee hikes in the campus (06:48). Followed by this the director gave his views upon students raising their voices on political agendas prevailing in the nation (10:41). Moreover, the Director also talked about whether the visions which were kept in mind while forming the IIT’s, have been executed(13:40). Finally, the director gave an inspiring message to the students(15:33).
Check out the video to find out the views and perspectives of one of the most passionate and impactful persons in our institute!

The Youtube link for the video is here: https://youtu.be/hj1vnrcpPqg

Armed with his knowledge, wit, and artistic flair,
R.K. Laxman did nothing less than unleash himself upon   this country. His bold stance and perspectives on political underpinnings have been admirable through the years, and undoubtedly enjoyed by all – the young and the old, the lay and the proficient.
R.K. Laxman won numerous awards for his cartoons, including Asia’s top journalism award, the Ramon Magsaysay Award, in 1984.
In 2005, the Government of India honored him with the 'Padma Vibhushan.' 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur pays homage to 'The Common Man' cartoonist on his 97th birth anniversary.

'Valmiki Jayanti' is celebrated as the birthday of the famous poet Maharshi Valmiki. It is especially very popular in Northern India and is known as 'Pargat Diwas.'
Maharshi Valmiki is also known as 'Adi Kavi' as he discovered the first Sloka which set the base of Sanskrit poetry. Maharshi Valmiki is the author of the famous Hindu epic Ramayana and one of the greatest saints of the ancient world. His complete life and teachings have always encouraged Humans to fight against social injustice. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur remembers Maharishi Valmiki on this auspicious day of 'Valmiki Jayanti.'

For promoting science and technology in India along with harnessing scientific knowledge for the cause of humanity and national welfare and to promote and maintain liaison between Science and Humanities, the Indian National Science Academy Teachers award has been awarded to Prof. Srabani Taraphder from the Department of Chemistry. Her astonishing effort for developing extensive computational methods of studying proton transfer reactions using a wide range of simulation methods including classical and quantum mechanical-molecular mechanical molecular dynamics simulations was recognized by the Academy and thus helped her to get into the list of  Awardees. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur extends it’s heartiest Congratulations to Prof Srabani Taraphder for her achievement and getting a price of Rs.50,000. 

 List of all other Awardees can be found from the following link:  http://insaindia.res.in/teacher_award_list.php

The revised tariffs for the booking of Class Rooms, Auditoriums and Halls for Nalanda Complex, SR Complex and Old Academic Complex to be implemented with immediate effect are attached below. These plans are based on 4 and 8 hours duration and the prices are different for outsiders and insiders. The reasons for the following revision will be clarified soon. However, there is nothing to worry about for the KGP students. As per the Vice President (TSG) and Registrar, the charges are not applicable for KGP students for their internal activities. All the student organised activities that used to be carried out earlier will not be charged for and will keep happening as usual. The rectified circular stating the same will be out within a couple of days. The process of booking venues also remains the same.
Stay tuned to our page for further updates!

The much-awaited Placement process is about to have a brimming start from the coming Monday and with all the hustle and tussle of tests and PPTs along with some pent-up confusion in the mind, these winters won't be the same chilled up as usual. Why let your confusion hinder your preparation? Ever thought whom to contact to clear your doubts regarding the placement process, whether it be CV verification process or be it the need to attend the PPTs or trusting the right medium to get the most updated information? Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had a talk with the current PlaceComs to clear up all your queries. 

Have a look at the session to have a better preparation for the upcoming placement season.

http://awaaziitkgp.org/placement_queries.php

The festival Dussehra is celebrated to commemorate the victory of Lord Rama over the demon Ravana and the triumph of good over evil.
 
This Dussehra, may Lord Rama bless you with the strength and courage to follow the path of virtue and fill your life with lots of prosperity, happiness, and success.  
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes you all a very Happy Dussehra.

In the recent QS Indian University rankings IITs continue to be on the top spots. The QS Indian University rankings include public universities, private universities and higher education institutions or deemed universities.

A total of 7 IITs secured spots under top 10 in QS Indian university rankings '19.
IIT Bombay secured the top position followed by IISc Bengaluru on the second position. IIT Madras stands on the third position in Indian university rankings. IIT Delhi, which is above IIT Madras in world ranking, stands on the fourth spot in Indian ranking. IIT Kharagpur and IIT Kanpur are interestingly on fifth and sixth spot respectively in Indian University rankings whereas in world rankings IIT Kanpur is above IIT Kharagpur. University of Delhi is at the seventh spot whereas University of Hyderabad is at the eight place. IIT Roorkee, IIT Guwahati, are among other IITs which are under top 10, they stood on the ninth and tenth place respectively.

Twenty Indian institutions received full marks in the staff with PhD, the indicator designed to identify the extent to which institutions are cultivating a highly-qualified faculty body. 
Moreover, MIT secured the top rank in QS World University rankings for the seventh consecutive year.

Under the QS University rankings survey the universities are evaluated mainly by this six metrics: Academic reputation, Employer Reputation, Student to faculty ratio, Citations per faculty, International faculty ratio and International student ratio.

Major IITs lacked the International faculty and students aspect of the survey. The citations per faculty aspect of IISc Bengaluru was the best among Indian universities with 100/100 points.

https://indianexpress.com/article/education/qs-university-rankings-2019-iit-iisc-grab-top-slots-check-complete-list-5404012/

Twenty Indian institutions received full marks in the staff with PhD, the indicator designed to identify the extent to which institutions are cultivating a highly-qualified faculty body. 
Moreover, MIT secured the top rank in QS World University rankings for the seventh consecutive year.

Under the QS University rankings survey the universities are evaluated mainly by this six metrics: Academic reputation, Employer Reputation, Student to faculty ratio, Citations per faculty, International faculty ratio and International student ratio.

Major IITs lacked the International faculty and students aspect of the survey. The citations per faculty aspect of IISc Bengaluru was the best among Indian universities with 100/100 points.

https://indianexpress.com/article/education/qs-university-rankings-2019-iit-iisc-grab-top-slots-check-complete-list-5404012/

Great dreamers are those who dream a bit beyond their limits and, usually, they are the ones who can think out of the box. One such dreamer was Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, widely renowned as the Missile Man of India, he was honored with the highest civilian award of the country, the Bharat Ratna in the year 1997.

He served as the 11th president of India from 2002 to 2007 and worked as a scientist and science administrator at DRDO and ISRO. Throughout his life, he was intimately involved in India's civilians space programme and military missile development programmes along with Pokhran-II nuclear tests in 1998. 
Despite all this, he always preferred to call himself a teacher. Being a visionary, he always envisioned India's potential in its children and youth.  He strongly advocated education for all to develop rational and scientific thinking right from the start.

An inspiration to endless people in the country, a true example of simple living and always young at heart. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur remembers Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam on his 87th birth anniversary.

With profound grief, we bring to you the news of the demise of our beloved Professor Brajbhushan Pandey. He was a well-known Transportation and Highway Engineer throughout the world.

Prof. Brajbhushan Pandey (retd.) was a 1961 graduate of Civil Engineering from IIT Kharagpur and joined as a faculty here in the year 1964. He served as HoD of the Civil Engineering Department between 1993 and 1996. He had outstanding contributions to the development of both urban and rural road and transportation infrastructure throughout the country at a time when it was in its most crucial stage. As a member of many government schemes and organizations such as National Rural Road Development Agency and the Technical committee of Indian Roads Congress to say a few, he helped pave the path to better roads in the country and development of state of the art equipment for testing of road and road materials. He received many accolades from various scientific and government organizations for outstanding research contributions and was honored with the Distinguish Alumnus Award of IIT Kharagpur in 2011.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur extends its deepest condolences to family and friends of the Professor along with the entire KGP community. We hope that his contributions will be remembered and built upon.

IIT Kharagpur had a phenomenal start to their Inter IIT campaign this year as they finished second in swimming garnering 47 points. 
IIT Madras topped the points chart with 53 points while IIT Kanpur ended a distant third at 21 points. IIT Bombay stood fourth with 20 points. A total of 6 IIT's opened their account in points table out of 11 participants. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and hopes that this performance in water sports would be carried forward in other sports as well.

Right from the beginning, Men's Water Polo team was buckled-up to play on fiddle, and this picture became more evident when it was the time for the final four. The team displayed a flawless show to destroy the opponent teams, thus resulting in five successive wins and topped the chart with 15 points. In the process, the team handed over a perfect mauling to whatever that came in between them and the trophy. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire Water Polo team on their splendid performance.

After a phenomenal performance of IIT Kharagpur at the inter IIT aquatics meet held in IIT Guwahati where IIT Kharagpur stood second in the points table, another achievement was unlocked when IIT KGP showcased its talent and proved its mettle in Udghosh, the annual sports meet organized by IIT Kanpur from 4th-7th October. Udghosh proved to be an excellent stage for showcasing IIT KGP’s sporting spirit and gave a slingshot in boosting the confidence of the teams for the upcoming Inter IIT Sports Meet to be held in IIT Guwahati. 

The medal-winning teams of IIT KGP in Udghosh 2018-19 are as follows:
1. Chess - Gold medal
2. Badminton Women's- Silver medal
3. Basketball Men's- Silver medal
4. Lawn Tennis Men's- Silver medal
5. Lawn Tennis Women’s- Silver medal
6. Hockey- Bronze medal
7. Squash- Bronze medal
8. Weightlifting- Bronze medal 

We wish that both, the beautiful form of KGP’s sportspersons and the winning streak continues. 
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the participants and wishes them great luck for Inter IIT Sports meet 2018-19.
#KGPKaTempoHighHai

In order to facilitate cooperation in research and education between the two institutes, an MoU has been signed between IIT Kharagpur and Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU). This would act as bliss for both the institutions as both the institutions are having trans-disciplinary academic and research programs encompassing science, technology, medicine, social sciences, arts and fine arts. The key areas of focus under this MoU will be Hydro Power, Ocean Modelling, Deep Sea Resources and Marine Technology in which the NTNU has an expertise.

Source: https://www.ndtv.com/education/iit-kharagpur-norwegian-university-of-science-and-technology-ntnu-ink-mou-1931263

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Prof. Surjya K Pal (Department of Mechanical Engineering) for being appointed as the new Associate Dean Of Alumni Affairs. We wish him to take the alumni relationships to new heights under their guidance. He did his B.E from Government Engineering College, Jalpaiguri, WB (1st Class, 3rd Rank) and did his masters and Ph.D. from IIT Kanpur and IIT Kharagpur respectively. 

Prof Surjya K. Paul has held the following  responsibilities in the past :
• Prof-in-Charge, DHI Centre of Excellence on Advanced Manufacturing Technology
• Chairman, Steel Technology Centre
• Chairman, H.M.C

After the exhilarating response to the first two sessions of the Talk with the Director, Awaaz IIT Kharagpur presents its next segment where the Director IIT Kharagpur talks about our standing among the world's topmost universities and the reasons hampering IIT KGP to reach top 100 in QS rankings (00:00), his views over our absence in recently released IoE list while Jio institute making  it to the list (05:52), his opinion on whether the supernumerary seats for girls in IITs is a step in the right direction (09:55), about the importance of a media body (14:02) and finally his take on things that can be done apart from the work done by Awaaz (15:10).
Check out the video to find out the views and perspectives of one of the most passionate and impactful person in our institute!

Attention Final Year Students!
The placement season is set to arrive again as the sweet winter breeze of early mornings and late nights has started to flow. The weeklong DP holidays acting as the silence before the bustle of placement season. Alongwith this bustle comes a lot of confusion in the mind of students including whom to contact, what documents do you need, what are the procedures in case of multiple shortlisting and many others. Well, this ain't confusing you much but for the placement season ahead, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur has taken the initiative to clear all types of doubts amongst the students regarding placement processes that remain unanswered. Ask any of your doubts and we will get you all the answers right from the desk of CDC PlaceComs and Staff. Your doubt maybe the doubt of many people and even if it is not, it may help generate greater clarity regarding placement processes. We encourage all the Final Year Students to write freely all their queries in the attached form and contribute to an environment of greater lucidity during the high time.
All the Best!

https://goo.gl/forms/Rh8nftiwCKCh2hIY2

Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur and Professor, Department of Computer Science & Engineering is being awarded Technology Excellence Award by Intel India. He joined the institute as a faculty member in 1988. His areas of interest include AI, CAD for VLSI, Embedded Systems, Algorithm Design, and Reliable & Fault-Tolerant Systems. He is also an awardee of Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology, one of the highest multidisciplinary science award in India, for the engineering category in 2000 and President of India Gold Medal in 1985.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes our professor all the best in his future endeavours!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes our professor all the best in his future endeavours!

Mental well-being, a combination of emotional, psychological, and social well-being, plays a very important role along with physical fitness. Students often go through a lot of stress throughout their college life. It is, however, important to keep moving ahead in life and face all the obstacles encountered with optimism. As it is rightly said, your present circumstances don’t determine where you go, they merely determine where you start. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes for the good mental health of the entire KGP Family.

Do you find your mess messy or canteens a bit unregulated? Be it in terms of food quality, or hygiene, or occasional crowding (of students, cats, and dogs), or timings, everybody has a lot to say (or rant?) about his/her hall's mess. Here we are, with a survey specifically designed to address the issues pertaining to the mess as well the canteens, and their monitoring. This survey will play a very important role in bringing forth the problems faced by the students into the light of the administration and relevant monitoring committees so that they could take appropriate steps. Critical analysis of the issues as important as mess and canteens is impossible without the opinion of the student community, hence Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur earnestly requests each and every student to invest a little time for the benefit of everyone.
https://goo.gl/forms/Z9rVC9XvGuvsvM2z2

Talk with the Director | Part-2
After the well received and thrilling response over the first session of the Talk with the Director, Awaaz IIT Kharagpur presents its next installment where the Director elaborates over the minimal city life of IIT Kharagpur and his discern over this issue followed by its pro and cons(0:01), his thoughts over the change in the course content that must be implemented to make the students more employable in the industries (3:25) which is followed by the discussion on the freedom given to students to opt for the micro-specialization courses of Industrial Systems and Engineering department(8:03). After which, we deviated from the above topic and asked him to share incidents about his student life and his involvement in the hall activities(9:07)succeeding this he gave his takes on the present conditions of the Hall and Mess Maintenance and how they can be made more efficient(12:24). Finally, we concluded with an interrogation about Vision 2020 and project Vishwajeet(17:04).
Check out the video to find out the views and perspectives of one of the most passionate and impactful person in our institute!

IIT Kharagpur wins Gold in Water Polo at the 34th Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet!

Dominating throughout the tournament, the IIT KGP men's Water Polo team on Sunday defeated arch-rivals IIT Kanpur by 10-6 in the finals of Inter IIT water polo Championship to lift the cup.
Before in the championship, IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Bombay by 13-2, IIT Delhi by 17-2, and IIT Madras by 6-3 in the pool stage, after which it knocked out the hosts IIT Guwahati by 13-2 in the Semi-Finals.

Amlan Shil, Captain of IIT KGP Men's Water Polo Team wins the Best Water Polo Player Award. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the whole KGPian community on this Achievement.

Amlan Shil, Captain of IIT KGP Men's Water Polo Team wins the Best Water Polo Player Award. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the whole KGPian community on this Achievement.

IIT Kharagpur wins Gold in Water Polo at the 34th Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet!

Dominating throughout the tournament, the IIT KGP men's Water Polo team on Sunday defeated arch-rivals IIT Kanpur by 9-6 in the finals of Inter IIT water polo Championship to lift the cup.
Before in the championship, IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Bombay by 13-2, IIT Delhi by 17-2, and IIT Madras by 6-3 in the pool stage, after which it knocked out the hosts IIT Guwahati by 13-2 in the Semi-Finals.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the whole KGPian community on the Championship which has come home.

message:
Talk with the Director | Part-1
We had our expectations, and he had his challenges, but among these, there stood a man who has served the Institute for more than 37 years as a student, professor and currently as the Director. Professor Partha P Chakrabarti, famously called as ‘PPC’ among the students, has his style of leadership. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had the opportunity to have a chat with the Director IIT Kharagpur on all the issues relevant to the institute which directly and indirectly affect the KGP fraternity. In this video interview, he talks about the responsibilities of being a Director (0:00), the difficulties of handling such a large mass of the population in the campus (1:31), the difference between the student communities of our time as compared to that of his (3:40) and what spurred such  change in the mindset of students (7:01) which was finally followed by the agendas he had for the institute and to what extent were these executed (8:30). Check out the video to find out the views and perspectives of one of the most passionate and impactful people in our institute!

34th Inter IIT Aquatics Meet | Day 3
| Swimming |
The thrilling performance of IIT KGP swimmers continued as the team bagged one Gold, two Silver and one Bronze medal along with one 4th position.

| Water Polo |
The Men’s Water Polo team continued its dominance and defeated IIT MADRAS by the final scoreline of 6-3 in IIT KGP’s favor. This is the third win of the team in a row. The Men’s Water Polo team is into the semi-finals, unbeaten, which will be played against IIT GUWAHATI.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners.
Stay tuned for further updates and medal tally.

KGPians have proved it again that when it comes to help people out and contribute to the cause of Kerala Flood victims, they are more than willing to go to any length. It's a pleasure to inform you all that a total amount of Rs. 6.3 lakhs was raised from all the halls through the proposal and implementation of the fund-raising idea by Students' Senate. This goes on to prove that students have been very generous in donating the money for the cause of Kerala Flood victims.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur thanks all the students who donated generously and other stakeholders who conceived this idea and implemented it.

This goes on to prove that students have been very generous in donating the money for a good cause. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur thanks all the students who donated generously and other stakeholders who conceived this idea and implemented it.

AI is quite ubiquitous in today's life and having knowledge of the same is understandably necessary. CodeClub, Department Society of Computer Science and Engg. , is pleased to organize up.AI Summit, a programme open to all, aimed at introducing beginners to the field of AI and reducing the complexity of the topic. 
The 3-day programme will involve a Bootcamp, talks by eminent personalities and leaders in the field from companies such as Wadhwani AI, Capillary, Jio etc. and a contest with exciting prizes and goodies to win. 
The last part of the summit is a 3-month challenge where students structure real-life problems in the specific domains - industry, education, healthcare, and environment/agriculture and find a solution to those problems. Top 10 teams get the chance to be incubated by big tech companies and the top 3 out of them get cash prizes.
Join them on 5th, 6th and 7th Oct and be a part of the ever-growing AI community.
Stay tuned to page (https://www.facebook.com/upaisummit) and website (upai-summit.in) for updates.

Today marks the 150th birth anniversary of a man, whose arrival blessed the soil of India, and took us on a path of enlightenment. He taught us self-reliance by spinning khadi, gave this world the noble idea of 'Ahinsa' and led India's independence movement against the British.                                                          Mahatma Gandhi is the ambassador of world peace and harmony, and continues to be the inspiration for millions of people across the world. Whole world celebrates this day as International Non-violence day in his honour.                      
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur salutes the father of the nation and wishes you all a Happy Gandhi Jayanti.

The initiative of screening live matches and events got off to a great start as the enthusiastic cricket fans turned up in large numbers for the Asia Cup Final between India and Bangladesh, screened at Netaji Auditorium. A nail-biting finish with India just managing to get over the line served as icing on the cake for the fans. The enthusiasm and intensity of the audience in Netaji Auditorium were no less than the ones sitting in the stadium itself. Everyone cheered their hearts out for our team and celebrated the victory in unison. Initially, when Bangladesh came to bat, the auditorium was sparsely filled but as their innings progressed, the crowd started building up and when India started their chase, the auditorium was fully occupied in no time. 
The initiative was one of the proposals of Vaibhav Khatwani, current General Secretary, Social and Cultural, and he was extremely positive of the overwhelming response from the student community and support from Devang Upadhyay, Secretary Films and  Prof. Amreesh Chandra, Vice-Chairman, TFS and other concerned stakeholders. Although this screening was conducted by an external vendor this time, Technology Film Society is expected to carry out the same with its own budget for future screenings.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates this initiative to bring out the work-life balance in our campus and hopes to witness more such screenings in the future!

message:
After the Mid-Semester exams were over, KGP saw the graceful presence of the fifth Indian chess Grandmaster Mr. Surya Shekhar Ganguly on its campus. He enlightened the students with his vast repertoire of experiences regarding chess and various related tournaments. He was an International Master at 16 and a Grandmaster at 19. He was also the 2009 Asian champion and six-time Indian Champion. He shared his real-life incidents on the way to becoming one India's most celebrated chess player and his encounters with the greats in the chess including five-time World Chess Champion Vishwanathan Anand. With his witty and humorous answers, he shared his wisdom about the career in chess and the need to begin early at the age of 4-5 to perform well at a good platform soon. The students had an active participation with many questions towards the end. This fruitful and interactive session was organized and conducted smoothly by the Sports and Games Committee, IIT Kharagpur. Also,  Chess Club IIT Kharagpur presented a poem at the end of the session.
Dignitaries present in the session included Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean, SA) and Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG)
Picture credits: Hemanth Addada
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 24 new photos — with Saurabh Desai and Aditya Meshram.

message:
After the Mid-Semester exams were over, KGP saw the graceful presence of the fifth Indian chess Grandmaster Mr. Surya Shekhar Ganguly on its campus. He enlightened the students with his vast repertoire of experiences regarding chess and various related tournaments. He was an International Master at 16 and a Grandmaster at 19. He was also the 2009 Asian champion and six-time Indian Champion. He shared his real-life incidents on the way to becoming one India's most celebrated chess player and his encounters with the greats in the chess including five-time World Chess Champion Vishwanathan Anand. With his witty and humorous answers, he shared his wisdom about the career in chess and the need to begin early at the age of 4-5 to perform well at a good platform soon. The students had an active participation with many questions towards the end. The session was fruitful and interactive. Also,  Chess Club IIT Kharagpur presented a poem at the end of the session.
Dignitaries present in the session included Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean, SA) and Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG)
Picture credits: Chess club, IIT Kharagpur

message:
Technology Film Society has come up with a new initiative of live screening relevant events and matches, and the first in such a series of events is the Asia Cup Final match between India and Bangladesh. A departure from regular movie shows on weekends, this initiative, would surely prove to be appealing for the KGP community to come out of the rooms and watch the high octane sports encounters together with fellow students. 

The live streaming is going to start at 5:00 pm IST in Netaji Auditorium tomorrow and the movie show for the students stands cancelled owing to this. The show has been rescheduled to 10:00 am on Sunday. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates the initiative and hopes that it proves to be a great success.

Post Office Passport Seva Kendra (POPSK) was inaugurated today, September 27, 2018 at the Technology Mukhya Dakghar. It was inaugurated by Honourable MLA, Shri. Dilip Ghosh, Kharagpur Sadar. Started with the motive to reduce the hardships faced by the people, the portal was opened for 10 applicants today which will be increased to 30 from September 28, 2018. However, the limit can be extended on demand in future, as told by  Regional Passport Officer, Shri. Bibhuti Bhushan Kumar.  Appointments will be released on POPSK website www.passportindia.gov.in.

Applicants are supposed to bring online Application Reference Number (ARN) sheets along with other necessary documents of identity proof, address and proof of date of birth with them. The applicants have to pay the passport fees through online payments system.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur considers this as a landmark step and hopes that it will benefit all the faculty and student community in future.

message:
Train services that have been severely disturbed due to the Adivasi agitation since yesterday morning have been restored to normalcy. On a telephonic conversation with us, the DRM of Kharagpur Division has stated that the local trains have started plying on the KGP-HWH-KGP route while the express trains are somewhat delayed due to the detention of several trains on different stations. However, we advise everyone to have a look at the details of cancelled and rescheduled trains before embarking on any journey. 
Link to the report of disruption in railway services: https://www.financialexpress.com/infrastructure/railways/train-services-in-south-eastern-railways-kharagpur-division-hit-by-adivasi-agitation/1325145/

Hardik Aggarwal, a first year student from IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the prestigious Aditya Birla Scholarship 2018. Aditya Birla Scholarship is awarded to few talented and deserving students from IITs, IIMs and other reputed colleges. 
This year 15 first year students of the premier engineering institutes have been selected from among the 35 shortlisted candidates through an interview held at Hotel ITC Grand Central in Mumbai on 22nd September. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him on this achievement!

साहित्य के सितारे ।। भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र 

भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र को आधुनिक हिंदी के पितामह के नाम से जाना जाता है। हिंदी साहित्य में आधुनिक काल का आगमन भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र के काल से ही माना जाता है। इनका मूल नाम 'हरिश्चंद्र' था, इन्हें 'भारतेंदु ' की उपाधि दी गयी थी। उन्होंने देश में व्याप्त गरीबी, पराधीनता व अमानवीय शोषण को ही अपने साहित्य का लक्ष्य बनाया। हिन्दी को राष्ट्र भाषा का दर्जा दिलवाने में उन्होंने अपनी प्रतिभा का बखूबी इस्तेमाल किया। हिन्दी काव्य व पत्रकारिता के क्षेत्र में उनका अमूल्य योगदान रहा। हरिश्चंद्र बाबू का व्यक्तित्व और कृतित्व बहुआयामी था। उन्होंने आधुनिक हिंदी साहित्य की लगभग सभी विधाओं में योगदान दिया विशेषकर गद्य साहित्य में। हिंदी में नाटकों का प्रारम्भ भारतेन्दु हरिश्चंद्र से माना जाता है और इसकी शुरुआत बंगला के विद्यासुन्दर (1867) नाटक के अनुवाद से होती है। उन्होंने 'हरिश्चंद्र चन्द्रिका', 'कविवचन सुधा' और 'बाला बोधिनी' पत्रिकाओं का संपादन भी किया। वे एक उत्कृष्ट कवि, सशक्त व्यंग्यकार, सफल नाटककार, जागरूक पत्रकार तथा ओजस्वी गद्यकार थे। इसके अलावा वे लेखक, कवि, संपादक, निबंधकार, एवं कुशल वक्ता भी थे। उन्होंने मात्र चौंतीस वर्ष की आयु में एक विशाल साहित्य की रचना की।

अपनी इन्हीं विशेषताओं के कारण भारतेंदु हिन्दी साहित्याकाश के एक दैदिप्यमान नक्षत्र बन गए और उनका युग भारतेंदु युग के नाम से प्रसिद्ध हुआ।

अपनी इन्हीं विशेषताओं के कारण भारतेंदु हिन्दी साहित्याकाश के एक दैदिप्यमान नक्षत्र बन गए और उनका युग भारतेंदु युग के नाम से प्रसिद्ध हुआ।

साहित्य के सितारे ।। भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र 

भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र को आधुनिक हिंदी के पितामह के नाम से जाना जाता है। हिंदी साहित्य में आधुनिक काल का आगमन भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र के काल से ही माना जाता है। इनका मूल नाम 'हरिश्चंद्र' था, इन्हें 'भारतेंदु ' की उपाधि दी गयी थी। उन्होंने देश में व्याप्त गरीबी, पराधीनता व अमानवीय शोषण को ही अपने साहित्य का लक्ष्य बनाया। हिन्दी को राष्ट्र भाषा का दर्जा दिलवाने में उन्होंने अपनी प्रतिभा का बखूबी इस्तेमाल किया। हिन्दी काव्य व पत्रकारिता के क्षेत्र में उनका अमूल्य योगदान रहा। हरिश्चंद्र बाबू का व्यक्तित्व और कृतित्व बहुआयामी था। उन्होंने आधुनिक हिंदी साहित्य की लगभग सभी विधाओं में योगदान दिया विशेषकर गद्य साहित्य में। हिंदी में नाटकों का प्रारम्भ भारतेन्दु हरिश्चंद्र से माना जाता है और इसकी शुरुआत बंगला के विद्यासुन्दर (1867) नाटक के अनुवाद से होती है। उन्होंने 'हरिश्चंद्र चन्द्रिका', 'कविवचन सुधा' और 'बाला बोधिनी' पत्रिकाओं का संपादन भी किया। वे एक उत्कृष्ट कवि, सशक्त व्यंग्यकार, सफल नाटककार, जागरूक पत्रकार तथा ओजस्वी गद्यकार थे। इसके अलावा वे लेखक, कवि, संपादक, निबंधकार, एवं कुशल वक्ता भी थे। उन्होंने मात्र चौंतीस वर्ष की आयु में एक विशाल साहित्य की रचना की।

अपनी इन्हीं विशेषताओं के कारण भारतेंदु हिन्दी साहित्याकाश के एक दैदिप्यमान नक्षत्र बन गए और उनका युग भारतेंदु युग के नाम से प्रसिद्ध हुआ।

साहित्य के सितारे ।। भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र

Ankit Barde, an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, is fighting with an end-stage renal disease. His kidneys are functioning at less than 5% of its capacity. While he has been battling with kidney related ailments for almost one year now, the doctors have suggested him to undergo kidney transplant as last possible option which, understandably, is very much expensive.
We, as KGPians, should contribute our bit in support of a fellow KGPian in fighting this battle of life and death. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the KGP community to donate through the following fundraiser:
https://www.ketto.org/fundraiser/ankitbarde?utm_source=internal&utm_medium=fbpageshare&utm_campaign=ankitbarde

The need for people realizing the world as their home is increasing each day as we stand here to improve upon the present policies, technologies and take new initiatives to save the planet from a disaster. IIT KGP has always bred minds who think about not only the development of the nation but also the development and welfare of the world.

Another such person among these Jewels of KGP is Mr. Shrey Goyal.  A graduate from Mining Engineering department of IIT Kharagpur in 2011, Shrey chose an unconventional career choice when he co-founded ‘Sustainable Growth Initiative’, a startup that advises corporates and governments on energy security and works towards low carbon emissions. He also featured in the ‘Forbes India 30 Under 30’ list of 2016 in the NGO and Social category, at merely an age of 27 and was also a speaker at the COP21 climate conference in Paris. 

Read more about his journey and future plans in this next part of our series ‘Jewels of KGP’ - 
http://awaaziitkgp.org/Jewels_Shrey.php

Hello Freshers!
Your first interaction with KGP, its campus life and culture was through the induction programme. This was the second year straight on the part of the administration to organize such an ambitiously envisioned programme. You must be having a lot of pent-up thoughts and feelings about your first encounter with the KGP life- “The Induction Programme”. 
Progress brings with it the amelioration of the human condition. Your opinions matter a lot and so does your feedback. We, therefore, invite you to opine and provide the necessary feedback regarding the induction programme via this short and concise form. One minute of yours invested for this purpose is surely going to help the administration design the programme in a better way in the coming years for the betterment of the upcoming batches. This one minute of yours can prove to be decisive!
Why wait? 
Fill it up:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1DmkAyXpwFCP1bcWtz19PSfzaV2FW8jxrkIsdT7HPeHg

"The media is one of the most powerful entities in a democratic setup. They have the power to make the innocent look guilty and to make the guilty look innocent, and that's their power. Because they control the minds of the masses." These sentiments echoed by Malcolm X have been proved many a time. But unfortunately, in recent times media outlets are not dedicated to what they should actually be looking for- ethics and truthfulness. Lots of instances can be cited which suggest that media is running recklessly after sensationalism and profit, which sadly, is directly proportional to how one can engage the common people with a spicy gossip. This has led media tending to report rumors, speculations, and projections as facts and in turn, misleading the major chunk of masses into believing them.
A recent news in a leading newspaper daily stating that IITBHU would be providing training to become ideal daughter-in-law shook us. Although the news garnered a lot of mass attention and surely helped the media houses gain its warranted popularity, but at what cost? Defaming an institution of national importance can never be justified on grounds of a false news. IIT BHU director had to convene a meeting with the top officials regarding the news and the institute has sent the clarification to all the media houses. A startup which was incubated at IIT BHU was taking some steps and the reporter thought it necessary to highlight it as an IIT BHU initiative so as to get the attention of masses. (Link to the report: https://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-we-are-not-offering-an-ideal-daughter-in-law-course-iit-bhu-rejects-report-2659438)
IITs, being the premier institutes of India, have been a sought-after topic of news reporting for the media. The status of IITs as mere screening institutes for providing jobs after a few years of study has been created thanks to media highlighting only about the highly paid jobs here. The hype that has been created around IITs being such institutes have cost the nation its research potential and reputation has been compromised. It's high time that we stand against such ways of news reporting and believe in constructive journalism.

"One child, one teacher, one pen and one book can change the world", a quote by an activist for women education and the daughter of a teacher, Malala Yousafzai.

Rightly so, a teacher constantly fights to bring out the best in his students. He is the one who does not bid his pupil to enter the house of his wisdom rather leads them to the threshold of their minds. 

To fathom the pre-eminence of teachers in our lives the birth anniversary of Dr Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, the 5th of September is celebrated as Teacher's Day all over the country with great enthusiasm. He was a legendary teacher, first vice president and second President of India. Widely recognised and respected as one of the 20th century’s most respected Indian thinkers, he wasn’t just a teacher.
Awaaz wishes all a very Happy Teacher's Day.

On the eve of Janmashtami, various halls celebrated the birth anniversary of Lord Krishna with astounding enthusiasm. Different halls of residence including RP, RK, Patel, and BRH organized Intra-hall Matki Phod competition. The event started with the interaction program as a step towards the welfare of the students and building the community, which received immense participation and support from all boarders irrespective of year. In the loud, rocking music and continuous showers of water, students constantly kept their tempo high to break 'Dahi Handi'  hanged high, firstly year wise, then wing wise and at last, all together. Everyone fought hard to break Dahi handi and in the process, enjoyed a lot. Gifts were also distributed at the end. Along with these events, Antaakshari competition added the extra charm of music and joy. With the aim to enhance community building and student welfare, increase bonding and interaction among students, the event was a huge success.
   
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciate the efforts of all halls and consider this initiative as a great step in building a healthy and positive atmosphere among student community in the present situation.

message:
Teacher's Day Celebration 2018
Teacher's Day celebration took place in the campus on 2nd of September. The day witnessed the most bright start with sketching competition organized for school children, the venue being Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence whose students had arranged the celebration. Then came the evening of Teachers' Day celebration at Kalidas Auditorium which witnessed commendable participation from the students and the professors. It was an honor for IIT Kharagpur to have Indian Folk Exponent, Kalpana Patowary, who had lightened the closing ceremony of Commonwealth Games 2018 and sang in an album by The Coke Studio. During the event, she sang songs in various dialects like Bengali and Bhojpuri and also sang her own song which had been released by Coke Studio. Prof. Joy Sen played a piece on Sitar and Prof. Anandrup Bhattacharya sang classical Bollywood songs that echoed the auditorium with their melody. Various cultural events performed by the students of Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence drove through the evening that comprised of various dance performances; one was themed 'Expressionless' which was of a comic and lyrical genre. A rock and roll style dance performance, which was filled with a plethora of striking moments and twists, left the audience awestruck. A drama titled '9 reasons why you should have stayed home sick today' was presented which added an element of fun to the evening. Elocution by two students and a music performance also added to the celebration.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 15 new photos — with Rupak Thakur and 8 others.

Prof. Joy Sen played a piece on Sitar and Prof. Anandrup Bhattacharya sang classical Bollywood songs that echoed the auditorium with their melody. Various cultural events performed by the students of Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence drove through the evening that comprised of various dance performances; one was themed 'Expressionless' which was of a comic and lyrical genre. A rock and roll style dance performance, which was filled with a plethora of striking moments and twists, left the audience awestruck. A drama titled '9 reasons why you should have stayed home sick today' was presented which added an element of fun to the evening. Elocution by two students and a music performance also added to the celebration.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 15 new photos — with Rupak Thakur and 8 others.

message:
Teacher's Day Celebration 2018
Teacher's Day celebration took place in the campus on 2nd of September. The day witnessed the most bright start with sketching competition organized for school children, the venue being Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence whose students had arranged the celebration. Then came the evening of Teachers' Day celebration at Kalidas Auditorium which witnessed commendable participation from the students and the professors. It was an honor for IIT Kharagpur to have Indian Folk Exponent, Kalpana Patowary, who had lightened the closing ceremony of Commonwealth Games 2018 and sang in an album by The Coke Studio. During the event, she sang songs in various dialects like Bengali and Bhojpuri and also sang her own song which had been released by Coke Studio. Prof. Joy Sen played a piece on Sitar and Prof. Anandrup Bhattacharya sang classical Bollywood songs that echoed the auditorium with their melody. A drama titled '9 reasons why you should have stayed home sick today' was presented which added an element of fun to the evening. Elocution by two students and a music performance also added to the celebration.

Having a lot of pent-up ideas and opinions regarding the recently conducted first ever 'Assimilation Programme' whooping around your head but lacking a platform to express them? Here is an opportunity for you to voice out your experience, suggestions and opinions regarding the same. In the series of 'Your Perspective', Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur invites all to pen down their opinions regarding the recently conducted Assimilation Programme under the umbrella "Assimilation Program: Necessity or Legacy?"

Send the doc file of your article at editor@awaaziitkgp.org before 9th September i.e. Sunday midnight.
Selected articles will be published from the page. Anonymity, if requested, will be taken care of.

With the aim to provoke rethink on the modes of societal governance and law, Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSoIPL), IIT Kharagpur has developed a one-semester inter-disciplinary course titled "Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Law".  It addresses the paradigm shifts that are occurring due to the intense involvement of AI as autonomous systems that can possibly invent, participate in inventions, create new expressions like music, paintings, and raising sensitive questions on inventorship, authorship, ownership of patents, copyright, designs.
Weaving AI into its curriculum, RGSoIPL has pioneered another change in Legal education becoming only law school in the country with a technological focus. 
Source:
https://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/iit-kgp-introduces-ai-in-law-and-management-education-118082800802_1.html

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur contacted the CIC officials responsible for wifi and LAN connections.

CIC reported a power drop today which has not been entirely restored. They are using some substitute power supply which could provide connection to at least some students if not all.
CIC has reported that they have already received many complaints and are still working on it.
The problem they are facing presently is that the current power supply is not able to provide connection to the entire campus which is why they have requested to reduce the number of user connections per unit time.
"The issue will be hopefully resolved by tonight", said the CIC officials.

Dhyan Chand Singh, a renowned personality in the International Hockey arena, had a phenomenal 22 years of sports career with 400 goals and 3 gold medals in Olympics for India. To celebrate his birthday and to keep the sporting spirit high in the country, 29th August is celebrated as the National Sports Day.
India’s most dedicated sportsperson, a true patriot, an inspiration to many, we bow down before this legend as well as all the sportspersons and pledge to keep the Indian flag high forever.

Today we celebrate this unique bond of love between brothers and sisters, where even though you want to kill each other, and are rivals, but dare someone point a finger at your sibling. Remembering all the TV remote and divide-the-food-into-two-halves fights, we wish you a very happy Rakshabandhan. May this sacred bond and the unconditional love between the siblings grow stronger each day.

message: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared a Page. Recently, Kerela has battled the most dangerous floods in its history of 100 years which has affected millions of lives severely. In such a tough situation, Breakthrough Science Society – IIT Kharagpur Chapter has taken an initiative to stand with the people of Kerala by providing some basic necessities. They are going to start a door to door Relief Aid collection from our campus and send it to the local breakthrough volunteers. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciate their efforts and urges everyone in the campus to show their full support. https://www.facebook.com/bssiitkgp/?hc_ref=ARRu-yoy4AOUwSAiGnFyuBqvonfnklRxiWQxqek19YFFmeueUqvM9AyiyicFLV3dSfA&__xts__%5B0%5D=68.ARC1DBtKhLudvaJ8YD35XY3Nun0vHIRQ5SNMOnLmE11ln3OrxOhMjVrSZT28LHAbZjoCrRjT76LW9BW4SiGPDYBtOQ08UOXU2D3svNq15U3irSvrB3ug7EDgNCb6W-31H9L6g94&__tn__=kC-R

message: A silent protest by IIT Kharagpur faculties was staged this evening in front of the main building alleging violation of rule of law, violation of natural justice, and violation of service rules. The further accusations include no transparency, salary deductions without due intimation, anomalies in deductions, not making MHRD order public, repeated letters to administration going unanswered and the requests made by faculties getting ignored.

message:
Whether it's about the field of research or about creating optimal solutions for the real-life problems, Kgpians never skip an opportunity to be at the top notch. A significant breakthrough came out this time when Flipkart acquires the startup Liv.AI. This startup by the KGP alumni Subodh Kumar, Kishore Mundra and Sanjeev Kumar works on speech recognition and surrounding technologies and is capable of converting speech to text in nine regional languages including Hindi, Bengali, Punjabi and Tamil, apart from English. This makes it extremely valuable in a country like India with a  gigantic bunch of linguistic and cultural diversity.
https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/small-biz/startups/newsbuzz/flipkart-talks-to-liv-ai-to-take-on-the-likes-of-alexa/articleshow/65481769.cms

Dean UG, Prof. S.K. Barai and the UG Council have called for an interactive session on 23rd August at 6 pm with all the UG students who fall under 'Academically Weak' (based only on their CGPA) to discuss about the crucial issues regarding academics. The team of representatives wishes to take feedback, criticism and inputs to solve the current issues.
Crucial issues that will be taken up for discussion include the credit limit rules and supplementary examinations. Students are requested to turn up for this meeting and express their opinions and raise their concerns and problems with the current academic setup.

Venue: F-142, Main Building

Crucial issues that will be taken up for discussion include the credit limit rules and supplementary examinations. Students are requested to turn up for this meeting and express their opinions and raise their concerns and problems with the current academic setup.

message:
A settled family in Canada, along with a lucrative job of professorship in a renowned college is no doubt anything short of a woman’s dream life, but from there to divorcing the husband and leaving all for rugged terrains in West Bengal to struggle for the downtrodden and underprivileged seems to be an unbelievable storyline of a movie. But fortunately yes, such a wonder woman does exist, and Hansa Nundy, an alumna of IIT Kharagpur is whom we are talking about.
“It is very easy to live for yourself”, says Hansa beaming with energy even in her 72nd year in her office room of the Disha Seema Centre School, a residential complex for children from underprivileged backgrounds to live, learn and eventually lead unto better lives. Read the full article here:
http://awaaziitkgp.org/disha.php

A talk on the life history of Netaji Subash Chandra Bose by author and former journalist Mr. Anuj Dhar is being organized by Samvad in the Kalidas Auditorium on 22nd August from 5 p.m. onwards. This talk would also witness the famous Bengali movie director, Mr. Srijit Mukherjee, as one of the guests, who also intend to make a movie on the enigma around the disappearance of Netaji.

In one of the major decisions taken at the IIT council meeting held in the capital on Tuesday, all IITs unanimously rejected the government-backed proposal to radically reform JEE advanced putting an end to all the speculations being proliferated about the examination. 

The IIT council rejected both the ideas presented by the HRD ministry - of setting up an expert committee to make JEE advanced more scientific and to reduce dependence on coaching centres as well as the idea of changing the allocation system of selected students. The IITs also added that the current format has been working smoothly and any 'tinkering' with it was undesirable. Finally, the ministry also went with the IIT view that the need for reform must be driven by the institutions and should be bothered upon only when they feel the need for reforms.

Source - 
https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/education/iits-reject-proposal-for-radical-reform-of-jee-advanced/articleshow/65471821.cms?utm_source=WAPusers&utm_medium=fbshare&utm_campaign=socialsharebutton&from=mdr

Who inspires us the most? It's always the person with whom we can connect to. What if he/she has had the same launching pad of life, IIT Kharagpur, as we have? The institute has been consistent in producing stalwarts in respective fields and the selection panel for alumni award must have faced a lot of problems because of this. The 68th foundation day witnessed the first edition of the Young Alumni Achiever Awards. The awards were given to those promising Alumni of the institute who are under 40 years and have achieved considerable success in their chosen career and have shown the potential for continued success ahead.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur introduces its readers to 4 of the 12 awardees and hopes that the inspiring lives of these people make all possible positive impacts on everyone's life.

Mr. Aneesh Reddy and Mr. Anant Choubey, two of our Alumni have proposed to set-up a Re-Water Research Center at IIT Kharagpur to replenish and rejuvenate water resources. The pilot plant, which is expected to be set-up by March 2019, will convert 1.35 million of litres of sewage water from the hostels to 1.2 million litres of potable water, on a daily basis. Quality assurance tests will also be conducted to demonstrate the suitability of the treated water for consumption and also to infuse confidence among public and other agencies about technology related to sewage water treatment. Mr. Aneesh Reddy told that ‘The Aditya Choubey Center for Re-Water Research’ would be networking with the government bodies to take up this technology and the process and meet the water challenge in various cities. The idea is to simultaneously tackle the problems of scarcity of clean water for domestic use and massive sewage problems in urban areas. “The project is being developed to attract potential entrepreneurs and government agencies to take up sewage treatment at a large scale and with a business model for banks to gain confidence in funding such businesses,” said Mr. Anant Choubey.

Source - https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/home/environment/developmental-issues/iit-kharagpur-to-set-up-re-water-research-center/articleshow/65450598.cms

"It is not the beauty of a building you should look at; its the construction of the foundation that will stand the test of time."  - David Allan Coe
 
IIT Kharagpur was founded as a part of Jawaharlal Nehru’s far-sighted dream to have a free self-reliant India in 1951. Driven by such an ambitious vision, the institute has come a long way today with enormous developments and incessant growth in every aspect celebrating its 68th Institute Foundation Day.

We are glad to announce that the 54th Inter IIT Sports meet will be hosted by IIT Kharagpur. The Sports meet will be held in December except for the aquatic events which will be held in October next year. This being the 11th time for IIT Kharagpur for hosting the Sports meet. The enhanced focus on sports activities will strengthen the wellness initiatives as a whole. 

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates every KGPian and wishes them great luck.
