After having 67 years of stupendous journey of perpetual growth and excellence, the 68th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur was celebrated today at Netaji Auditorium. It was graced by the propitious presence of the Chief Guest Purnendu Chatterjee himself being an institute alumnus and  Executive Director of Indian School of Business (ISB), Hyderabad and the Director Dr. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti. Awards from different categories like Staff Excellence Award, Nina Saxena Technology Excellence Award, Faculty Excellence Award as well as the  Chair Professorship was conferred. Also, the Young Alumni Achiever Awards were presented to young and promising alumni who have achieved great success and recognition in their chosen profession. The event also witnessed an adorable gesture of giving mementos to the alumni who have reached KGP to attend the homecoming. The event concluded with a vote of thanks from the registrar on behalf of the institute.

message: After having 67 years of stupendous journey of perpetual growth and excellence, the 68th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur was celebrated today at Netaji Auditorium. It was graced by the propitious presence of the Chief Guest Purnendu Chatterjee himself being an institute alumnus and  Executive Director of Indian School of Business (ISB), Hyderabad and the Director Dr. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti. Awards from different categories like Staff Excellence Award, Nina Saxena Technology Excellence Award, Faculty Excellence Award as well as the  Chair Professorship was conferred. Also, the Young Alumni Achiever Awards were presented to young and promising alumni who have achieved great success and recognition in their chosen profession. The event also witnessed an adorable gesture of giving mementos to the alumni who have reached KGP to attend the homecoming. The event concluded with a vote of thanks from the registrar on behalf of the institute.

message:
Schedule | 18th August | Institute Foundation Day

Today, IIT Kharagpur will be celebrating 67 glorious years of perpetual growth on its 68th Foundation Day. The administration is geared up to make this event a symbol of KGP's glory and here is the complete schedule of the day. We believe IIT Kharagpur will continue to inspire each and every one for all the glorious years ahead and play a constructive role in building a new and strong India. All members of the faculty, staffs, students, alumni, and retired employees of the institute are cordially invited to attend the function.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur requests the student community to attend the function and make this event a great success.

Amidst the damage & havoc caused by unprecedented floods in Kerala- what stands out is the grit and commitment of young IAS officers leading teams for relief and restoration operations. Mr. Raja Gopal Sunkara (IAS), Sub-Collector of Padmamabapuram has been on the job in the field helping out each and every soul. Raja Gopal Sunkara also happens to be an IIT Kharagpur Alumnus, Dual Degree Agricultural & Food Engineering of the batch of 2012, later IAS (2014) and now Sub Collector and Sub-Divisional Magistrate, Padmanabhapuram tirelessly working in flood-hit South India, especially Kerala. 
He has requested our vast network of Alumni and students to generously contribute to Kerala in the following ways:
1. Donate to The CM's Disaster Relief Fund (CMDRF)
Online: www.donation.cmdrf.kerala.gov.in/
CMDRF Account details:
Name of the donee: Chief Minister’s Distress Relief Funds
Account Number: 67319948232
Bank: State Bank of India
Branch: City Branch, Thiruvananthapuram
IFSC: SBIN0070028
PAN: AAAGD0584M
Account type: Savings
SWIFT Code: SBININBBT08

Or 

2. The following material can be mobilised in Kerala itself or in Tamil Nadu/Karnataka and we will find a way to transport them to Kerala:
1. Sanitary Napkins
2. ORS
3. Chlorine tablets
4. Bedsheets
5. Sleeping Mats
6. Underwear
7. Nighties 
8. Towels
9. Mosquito Coils/Odomos
10. Anti septic lotion/Dettol
11. Anti fungal powder
12. Bleaching powder
13. Soap, toothpaste and toothbrushes
14. Candles and Matchboxes
15. Rusk (No Bread)
16. Biscuits
17. Water
18. Rice
19. Sugar
20. Milk powder
21. Tea powder
22. Cough Syrup
23. Paracetamol

The list is not exhaustive. Any help is welcome.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates the grit, determination and exemplary selfless service put up by him and appeals all the alumni and students to contribute in whatever way possible.

अटल बिहारी वाजपेयी जी के निधन पर आईआईटी खड़गपुर के मुख्य प्रांगण में शाम को  छः बजे देश के महान नायक को श्रद्धांजलि अर्पित की गई। अटल जी को श्रद्धांजलि देने के लिए उनके चित्र पर पुष्प अर्पित किये गए व मोमबत्ती जलाकर उनकी आत्मा की शांति की मनोकामना की गई। इस अवसर पर काफी लोगों ने अपनी उपस्थिति दर्ज की। अटल जी के सम्मान में उपस्थित लोगों ने अपने विचार व्यक्त किये व उनके देशहित में किये गए कार्यों को याद किया गया। कुछ लोगों ने अपनी कविताओं के माध्यम से अटल जी को उन्ही के कवि अंदाज में याद किया। इस अवसर उपस्थित संचालकों ने कहा कि हमें उनके जीवन से बहुत कुछ सीखना चाहिये, उनके जैसे देशप्रेमी स्वंयसेवक 
की क्षतिपूर्ती  असंभव है। यदि हम उनके विचारों को अपने जीवन में उतारें तो हम देश को एक नई ऊँचाई तक ले जा सकते। उपस्थित जनसमूह ने अटल जी के दिखाये हुए पथ पर चलने का संकल्प लिया।
आवाज़ आईआईटी खड़गपुर जननायक अटल जी की आत्मा की शांति की कामना करते हैं।
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.

message:
Half Day Holiday || 17th August

The country mourns the sad demise of Atal Bihari Vajpayee and the state has declared half day holiday today. Classes will remain suspended in the second half today on account of the same.

An appeal from the Director, 
"Dear All,

You are aware that Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee, our ex-Prime Minister, passed away yesterday. In view of this, I am requesting that at 11 am, all of us have a solemn remembrance by observing a Two-Minute Silence with prayers for his soul journey and his dreams for our nation's good be fulfilled. This may be observed in the respective places where we are, classrooms of the ongoing classes, in departments, centres, schools, units, offices, etc., wherever possible in a convenient manner and appropriate ambience. Your kind cooperation in this regard is solicited.

Regards
PPC"
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the student community to kindly observe the two-minute silence and pay their regards to our beloved Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

IEEE EMB Chapter of IIT Kharagpur is organising a talk on 'Conformal Ultrasound Transducer Arrays for Image-Guided Neural Therapy' by Dr. Soumyajit Mandal. The details are as follows:
Date and Time: 17th August 2018 (5:15 PM to 6:15 PM)
Venue: NKN Seminar, Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering

The speaker, Dr. Soumyajit Mandal, received his B.Tech degree from IIT Kharagpur in 2002 with top honors, and his M.S. and Ph.D. degrees from MIT in 2004 and 2009.

Interested students are encouraged to participate in the same.

"मौत की उमर क्या है? दो पल भी नहीं, 
ज़िन्दगी सिलसिला, आज कल की नहीं। 

मैं जी भर जिया, मैं मन से मरूँ, 
लौटकर आऊँगा, कूच से क्यों डरूँ? "

आज एक युग का अंत हो गया- भारतवर्ष के किसी एक राजनीतिक अध्याय का ही नहीं, बल्कि समग्र राष्ट्र की ओजस्विता के अध्याय का भी। भारत-रत्न स्वर्गीय अटल बिहारी वाजपेयी के निधन ने सम्पूर्ण राष्ट्र को शोक-सागर में डुबो दिया है। तीन बार देश के प्रधानमंत्री रह चुके वाजपेयीजी एक आदर्श राजनेता थे जिनकी राजनीति दलगत कभी रही ही नहीं, क्योंकि वे पूरे देश को एक साथ लेकर चलना जानते थे। संयुक्त राष्ट्र संघ में हिंदी में अपना वक्तृत्त्व देने वाले वे पहले राष्ट्र-प्रतिनिधि थे। वे एक कुशल एवं ओजस्वी वक्ता, प्रख्यात कवि एवं आदर्श पत्रकार थे, जिनका हर शब्द देश की जनता के दिल में घर कर जाता था। यही कारण है कि परमाणु परीक्षण, कारगिल युद्ध, या संसद हमले जैसे कठिन समय में भी उन्होंने कुशलता से राष्ट्र का संचालन किया और सभी पार्टियों को एक सूत्र में बाँधे रखा। स्वतंत्र भारत के राजनीतिक इतिहास में वाजपेयीजी शायद ऐसे एकमात्र राजनेता हैं जिन्हें पक्ष और विपक्ष, दोनों का समान भाव से आदर और प्रेम मिला। कारण बहुत सहज है- उनके लिए देश किसी व्यक्ति, समाज, या दल से ऊँचा था; अगर आलोचना की जरुरत हो तो भी वे पीछे नहीं हटे, चाहे सामने नेहरू जी ही क्यों न हों, और अगर देश का आह्वान हो तो विपक्ष में होते हुए भी उन्होंने विश्व के मंच पर राष्ट्र का प्रतिनिधित्व किया और अपने राष्ट्र-धर्म का पालन किया। आवाज़, आईआईटी खड़गपुर की ओर से उन्हें कोटि-कोटि नमन और भावभीनी श्रद्धांजलि!

"क्या हार में क्या जीत में, किंचित नहीं भयभीत मैं!
कर्तव्य पथ पर जो मिला, ये भी सही वो भी सही!
वरदान नहीं मांगूंगा, हो कुछ भी पर हार नहीं मानूंगा!"

"मौत की उमर क्या है? दो पल भी नहीं, 
ज़िन्दगी सिलसिला, आज कल की नहीं। 

मैं जी भर जिया, मैं मन से मरूँ, 
लौटकर आऊँगा, कूच से क्यों डरूँ? "

Kerala is suffering the worst flood disaster since 1924. With the official death toll rising above 80 and the estimated loss of the state in thousands of crores, Red alert has been sounded in all the 14 districts. According to the Indian Express, 85,399 people have been shifted to relief camps and the rescue teams are trying their best in helping as many as they can.

Tech Keralites, a group of students and staff of IIT Kharagpur has come forward to seek help from the KGP community for donations in the Chief Minister's Distress Fund.

Account Name: TECH KERALITES
Account Number: 3872002100007017
Bank: Punjab National Bank
Branch: IIT Kharagpur
IFSC Code: PUNB0387200

UPI-Tez/BHIM- +918138855815

Those who are interested in donating directly to the Chief Ministers Distress Relief can use the link given below-
Chief Ministers Distress Relief website. https://donation.cmdrf.kerala.gov.in/

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur applauds the efforts of the compassionate students and staff and urges the KGP community to contribute their bit as every penny counts.
#StandWithKerala

India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (http://www.niti.gov.in/) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a global mobility hackathon to crowdsource solutions aimed at the future of mobility in India. Envisaged to be one of the largest hackathons globally, MoveHack is focused on 10 themes and structured over three legs: online, followed by Singapore leg, and the finals in New Delhi.

MoveHack aims to bring about innovative, dynamic and scalable solutions to problems pertaining to mobility. The hackathon has a two-pronged campaign approach: 
(a) “Just Code It”: aimed at solutions through innovations in technology/product/software and data analysis, and 
(b) “Just Solve It”: innovative business ideas or sustainable solutions to transform mobility infrastructure through technology.

Move Hack is open to individuals of all nationalities, making it a truly global hackathon. Registrations are open at https://www.movehack.gov.in. The top 30 teams from the online submissions will travel to Delhi to participate in the Final Round to be held in New Delhi on 5 and 6 Sep 2018.

The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi (http://movesummit.in/) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi (http://movesummit.in/) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (http://www.niti.gov.in/) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a global mobility hackathon to crowdsource solutions aimed at the future of mobility in India. Envisaged to be one of the largest hackathons globally, MoveHack is focused on 10 themes and structured over three legs: online, followed by Singapore leg, and the finals in New Delhi.

MoveHack aims to bring about innovative, dynamic and scalable solutions to problems pertaining to mobility. The hackathon has a two-pronged campaign approach: 
(a) “Just Code It”: aimed at solutions through innovations in technology/product/software and data analysis, and 
(b) “Just Solve It”: innovative business ideas or sustainable solutions to transform mobility infrastructure through technology.

Move Hack is open to individuals of all nationalities, making it a truly global hackathon. Registrations are open at https://www.movehack.gov.in. The top 30 teams from the online submissions will travel to Delhi to participate in the Final Round to be held in New Delhi on 5 and 6 Sep 2018.

The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi (http://movesummit.in/) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

Independence Day is here and the celebrations were not only limited at the Institute level. Students spread across various Halls of Residences also celebrated this auspicious day in their respective Halls by hoisting the national flag and commemorating the freedom fighters and martyrs who were pivotal to India's independence. In almost all the Halls, the national flag was hoisted early in the morning by their respective wardens and assistant wardens, followed by speeches and customary sweet distribution. Here's the sneak peek into the independence day celebration at various Halls.
At RP Hall, the celebrations included distributing food packets at the school 'Disha Seema Centre' on this occasion which indeed is a nice gesture to look up to. At Azad Hall, flag hoisting was followed by tree plantation to send out a message about how important is it for us to preserve the nature to be able to enjoy this freedom in the long run. In all the halls, the Hall staff members also played a big role in arranging for the celebrations though most of them did not have their duty today.

message:
"Long years ago, we made a tryst with destiny, and now the time comes when we shall redeem our pledge, not wholly or in full measure, but very substantially. At the stroke of the midnight hour, when the world sleeps, India will awake to life and freedom. A moment comes, which comes but rarely in history when we step out from the old to the new when an age ends, and when the soul of a nation, long suppressed, finds utterance." Maybe in terms of time, it has been around 72 years when they were first voiced by Jawaharlal Nehru but their importance to the entire nation is flagrant by the way independence was celebrated today at IIT Kharagpur near Bidhan Chowk in front of the main building. Although because of rain the programme was shifted from Bidhan Chowk to Netaji Auditorium after the flaring of the flag by our beloved director. The programme also witnessed various jaw-dropping performances from kids of various schools like DAV model school, Hijli High School, Jagriti Vidya Mandir, Mongrace Daycare centre as well various other schools located near the institution, those kids irrefutable won many hearts and arose patriotic feeling among the people present there. The programme was graced by the presence of Director Partha P Chakrabarti, Dean UG Sudhir Kumar Barai as well as Professor Somesh Kumar Dean, Student Affairs along with NSS and NCC volunteers. 

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur urges everyone to salute the nation,  have freedom in the mind, faith in the words and pride in the soul.

message:
Independence is indispensable to every one of us and it’s been 72 long years when India tasted it. All those sufferings, struggles and sacrifices bore fruit on this very day when India stood proud, moving out of the tumultuous British claws which held it for 200 long years.15th August, the Independence day of India has been a symbol of devotion, dedication and determination and today, we all stand proud of the martyrs who gave their all to make India independent.
 
Awaaz wishes everyone a HAPPY INDEPENDENCE DAY!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the students, faculty, and staff to come together, sing the national anthem, witness and feel the patriotism in all those passionate performances and pay homage to all those who laid down their lives for the nation.

Schedule | 18th August | Institute Foundation Day
On 18th August 2018, IIT Kharagpur will be celebrating 67 glorious years of perpetual growth on its 67th Foundation Day. The administration is geared up to make this event a symbol of KGP's glory and here is the complete schedule of the day. We believe IIT Kharagpur will continue to inspire everyone for all the glorious years ahead and play a constructive role in building a new and strong India. 
All members of the faculty, staffs, students, alumni, and retired employees of the institute are cordially invited to attend the program.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur request the student community to attend the function and make this event a great success.

AgNext, a startup by KGPians, is an agricultural sensing and solutions company that offers a platform to ideate, innovate, prototype and commercialize impactful technology solutions and services for entire Agri-Value Chain. Projects involve topics related to IOT Electronics, Machine Learning, Image Processing, Full Stack Software Development, Android and Web Applications, Cloud Computing, Robotics, Product Design (CAD), Market Research and Business Development.  They are looking forward to a long-term association with KGPians who are passionate about using their talents and skills for socially relevant and impactful technology solutions for Agri-Tech. Fellowship will be awarded to selected participants. Beyond handsome financial rewards, they plan to offer involvement in patents for the products you work on. Go to the link below:

Yet another breakthrough achievement by KGPians when a team participating from IIT Kharagpur secured the Chairman Award for Technical Innovation in India Innovation Challenge Design Contest (IICDC) 2017. The award was given on Battery Health Management System with Integrated Charger by Texas Instruments India(TI). The IIT Kharagpur figured on top among the 10 winning teams of one of the country's most popular design contests for engineering students.
The winners qualify for a Rs. 3.5 crore start-up seed fund from the Department of Science and Technology (DST) and an opportunity to be incubated at IIM Bangalore's innovation and entrepreneurship hub N S Raghavan Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning (NSRCEL). The final 10 winners were chosen after several rounds of discussions and deliberations by a panel of judges. Awaaz IIT Kharagpur extends it's heartiest congratulates to the winning team.
Source: https://www.ndtv.com/education/iit-kharagpur-gets-chairman-award-for-tech-innovation-in-iicdc-1899153

Honda Foundation is pleased to announce the launch of the Honda Young Engineer & Scientist (Y-E-S) Award 2018. Awardees get 10,000 USD and internships in leading universities/companies of Japan.
The program is open for applications w.e.f. August 01st, 2018, and will remain accessible for online applications through the portal http://yes.honda.co.in up to August 31st, 2018.
Students who are currently studying in the fifth semester of their 4-year (B.Tech.) or 5-year dual degree (M. Tech.) programs are eligible to apply.

The MHRD has planned to launch three India-centered research schemes in the coming October, that will focus on issues of national concern and also develop the country's research infrastructure and knowledge ecosystem. The institutions selected to pilot these schemes are IISc Bangalore, IIT Kharagpur, and India Council of Social Sciences and Research (ICSSR).

IIT Kharagpur will be coordinating the Scheme for promotion of academic & research collaboration (SPARC). The Rs 418 crore scheme seeks to boost joint research with global universities from 25 countries and get international expertise to solve major national problems, train Indian students in the best laboratories, and deepen academic engagement. The other two schemes, Impactful policy research in social science (IMPRESS) and Scheme for transformational and advanced research in fundamental sciences (STARS) will be coordinated by ICSSR and IISc Bangalore respectively.

Get more information about it here:
https://m.economictimes.com/industry/services/education/3-india-specific-research-schemes-to-be-launched/articleshow/65347256.cms

The IIT Kharagpur student branch of Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers(IEEE) carried out a workshop on the widely used software MATLAB in the 'Takshashila' building, witnessing a huge turnout of enthusiastic students who filled up the two labs. The introductory workshop was appreciated by almost all the students ranging from undergraduate freshers to a significant number of Ph.D. students as it played a helping hand to familiarize them with its commands and purposefulness. The workshop lasted for around three hours in the evening with a ten-minute break for snacks.

The student branch of IEEE also assured that they will be planning more such events whenever a considerable number of students approach them with specific topics sighting a workshop.

message:
The IIT Kharagpur student branch of Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers(IEEE) carried out a workshop on the widely used software MATLAB in the 'Takshashila' building, witnessing a huge turnout of enthusiastic students who filled up the two labs. The introductory workshop was appreciated by almost all the students ranging from undergraduate freshers to a significant number of Ph.D. students as it played a helping hand to familiarize them with its commands and purposefulness. The workshop lasted for around three hours in the evening with a ten-minute break for snacks.

The student branch of IEEE also assured that they will be planning more such events whenever a considerable number of students approach them with specific topics sighting a workshop.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.

Hello freshers!
Do you feel your voice is loud enough to reach every corner of the campus? Here is your golden chance to make it to the most efficient stage; one that develops multiple journalistic, creative and life skills while making a lasting impact within the campus.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, Student Media Body of the campus is all set to recruit freshers for this academic year. Have a glance at the venue and timings and give your best shot to become a part of a family-like team where you learn and grow, boosted by the faith of the entire KGP community.

Register over here: bit.ly/awaaz18sel

Selection Details:
11th August, Saturday || V4, Vikramshila || 11am to 9pm
12th August, Sunday || V4, Vikramshila || 11am to 9pm

In order to curb the billion-dollar private coaching industry that has grown around the IIT entrance exam JEE, an ostrobogulous idea of turning the premier engineering colleges like IITs limited only to post-graduate and research-centric institutions like the IIMs instead of focusing more on undergraduates as they currently do has been put forward by a section of the faculty and alumni of the Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs). The proposal is set to be taken up for review at a meeting of the IIT council on 21st August.
Source: https://theprint.in/governance/will-iits-become-post-graduate-only-iit-council-to-discuss-on-21-august/94994/

A lot of issues being faced by the students while surfing the web has been reported to CIC helpdesk. The head of CIC acknowledged that CIC team is now aware of the problems and working to resolve the issues. Hence, there is now no need for everyone to report the same problem. Few unforeseen problems are expected for some time after a major equipment migration but CIC team will resolve it. As stated earlier, there hasn't been any new restrictions placed intentionally. 
Head (CIC) also wishes to inform all the students that the Youtube problem (and others problems as well) being experienced by students is an unforeseen problem arising out of a major equipment (firewall) migration in the backend yesterday evening. There are no new restrictions imposed on anything. Some problems after a major migration are common and expected. CIC will resolve it and their team is working on it. It is a bit of strange problem whose exact cause is yet to be known with full accuracy and hence, no particular time period can be quoted by which the problem will get solved, but it will be resolved very soon. Students are requested to not to worry, and not to report the problems again and again as the CIC team are now aware of it.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur contacted the Head (CIC) regarding the newly imposed restrictions on the internet including the "Restricted Mode” on YouTube and found out that there has been nothing like these restrictions that have been put up intentionally by CIC. Head of the CIC said, "There are no new restrictions placed. Two old firewalls were replaced by new ones last evening, there may be issues because of that. If students are still facing issues, they should report the exact problem to CIC helpdesk and it will be looked after."
We would like to request you all to comment down the exact issues that you have been facing since last evening so that we can communicate them collectively to CIC helpdesk. 
In case you wish to communicate problems faced by you while browsing, here're the details:
Email: helpdesk@cc.iitkgp.ac.in
Ph: (91)-3222-282391

Another astonishing milestone achieved by IIT Kharagpur and this time it is in the field of Bioelectronics. The team working at Bioelectronics Innovation Laboratory has developed coin-sized biological chips for rehabilitation and prostheses applications. As per Prof Sudip Nag these chips would solve neural connectivity problems that are not addressed by the latest medical sciences and would also escalate the lifetime of implants reducing the number of surgical interventions. Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team for its stupefying achievement. For further information one can follow the given link :
https://www.newsheads.in/latest-news/sources/iit-kharagpur-to-develop-coin-sized-biological-chips-for-medical-treatment-article-23082.html

Sapient will be conducting its PPT from 7 PM at V1, Vikramshila for final-year and pre-final year students. 

7 PM - 8.15 PM: Talk for final-year students (Hackathon+JumpStart launch)
8.15 PM - 9 PM: Internship talk for pre-final year students

It is mandatory for all students who have applied for the internship selections at Publicis Sapient to attend the PPT.
It is advisable for all final-year students interested in a career in product engineering and management, and software development, to attend the first talk.

In what comes as an astonishing result for IIT Kharagpur athletics, men's 4x100 relay team of Eslavath Jaga Deesh, Shivam Singh, Sairam Alla and Lokesh Reddi clocked 44.4 seconds bagging the bronze medal in the State Athletics Championship at the Salt Lake Stadium on Saturday. 

The medal came on the penultimate day of the meet and is the first ever medal of IIT-KGP in the state championship in just their second appearance. 14 participants represented the IIT Kharagpur team and despite difficulties in practice due to track renovation, the athletes have given their very best.
 
For more information, check out this link- https://www.telegraphindia.com/sports/iit-win-first-medal-250154

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the athletics team, their coach Mr. Pranab Sarkar and all the people behind the institute's healthy sports culture for this remarkable feat that would set a standard for more sporting glory in the future.

message:
Internships play an important role in providing one with the first-hand insight into his/her potential career without a long-term commitment. Among all those who endeavour to secure an internship through CDC, only a few finally make it through every year. While the series of examinations have already started for the CDC internships this year, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents the analysis of the internships offered through CDC in the last academic year to facilitate the job of the students aspiring to bag their desired internships. 

Follow the link to read the full article: http://awaaziitkgp.org/internship_analysis.php

Want to know how much CGPA does it take to get your branch changed at the end of the first year? 

The Department Change list for the second year students was released quite a while ago. A total of 126 students secured a department change this year. The cut-off CGPAs soared high this year as did the number of students getting their desired branches. The cut-off CGPA for CSE still remains the highest with a whopping increase to 9.87. However, Mechanical Dual exhibited the maximum gain in the cut-off with the increase of 0.51 compared to last year. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur brings to you the Department Change statistics for the year 2017 -18.

https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/department-change-statistics-2017-18-48376b3e022f

साहित्य के सितारे । श्री मैथिलीशरण गुप्त

“राष्ट्रकवि” मैथिलीशरण गुप्त का जन्म सन् 1886 में आज ही के दिन झाँसी, उत्तर प्रदेश में हुआ। उस वक़्त ब्रजभाषा के लोकप्रिय होने के बावजूद गुप्त ने अपनी रचनाओं में खड़ी बोली का उपयोग कर अपने मन के भावों का सटीक और सजीव चित्रण किया। इसी कारण उनका स्थान खड़ी बोली के जनकों में शिखर पर माना जाता है। रामायण, महाभारत और बौद्ध साहित्य के किरदार उनकी अधिकतर रचनाओं में मुख्य भूमिका में हैं। यह धार्मिक जुड़ाव उनके विचारों को एक नया आयाम देता रहा जिसका लोग सदैव स्वागत करते रहे।

‘पंचवटी’, ‘साकेत’, ‘जयद्रथ वध’, ‘यशोधरा’, ‘द्वापर’, ‘झंकार’, ‘जयभारत’ उनकी कुछ विशिष्ट काव्य रचनाओं में से हैं।  ‘अनघ’, ‘चन्द्रहास’, ‘तिलोत्तमा’, ‘निष्क्रिय प्रतिरोध’ और ‘विसर्जन’ उनके द्वारा लिखे मौलिक नाटक हैं। इसके अलावा उन्होनें कई लोकप्रिय बाल कवितायेँ भी लिखी हैं।

गुप्त जी के काव्य में राष्ट्रीयता और गांधीवाद की प्रधानता है। इसमें भारत के गौरवमय अतीत के इतिहास और भारतीय संस्कृति की महत्ता की प्रस्तुति है। उन्होंने 1912 में भारत दर्शन की एक लाजवाब काव्यात्मक प्रस्तुति “भारत-भारती" में दी। उनकी इस रचना ने देश की तत्कालीन दुर्दशा के समाधान बताते हुए स्वदेश प्रेम को एक नयी आवाज़ दी और स्वतंत्रता संग्राम के दौरान देशवासियों ने भी उनके सुर में सुर मिलाए। इसी कारण महात्मा गांधी ने उन्हें 'राष्ट्रकवि' की पदवी भी दी थी।

1954 में पद्म भूषण से सम्मानित और राज्य सभा के सदस्य रहे गुप्त जी ने तुक के बिना भी जो धुन लोगों के ह्रदय तक पहुँचाई हम उसे नमन करते हैं और यह आशा करते हैं कि आने वाली हर पीढ़ी तक उनकी रचनाओं का भावार्थ सफलतापूर्वक पहुंचता रहे।

Goldman Sachs is conducting a session for 'Women Emerging in Finance'. At Goldman Sachs, your skills and experiences will create a world of possibilities for our clients. From the latest IPO and market insights to investments in clean energy and infrastructure, each one of our teams contributes to innovations that drive progress around the world.
You’ll work alongside industry experts and strategic thinkers at all levels, gaining hands-on experience unlike anywhere else. All at a place where your ideas matter and your personal and professional growth are fronts of mind.
Come, embrace the opportunity to move industries, make markets and empower communities.
Steps to Register:
1. Go to https://recruiting360.avature.net/candidates and register as a new user
2. Enter all your details and click on Submit
3. Click on Register for events
4. Under country, select India and click on Filter
5. Select and click on the specific Women Emerging in Finance, IIT Kharagpur, 3rd August 2018 to register
6. Review the event details and click on ‘Register’
Timings : 7:15 PM
Venue: V3, Vikarmshila
Date: 3rd August

Publicis.Sapient would like to invite final year students of IIT Kharagpur to JumpStart (Sapient Premiere), a two day thought leadership and Innovation event aimed at aspiring minds in engineering.
Publicis.Sapient, the digital business transformation hub of Publicis Groupe, helps clients drive growth and efficiency and evolve the ways they work, in a world where consumer behavior and technology are catalyzing social and commercial changes at an unprecedented pace. With 17,000 people and over 100 offices around the globe, our expertise spanning technology, data sciences, consulting and creative, combined with our culture of innovation, enables us to deliver on complex transformation initiatives that accelerate our clients’ businesses through creating the products and services their customers expect. One can visit www.publicis.sapient.com for more information
JumpStart is a two-day thought-leadership-and-innovation event aimed at aspiring minds in engineering from the topmost colleges across the country. It aims at introducing these students to the real world of technology, exposing them to upcoming career trends and giving them a jumpstart to exciting careers across a wide range of fields. Organised by Sapient on August 25-26 at Bengaluru and September 01-02 at Gurugram, JumpStart will also include an all-expenses-paid travel, a stay at a luxurious hotel and numerous fun activities. 
1. The primary objective of JumpStart is to introduce students to the applications of modern-day technology to the problems in the real world. They will get insights into innovative uses of these technologies to accelerate businesses and solve problems across industries. 
2. The event includes an exclusive exhibition demonstrating marvels of technology developed by industry experts and innovative solutions to problems that slow down the growth of businesses with Big Data, API, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Experience Technology and more. 
3. Students will get to know about different career options across a number of fields. We want to use this event as a platform to bust numerous career-related myths that deter students from making wise career decisions
4. JumpStart will be an opportunity for them to interact with fellow engineers from across the country and establish networks that will help them grow as professionals later in their lives. 
5. JumpStart is about learning - we want students to become the best at what they want to do. It is not just an information-broadcasting event, it also focuses on using interactions among the participants for idea exchange. 
To attend JumpStart, a Hackathon will be conducted. To register, visit this link: https://goo.gl/1JkMCG. The Hackathon talk will be conducted on 6th August from 7.30 PM, along with the internship talk.
All prefinal and final year students are advised to attend the talk.

Publicis.Sapient would like to invite final year students of IIT Kharagpur to JumpStart (Sapient Premiere), a two day thought leadership and Innovation event aimed at aspiring minds in engineering.
Publicis.Sapient, the digital business transformation hub of Publicis Groupe, helps clients drive growth and efficiency and evolve the ways they work, in a world where consumer behavior and technology are catalyzing social and commercial changes at an unprecedented pace. With 17,000 people and over 100 offices around the globe, our expertise spanning technology, data sciences, consulting and creative, combined with our culture of innovation, enables us to deliver on complex transformation initiatives that accelerate our clients’ businesses through creating the products and services their customers expect. One can visit www.publicis.sapient.com for more information
JumpStart is a two-day thought-leadership-and-innovation event aimed at aspiring minds in engineering from the topmost colleges across the country. It aims at introducing these students to the real world of technology, exposing them to upcoming career trends and giving them a jumpstart to exciting careers across a wide range of fields. Organised by Sapient on August 25-26 at Bengaluru and September 01-02 at Gurugram, JumpStart will also include an all-expenses-paid travel, a stay at a luxurious hotel and numerous fun activities. 
1. The primary objective of JumpStart is to introduce students to the applications of modern-day technology to the problems in the real world. They will get insights into innovative uses of these technologies to accelerate businesses and solve problems across industries. 
2. The event includes an exclusive exhibition demonstrating marvels of technology developed by industry experts and innovative solutions to problems that slow down the growth of businesses with Big Data, API, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Experience Technology and more. 
3. Students will get to know about different career options across a number of fields. We want to use this event as a platform to bust numerous career-related myths that deter students from making wise career decisions
4. JumpStart will be an opportunity for them to interact with fellow engineers from across the country and establish networks that will help them grow as professionals later in their lives. 
5. JumpStart is about learning - we want students to become the best at what they want to do. It is not just an information-broadcasting event, it also focuses on using interactions among the participants for idea exchange. 
To attend JumpStart, a Hackathon will be conducted. To register, visit this link: https://goo.gl/1JkMCG. The Hackathon talk will be conducted on 6th August from 7.30 PM, along with the internship talk.
All prefinal and final year students are advised to attend the talk.

Chandralekha Singh (KGP 1988) & Jeremy Levy Student Excellence Award
Prajwal Singhania and Shubham Jena have been awarded the Chandralekha Singh (KGP 1988) & Jeremy Levy Student Excellence Award instituted to recognize and support the excellence in academics. The awards will be conferred on the Foundation Day to Shubham Jena and Prajwal Singhania.
Dr Chandralekha Singh [1988/MSc/PH/SN] and her husband Dr Jeremy Levy are professors at the University of Pittsburgh in the USA. The awards will be in the memory of Prof Mandakini Majumdar (Deshpande), who was a pioneer as one of the first women engineers to serve as a professor in the Civil Engineering Dept of IIT Kharagpur and in the honor of Prof G P Sastry of the Physics Dept of IIT Kharagpur, writer of several textbooks and known as a very popular teacher. For Prof. Singh and Prof. Levy, who themselves are academicians at the University of Pittsburgh, USA, these are legacies of teacher-student rapport of a close-knit campus like IIT Kharagpur.
This award has facilitated by the IIT KGP Foundation USA. The Foundation earlier facilitated donations for funded foreign internships and a Hi-Tech ambulance for the students.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos — with Prajwal Singhania and Shubham Jena.

message:
An interactive talk is being organised by the Corporate & Media Interaction (CMI) Cell of Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur with the speaker being Shri Ravi Kant (Ex Vice Chairman – Tata Motors and Distinguished Alumnus & Professor – IIT KGP).
Date: 02-August-2018 (Thursday)
Time: 3:30 – 4:30 PM
Venue: F-116, Main Building (Bhatnagar Auditorium)
Topic of the talk: How Robotics and Artificial Intelligence is Shaping the Future of Work and Impacting Society
Mr. Ravi Kant will also be available for meeting individually during 03-08-2018, 11:00 AM. Write to <abhijeet@vgsom.iitkgp.ac.in> in case you’d like to meet him. 

Profile of the speaker: Mr. Ravi Kant, B. Tech. (Hons.), M.Sc., D.Sc. (Hon) served as the Managing Director of Tata Motors Limited. He has a Bachelor of Technology degree from Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, MS in Industry from Aston University and Honorary D.Sc from Aston University. He is an Honorary Industrial Professor at the University of Warwick, UK and was awarded the BMA Management Man of the Year Award 2008-09. He serves as Chairman of Indian Institute of Management Rohtak; Tata Advanced Materials Ltd and TAL Manufacturing Solutions Ltd. He has been a Non-Executive Independent Director of Vedanta Limited since January 29, 2015 and served as its Non-Executive Director since January 28, 2014 until January 29, 2015. He is a Director of National Institute of Design (India) and Enactus (USA) and WonderWork (USA). Mr. Kant is credited with the successful and unexpected turnaround of the once-struggling luxury units, Jaguar Land Rover, bought from Ford Motor Company in 2008. He also played an instrumental role in the development and subsequent launch of world’s cheapest car Nano six years ago. He championed the development of the Tata Ace, still running as India’s biggest selling mini truck. He also played a crucial role in the acquisition of Daewoo Commercial Vehicle Company in 2004. After giving up active participation in running the day-to-day affairs of Tata in 2009, he gradually slipped into the role of a mentor and also a consultant.)

The Corporate & Media Interaction (CMI) Cell of Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur is organising an interactive talk with the speaker being Shri Mritunjay Kumar Tiwary (Founder, Trustee, and Head of Projects – Akhand Jyoti Eye Hospital)
Date: 01-August-2018 (Wednesday)
Time: 5:00 – 6:00 PM
Venue: #116, Main Building (Bhatnagar Auditorium)
Tentative topic: Social Entrepreneurship and Business Ventures at the Bottom of the Pyramid
Mritunjay Kumar Tiwary is the founder & Head of Projects at the Akhand Jyoti Eye Hospital, Mastichak, Bihar, which has now become one of the top 5 eye hospitals in India. He started the project with a strong belief that eye-health delivered innovatively can alleviate poverty, improve gender parity and enhance social capital in the low-income states of India. The hospital offers world-class eye care services, including all sub-specialties, and perform over 65,000 surgeries annually, 80% free, and in the process, impacts the lives of 1 million people every year.
He also works actively to provide equal opportunities to girls from rural Bihar by running the unique ‘Football To Eyeball’ talent creation initiative at the eye hospital which aims to tackle child marriage and gender inequality by providing an alternative to girls. 140 girls have now reclaimed their lives with 30 girls added to the scheme every year. Mritunjay was given the Reliance – CNN IBN REAL HEROES AWARD in 2010 for this initiative.

Here's an important message to the student community from the desk of Dean (Student Affairs) regarding the potential strike that can begin from 5th August.

Dear Students,

There is a threat of an imminent strike by the outsourced mess workers of some of the halls where contractual employees are working. They may be supported by other contractual workers of the halls too. Already there is stoppage of work by some of these workers in the messes. The Institute administration is trying to handle the issue with the help of the district administration.

At this point we need cooperation from all students to overcome this situation. Arrangements are being made to have restricted cooking. The breakfast may be in packed form. The lunch and dinner may be cooked with the help of regular mess employees who will work extra time after completing the work in their respective halls. The campus community may also help in providing the food in halls. Institute administration is working out strategies to face the situation.

It is imperative that all the regular activities of the institute such as classes, labs, tests, co-curricular and extra-curricular will continue as usual. The students are advised not to enter into any kind of altercation with the employees. It is important that the student community shows its resilience in the face of adversity. Hall presidents and other hall council members will provide necessary guidance in the matter. The student leaders and the Institute authorities may be approached anytime in case of any difficulty related to this.

The very first day of the Assimilation program carried out by the  Student representatives of the TSG and Halls, turned out to be what can be said a remarkable start of a future-shaping program. The Sunday morning started with the basic introduction about Assimilation Program along with clearing off some doubts and rumors about this program. It was then followed by the description of upcoming Inter IIT competitions by the Gymkhana representatives. The Inter IIT Cultural, Sports and Technology student representatives explained students about the details of all these areas and possible ways to explore them.
The second program of the day conducted by the External Relations Cell received a great response from the students' side. The program "How to build a CV " and "Understanding GDs and Pis" mainly focused on the different fields that come under a CV. It gave a brief idea about how to build a CV including the do's and don'ts while formulating the CV. 
The final program 'Student Welfare Portfolio' described a typical life of a  student when in mental pressure and a friend's role in his or her life.
Awaaz encourages second years students to participate in these programmes and make the most out of it.
If you still have any queries regarding the Assimilation program, you can visit here. https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/assimilation-program-insights-faqs-a64d55a2fa9b

It is to inform all the students that when the regular bus service during the class hours starts from Monday (30-July-2018), the bus will drop and pick up students at the new Nalanda complex gate (old Hijli station roadside). Earlier, the buses used to drop and pick at the other opposite gate that features Subway. 
Students should take a note of it.

The penultimate day of the induction programme witnessed inspiring lectures from Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, Director, IIT Kharagpur and Mr. Mir Ranjan Negi, former goalkeeper of Indian National field hockey team in addition to the regular physical activities and department visits. Mr. Negi's career was the inspiration behind the 2007 hit film Chak De India. He talked about how he was evicted from mainstream hockey, but he was committed to take Indian hockey to new heights. His life is the perfect example of dedication and determination empowering a person to achieve the unachievable and answer the unanswerable. Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, in his welcome address to the freshers, talked about the academic excellence of IIT Kharagpur as an institute and the opportunities that the students get here be it in any department or stream of study.

message:
The fourth day of Induction Programme began with physical activities and games under the guidance of creative and prolific practice trainers. The morning session commenced with exciting life skills sessions which were then followed by an inspirational talk and screening of the movie 'The Unreserved' by National Award 2018 winning filmmaker and IIT KGP alumnus Mr. Samarth Mahajan.
In the afternoon session, Prof. Somesh Kumar, Dean of Students' Affairs addressed the curious freshers with knowledge of their streams and other necessary disciplines. 
Hall interactions with hall representatives and wardens took place so that the students could get to know about various hall activities that go on throughout the year.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages freshers to explore different aspects and beauty of the campus and boost yourself for the upcoming programmes.
Do feel free to ask us any queries regarding the campus, academics or anything else on our facebook page or our website (www.awaaziitkgp.org). Stay tuned for further updates in and around the campus!

message:
Much has been talked about the soon to be launched Assimilation Program for second year students, a first of its kind, aimed at familiarizing students with Hall and Institute culture. While most of the second year students seem to have reservations about its execution, others seem equally perplexed and hence, curious about its objectives. So, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had a talk with UG Representative so as to clear the air around the same. Give this one a read to know about the frequently asked questions about this program.
https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/assimilation-program-insights-faqs-a64d55a2fa9b

Rajit Karmakar, a Ph.D. Scholar in the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the prestigious Richard E. Merwin Scholarship this year. Under this scholarship, IEEE Computer Society offers $40,000 in student scholarships from $1,000 and up to recognize and reward active student volunteer leaders in student branches or chapters who show promise in their academic and professional efforts. His primary research interest is Hardware Security and VLSI Testing. He has completed his MS degree from the same department at IIT Kharagpur in the year 2015.
He has been a graduate student member of IEEE for the past three years. He is also a student member of IEEE Computer Society and IEEE Circuit and Systems Society. Starting as any other student member, he served IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur in the capacity of Student Activity Committee (SAC) member (2016), Chair, IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur (2017), and currently, he is serving as the University Partnership Program (UPP) Liaison, IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur (2018).
During these years of his association with IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur, they have organized several workshops (technical/ non-technical), technical talks by distinguished lecturers from all over the world, organizing conferences, partially supported IEEE Student members to attend conferences and lot more. IEEE TechSym 2016 was one such major event that was highly successful. He believes this award/scholarship is a recognization of his hard work and dedication towards IEEE activities throughout the last few years. (FInd out about their activities here: https://goo.gl/iT2UBB)
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Rajit for bagging this scholarship and believes that the efforts being put by IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur is commendable. They deserve all the appreciation.
Scholarship details: https://www.computer.org/web/students/merwin

The third day of the Induction Programme began with exhilarating Physical activities performed by the freshers filled with zeal. Discussions based on various life-skills and creative practices were held under the guidance of skilled practice trainers, faculty mentors and advisors. A beautiful display of Kalighat Paintings at a room in Nalanda was the cynosure of all eyes. To have a basic idea of their chosen stream, the students were guided to their departments where they interacted with their respective HODs and faculty members.
Mr. Aneesh Reddy, Co-founder and CEO, Capillary Technologies later delivered an inspirational talk related to career, success, culture, frontiers of science and technology, and self-exploration.
Earlier on Day 2, the President (TSG) addressed the students and familiarised them with the various activities that Gymkhana conducts throughout the year. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, encourages all the freshers to gear themselves up for the upcoming proceedings of the Induction Programme. For any queries, feel free to contact us on our facebook page or our website(awaaziitkgp.org). Stay tuned for further updates in and around the campus!

message:
The second day of the Induction Programme unfolded with the stress-busting Physical activities like yoga and aerobics which were performed by the visibly enthusiastic freshers under the supervision of trainers in Nalanda and Tata sports complex. Life skills and creative practices involving things such as music value-based discussions and dance were introduced to the different groups of freshers. 

The second day witnessed two sessions of speeches in Netaji Auditorium. In the morning session, Technology Students' Gymkhana President Prof. William Mohanty and Vice President, Vishal Kumar Singh illustrated the importance of extracurricular activities to the curious crowd which was present. Later in the day, Prof. Swagata Dasgupta, Asso-Dean, Continuing Education and Prof. Anindya Sarkar, Head, Geology and Geophysics gave inspirational talks on career, self-growth and frontiers of science and technology. A hall introduction is planned at night to cap off a versatile day two for the freshers.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages all the freshers to utilize the various aspects of induction and do not hesitate to ask us a query related to any campus-related activities. Follow our page and website(www.awaaziitkgp.org) to stay updated!

Notice | Open House for Final year students | 6.00 PM, Kalidas Auditorium

All eligible students of final year placement (2018-19) are advised to attend the Open House Session regarding the same to be conducted today. Chairman and other Vice-Chairmen will address the students.
Venue: Kalidas Auditorium
Date: 25th July (today)
TIme: Sharp at 6.00 PM 
This is mandatory to attend the session for all who are eligible for placement in this academic session i.e., all final year students of UG, PG, PhD etc.

It's finally the time when the air of expectations becomes a show of reality for the freshers!
IIT Kharagpur's six-day induction programme kicked off today with the introduction to the history of IIT-KGP. Following it, academic structure and opportunities were illustrated by Prof. Sudhir K. Barai, Dean(UG). Similar career talks were also given in the evening by Prof. Pallab Dasgupta, Dean, SRIC and Prof. Suman Chakraborty, Asso-Dean, SRIC.
The striking feature of today's activity though was the YourDost overview given in Netaji Auditorium to which the anxious freshers listened with keen attention. The day concluded with some physical activity for one of the groups.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, wishes all the freshers very best for exploring activities and interaction through the induction program. In case of any query, feel free to contact us on our facebook page or our website(awaaziitkgp.org). Stay tuned for further updates in and around the campus!

message:
Notice for Freshers |  Induction Programme 2018-19 | Schedule
Here's the schedule of the Induction Program which commences today. In this program, students would participate in a wide range of social activities, sports challenges, and life skills programs. The various activities under this program are as follow:
- Interaction with the Director and the administration team
- Know your department - interactions, awareness of opportunities, etc, available there
- Life Skills activities - in order to learn more about yourself, others, to develop abilities to deal with stress, conflicts, competitions and to develop bonding
- Creative and cultural events and activities that you are interested in
- Community life - in halls, and through relations with your seniors and faculty members
- Guest talks - by eminent speakers on various areas

आखिर साल का यह वक्त भी आ ही गया- पिछले चार-पांच सालों में बिताये उतार-चढ़ाव भरे अनगिनत हसीं पलों की मन में चिरस्थायी प्रतिबिम्ब हो जाने का वक्त, कैंपस की दीवारों में पलीं-बढ़ी स्मृतियों का ह्रदय में एक अभेद्य किला बन जाने का वक़्त। बेचैन नाईट-आउट्स में बुने गए अटूट रिश्ते, इल्लू और टेम्पो शाउट के बीच लड़ी गयीं जज़्बे और जज़्बातों की कई लड़ाइयाँ और न जाने कब ये बंधन अटूट-से बन गए। मानो पूरी ज़िन्दगी का सार २.२ की इन्हीं हवाओं और टिक्का-वेजीस के किस्सों में मिल गया हो। 

Nostalgia से कुछ दूर- KGP परिवार से विदाई ले रहे सभी रत्नों के लिए यह भावुक घड़ी उनके KGP के साथ हमेशा के लिए जुड़ जाने की भी है। इसी सिलसिले में 'आवाज़' प्रस्तुत करता है पासिंग-आउट सीनियर्स की यादों के गुलदस्तों से निकले कुछ अमूल्य फूल जिनसे हमने 'यादें' का यह संस्करण बुनने की छोटी-सी कोशिश की है। प्रस्तुत है 'यादें' 2018..
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos — with Nihal Gupta.

message:
आखिर साल का यह वक्त भी आ ही गया- पिछले चार-पांच सालों में बिताये उतार-चढ़ाव भरे अनगिनत हसीं पलों की मन में चिरस्थायी प्रतिबिम्ब हो जाने का वक्त, कैंपस की दीवारों में पलीं-बढ़ी स्मृतियों का ह्रदय में एक अभेद्य किला बन जाने का वक़्त। बेचैन नाईट-आउट्स में बुने गए अटूट रिश्ते, इल्लू और टेम्पो शाउट के बीच लड़ी गयीं जज़्बे और जज़्बातों की कई लड़ाइयाँ और न जाने कब ये बंधन अटूट-से बन गए। मानो पूरी ज़िन्दगी का सार २.२ की इन्हीं हवाओं और टिक्का-वेजीस के किस्सों में मिल गया हो। 

Nostalgia से कुछ दूर- KGP परिवार से विदाई ले रहे सभी रत्नों के लिए यह भावुक घड़ी उनके KGP के साथ हमेशा के लिए जुड़ जाने की भी है। इसी सिलसिले में 'आवाज़' प्रस्तुत करता है पासिंग-आउट सीनियर्स की यादों के गुलदस्तों से निकले कुछ अमूल्य फूल जिनसे हमने 'यादें' का यह संस्करण बुनने की छोटी-सी कोशिश की है। प्रस्तुत है 'यादें' 2018..

Nostalgia से कुछ दूर- KGP परिवार से विदाई ले रहे सभी रत्नों के लिए यह भावुक घड़ी उनके KGP के साथ हमेशा के लिए जुड़ जाने की भी है। इसी सिलसिले में 'आवाज़' प्रस्तुत करता है पासिंग-आउट सीनियर्स की यादों के गुलदस्तों से निकले कुछ अमूल्य फूल जिनसे हमने 'यादें' का यह संस्करण बुनने की छोटी-सी कोशिश की है। प्रस्तुत है 'यादें' 2018..
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 39 new photos.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos — with Ashwini Gupta and 2 others.

message:
In what could be deemed as a landmark step for academics and research in India, IIT Kharagpur has signed a MoU with the premier medical institution of the country- AIIMS, New Delhi to carry out joint academic programmes (such as Ph.D, MD-Ph.D, MSc-Ph.D) creating a new breed of graduates and collaborating for joint research projects. The target also includes conducting short modular courses designed for undergraduate and postgraduate students, exchange of faculty members, use of laboratory facilities and sharing of data. 

Both the institutions believe that this would pave way for the students to explore a completely new dimension of research in medical technology and would hence lead to path-breaking developments in the field. With interdisciplinary education being the call of the hour when it comes to world standards, this step can be regarded as a welcome step towards it. 

For more information, follow the link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/home/education/news/iit-kharagpur-aiims-ink-mou-to-boost-research-programmes/articleshow/65033142.cms
Picture Courtesy: Director IIT Kharagpur

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur's post. As we all know, KGP is all about people. The images of the Main Building, the Insti Tower or the Nalanda Classroom Complex may fade away with time, but one won't forget those bhaat sessions with their own squad of friends at Chhedis, or Veggies. They will always cherish those lovely moments spent on the 2.2 during their stay at KGP. For someone who is graduating from KGP in 2018, dedicate a line or two along with a picture of them with you. They can be someone from your juniors, batchmates, or seniors; but if you have some memories and a message for them, fill this form up. We will release all such entries from our page on the Convocation Day. What better gift than giving back those "Yaadgaar" moments to them? https://goo.gl/forms/jG6SAbJewIG64tUf1

message:
In a quite bizarre and shocking decision, the Union Government has awarded Institute of Eminence status to six institutions which don't include IIT Kharagpur and few other old IITs. Jio Institute by Reliance Foundation, Manipal Academy of Higher Education and BITS Pilani are the three private universities awarded this status whereas IIT Bombay, IIT Delhi and IISc Bengaluru are the government institutions bestowed with this status. The surprise entry was Jio Institute which has not even started functioning and is reportedly set to begin operations in next three years.  
The decision is aimed at improving the global rankings of Indian Universities since none of the Indian Institutions has a place in the top 200 in world rankings. All the six Institutes of Eminence will enjoy complete academic and administrative autonomy to start a new course, hire foreign faculties and collaborate with foreign institutes without government approval. The three public sector institutes will be given a grant of thousand crore rupees in the next five years. The MHRD had earlier aimed to select 20 Institutes of Eminence – 10 public and 10 private, which will enjoy complete autonomy. But the panel headed by former Election Commissioner N. Gopalaswami found only six to be fit despite almost all IITs applied for the coveted tag. 

Source: https://www.thehindu.com/education/six-universities-including-jio-institute-to-be-institutions-of-eminence/article24371429.ece

In a quite bizarre and shocking decision, the Union Government has awarded Institute of Eminence status to six institutions which don't include IIT Kharagpur and few other old IITs. Jio Institute by Reliance Foundation, Manipal Academy of Higher Education and BITS Pilani are the three private universities awarded this status whereas IIT Bombay, IIT Delhi and IISc Bengaluru are the government institutions bestowed with this status. The surprise entry was Jio Institute which has not even started functioning and is reportedly set to begin operations in next three years.  
The decision is aimed at improving the global rankings of Indian Universities since none of the Indian Institutions has a place in the top 200 in world rankings. The Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group (KRSSG) secured the 2nd position in the Goalie skills Challenge of the 3D Soccer Simulation League at RoboCup 2018, held in Montreal, Canada from June 15 to June 22, 2018. They competed against 6 other teams consisting of postgraduates and professors across Germany, USA, Portugal, Brazil and China, making a total of 7 teams that participated in the competition.
The league comprised of simulating Naobots via computer systems connected a server. Each Naobot had to access the situation of the field and the optimum strategy to use itself, which makes it a decentralised AI system. Two undergraduates, Shubhanan Shriniket and Pratik Tibrewal represented the team in this competition. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire KRSSG team for their success and all the laurels that they have brought to KGP!
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Animesh Dutta.

New semester's about to begin; new aspirations tending to spur into the veins of KGPians and monsoon's here too! What we require now is the ignition to kick-off this enthusiastic journey. How about a start with the FIFA WC'18?
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur, in association with the Wackers and Conferencia, presents to you the opportunity to catch the live action as top teams fight for the World Cup glory! The premises of the Technology Students' Gymkhana will be all set to invite you to a thrilling stadium-like experience as the heart-stopping matches would be streamed live on the 12 feet x 8 feet LED screen. We thank Prof. William Mohanty, President, and Mr. Vishal Kumar Singh, Vice President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, to grant us the permission to organise this Mega-Event. We also thank the sponsor, the Wacker, to make this initiative of our's a reality. Our success, however, depends on whether our motive for this event is fulfilled and that being the enjoyment of the entire community of IIT Kharagpur.
So gear up your enthusiasm, gather your squad and grab your boots to catch the thrilling FIFA WC'18 action, live at the premises of Technology Students' Gymkhana. 
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur, hopes for the well being of each and everyone as well as wishes the best for the upcoming session.

साहित्य के सितारे ।। बाबा नागार्जुन

Native Maithili speaker Baba Nagarjun was one of the most fearless Hindi poets that stepped up in the modern era. Often referred to as “Jankavi” or poet of the masses, many regard him next to only Tulsidas and Kabir when it comes to expressing mass sentiments bluntly.

Travelling shaped up his early writings as he wrote with a pen name of “Yatri” or traveller and “बादल को घिरते देखा है” a travelling monologue, is one of his finest works in this dimension. The other dimension that shaped up most of his literature was socio-political activism. He was highly impressed by Marxism and led peasants movements in Bihar. “आओ रानी, हम ढोयेंगे पालकी” is a sarcastic masterpiece that humiliates Pandit Nehru’s lavish welcome thrown to the British queen. Nagarjun played an active role in movements prior to the Emergency period in 1975-77 and masses hailed his views that were mostly rebellious of those in power.

“बन्दूकें ही हुईं आज माध्यम शासन का
गोली ही पर्याय बन गई है राशन का”
                     -मोर न होगा...उल्लू होंगे

Nagarjun was given the Sahitya Akademi Award in 1969 for his historic book Patarheen Nagna Gachh, and the 'Bharat Bharati Award' by the Uttar Pradesh government for his literary contributions in 1983. In times when the tendency to flow with the mainstream overhauls, Nagarjun’s defiant clarity  serves as an inspiration to speak out loud for the downtrodden and opens us up to the stark realities of life.

There were few concerns and speculations among the student community after the announcement of secure WiFi login through ERP. Speculations included daily/weekly limit on data usage, attempt to track down the nature of data usage etc. We contacted Head (CIC) over these speculations and found out that none of these are true.
As per Head (CIC), there is no change in usage policy in terms of data limit and time of usage. It would be same as it has been till now. Currently, it will just require you to authenticate into the Wi-Fi network so that only valid users are allowed to use it. However, there will be a limit on the no. of devices connected at any one point of time from a single user id so that the user id is not misused. The limit will be reasonable given that a student may have multiple devices like laptop, 1-2 phones etc., and there will be this device limit for all including faculty and staff, not just students. Right now, CIC has enabled the authentication so that the IIT community starts using it and they will consider the feedbacks before they finally make the entire Wi-Fi access authenticated. This is why they have not turned off the non-authenticated SSIDs now. They will give sufficient notice to the entire IIT community before the whole Wi-Fi becomes authenticated. 
As for the concerns over tracking down the nature of data usage, he said that the IIT network is for everyone's academic and reasonable personal use only. CIC does not track the nature of data usage and this authentication process does not change that policy, but users should not indulge in misusing the Wi-Fi network for illegitimate purposes. A general guideline of usage can be found in the Policies link of www.cic.iitkgp.ac.in. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages the students on campus to start using this authentication and report problems to CIC and provide them with feedbacks.

Here's an important update regarding Wi-Fi facility on the campus.
Wi-Fi access inside IIT Kharagpur is soon going to require user authentication. In order to test the system and allow for a smooth migration, CIC has now enabled three secured SSIDs, ACADEMIC_SECURED, STUDENT_SECURED, CAMPUS_SECURED. 

Any user should be able to see one or more of these wherever you may be in the campus. Users are requested to start connecting to the secured SSIDs following the procedure below to access the wi-fi network. 

1. Your user id is your ERP login. 

2. To create your network access password, log in to your ERP account, and follow the link "Set Campus Network Password" under the link for "Home". Set a password you will use for network access (should be different from your ERP password). You can change the password anytime again in the same manner. 

3. Configure your device for wi-fi authentication. Step by step instructions for different OS (Android/Windows/Linux/Mac) can be found in the "Wi-Fi Authentication" link in http://www.cic.iitkgp.ac.in. Normally, you will have to do this configuration only once per secured SSID unless you change your password or want to login with some other user id. 

4. Connect to the corresponding SSID. 

Please note the following: 

1. Normally, you may need 10-15 seconds for connection the first time you configure, please be patient. 

2. Faculty/Staff may share their password with their family members for wi-fi access. However, in order to avoid password misuse, there will be a limit for no. of simultaneous connections. Please note that the user with the user id is responsible for any misuse of the wi-fi network when connected with the user id. 

Note that for now the current non-secured SSIDs will stay open until further notice for wi-fi access by people with no ERP account such as guests, visitors, contractual staff needing access for their work etc. The policies for these classes of users and access methods will be circulated soon by CIC. 

However, users with ERP accounts are strongly advised to start using the secured SSIDs immediately and report any problems to CIC; the non-secured SSIDs will be withdrawn soon.

-CIC Support Team

Yoga, an ancestral art, is the treasure for the humanity to rejoice with its overarching benefits. The significance of Yoga is well-described in ancient scriptures along with the Shrimad Bhagavad Gita. Rather than being merely physical exercise, It is one of the most favourable paths to establish a deep connection between one’s body, soul, and nature. Not to mention, the practice of Yoga imparts physical, mental and emotional health in one’s life. 

United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) declared the International Yoga Day to be celebrated on 21st June which is also marked as the summer solstice, after being proposed by our Prime Minister, Mr. Narendra Modi. Since 2015, it has been celebrated in India and worldwide with great enthusiasm.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes you all a healthy and happy International Yoga Day!

We all learn a lot from our fathers. He is the person who introduces us to this world with the struggles and teaches to overcome the obstacles. A father may seem to be tough from the external appearance, but he knows exactly when to come to his child's rescue building perfectly the strength and fighting spirit of his child. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes a very Happy Father's Day to all the artists who skillfully shape up their children and give them the endurance to stand against the blows of life.

As Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of the soul-purifying month of charity and prayers-the month of Ramzan, let us all stand for love and sympathy in an era troubled with hatred. While Offering of "Namaz"  and charity to the poor symbolize this auspicious occasion of goodwill, the delicious dishes and warm hugs mark the joyful celebration!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes Eid Mubarak to one an all and hopes that our lives are blessed with the message of peace and brotherhood.

About a month is left for a new academic session when we all will be welcoming a new batch of freshers in our campus. It becomes important that we smoothen the process of this transitional phase in their lives so that they become acquainted with the type of culture and opportunities available to them. Keeping this in mind, an Induction Programme was organized last year for the first time to ease the process of inducting freshers. Although it was a good initiative, in the end, it received mixed reactions from the freshers. To answer questions about the need for an Induction Programme, the origin of the idea, execution of the plan and it's effectiveness we present to you an analysis of the programme conducted last year.  The analysis also includes feedback from freshers on various activities and a brief interaction with Prof. Priyadarshi Patnaik, (HOD, HSS Department) who was actively involved in the conduction of this Programme. The link to the article is: http://awaaziitkgp.org/induction.php

QS world ranking for the year 2019 has been released. In what may be inferred as an optimistic sign for IIT-KGP, there has been a slight surge in its ranking as it has moved up 13 places to 295 as compared to previous year's rank of 308. 

With a QS World rank of 162, IIT Bombay has surpassed previous year's leader IIT Delhi as the top Ranked Indian college. Amongst the other top Ranked Indian colleges, IISc Bangalore has made a 20-place jump to a rank of 170 while IIT Delhi and IIT Madras have maintained their ranks of 172 and 264 respectively. Most of the experts have deemed improvement in research output as the prime factor for better QS rankings of top-ranked Indian institutes. 

QS (Quacquarelli Symonds Limited) world rankings are one of the most widely read academic rankings, released every year based on scores of six metrics- academic reputation (40%), faculty-student ratio(20%), citations per faculty(20%), employer reputation (10%) and international students, faculty ratio(5% each). Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Stanford University, and Harvard University have retained their 1st, 2nd and 3rd position respectively.

message:
World Environment Day, driven by the United Nations Environment Programme to raise global awareness, is an important day to mark the rising environmental concerns and motivate positive actions to protect our beautiful planet Earth. The theme for the World Environment Day 2018 is “Beat Plastic Pollution”. It urges governments, industries, communities, and individuals to come together and explore sustainable alternatives and urgently reduce the production and excessive use of Single-use Plastic polluting our oceans, damaging the marine life and threatening human health.

India, the host of the year, has pledged to clean up its monuments and reduce the use of plastic disposables around them. If each and every one of us does at least one green good daily towards our Green Social Responsibility, there will be billions of green goods daily on the planet.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to everyone to contribute towards reviving the green diversity of our mother Earth!

The day couldn't have started on a better note for KGP! The research groups of our institute seem to be on a roll! In what comes as a matter of pride for KGP student community and a testimony of brilliance of its research fraternity, Autonomous Ground Vehicle (AGV) research group, IIT Kharagpur have secured second position in 26th International Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC) held at Oakland University in Rochester, Michigan on June 1 - June 4, 2018. 
A total of 43 teams across India, Japan, USA, Canada and Istanbul had registered for this prestigious navigation challenge. But our team gave the best of the colleges which included the likes of University of British Columbia, Georgia Institute of Technology, University of Michigan-Ann Arbor, Ohio University etc., a run for their money. 7 teams from India contested in it including those from IIT Madras and IIT Kanpur. Team AGV finished as Runner-Up, while the winners were the team CART (Center for Applied Research and Technology), Inc. at Bluefield State College, USA. 

They needed to make a bot which can follow the lanes avoiding the obstacles by following given GPS coordinates. They designed forward wheel drive bot with castor at back. The one travelling the maximum distance of the given arena would go on to win the competition. Their bot travelled a remarkable 260 feets in the process of finishing as Runner Ups.

The entire AGV team had started assembling and modelling of the bot from December itself and with ample support from Prof. DrDebashish Chakravarty of Mining Engineering Department, their efforts got better and better. As their bot scaled past the obstacles following GPS coordinates, it was in a way metaphoric of the AGV team scaling new heights with their efforts. And a special credit also goes to the first year members who worked relentlessly and contributed with great zeal and enthusiasm.

The Intelligent Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC) is an annual international robotics competition for teams of undergraduate and graduate students. Teams design and build an autonomous ground vehicle capable of completing several difficult challenges. To know more about AGV, visit: www.agv.iitkgp.ac.in

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team of AGV on this remarkable feat and hopes that the level and quality of research continues to set new standards in the upcoming days.

message:
The 6th International Convention of SPIC MACAY was inaugurated here at IIT Kharagpur on 3rd June. The convention will go on till June 9 and includes activities such as Hatha and Naad Yoga, Craft, Classical and Folk Intensives, Gurbani, Qawalli, theatre, Heritage walk and Cultural talks. It is being held in collaboration with the MHRD, Ministry of Culture and Ministry of Tourism, Government of India.
The Society for the Promotion of Indian Classical Music and Culture Amongst Youth (SPIC MACAY) was founded in the year 1977 by Professor Kiran Seth, an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur and also the recipient of its Distinguished Alumnus Award. As the name suggests the organisation aims to promote Indian classical music, dance, folk music, yoga and meditation and other forms of Indian arts and crafts.
The tentative schedule of the convention can be seen here:

message:
SPIC MACAY is presenting a precious opportunity for KGP students who are currently in the campus to attend their workshop and learn various forms of Music, Dance, Yoga, Painting, Pottery and other interesting craft skills. 
The workshops in Music includes Rabindra Sangeet, Dhrupad, Hindustani Vocal, Carnatic Vocal, Gurbani, Baul etc. Dance workshops includes Kuchipudi, Kathak, Odissi, Kathakali, Bharatanatyam, Mohiniyattam, Chhau etc. Yoga workshop would feature Hatha Yoga workshop. Other workshops includes sessions on paintings, crafts, pottery, basketry, weaving, mask making, paper cutting and wood carving. 

IIT KGP students who want to participate in this workshop and morning yoga sessions are requested to fill this google form and report to control desk in Nalanda Complex tomorrow (5/6/18) morning at 8.30 am. The seats will be filled on first come first serve basis. There is no charge for attending these workshops and yoga sessions.
Kindly don't fill the form if you want to attend the concerts only.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScCNsEkyQLa0H2WxNQX8bRvH2nJYfo-FOngkLUs5VjDk9gpqg/viewform

Advancing one step further in its aim to expand partnership with foreign institutions, IIT Kharagpur has signed agreements with University of Melbourne and Newcastle for joint study programmes. Full-time Dual Doctoral Programme (DDP) will be rolled out from the semester beginning in July, in collaboration with the University of Melbourne. The MoU with the University of Newcastle is focussed on joint academic and research programmes, joint supervision of doctoral and masters students and other exchange and knowledge sharing initiatives.

Dean of International Relations, Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya said, "We are delighted that the University of Melbourne, the top-ranked Australian university, will now be our partner in grooming a very select group of doctoral students from our two countries. An industrially advanced nation like Australia and a leading technological university like IIT Kharagpur with its own self-contained campus have a lot to offer to the growing Indian cities as far as infrastructural developments in smart cities are concerned. We are looking forward to working on a project wherein we can develop a model for Indian smart cities."

Source:https://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kharagpur-s-agreements-with-australian-univs-for-jt-study-118060100761_1.html

We are looking forward to working on a project wherein we can develop a model for Indian smart cities."
