Advancing one step further in its aim to expand partnership with foreign institutions, IIT Kharagpur has signed agreements with University of Melbourne and Newcastle for joint study programmes. Full-time Dual Doctoral Programme (DDP) will be rolled out from the semester beginning in July, in collaboration with the University of Melbourne. The MoU with the University of Newcastle is focussed on joint academic and research programmes, joint supervision of doctoral and masters students and other exchange and knowledge sharing initiatives.

Dean of International Relations, Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya said, "We are delighted that the University of Melbourne, the top-ranked Australian university, will now be our partner in grooming a very select group of doctoral students from our two countries. An industrially advanced nation like Australia and a leading technological university like IIT Kharagpur with its own self-contained campus have a lot to offer to the growing Indian cities as far as infrastructural developments in smart cities are concerned. We are looking forward to working on a project wherein we can develop a model for Indian smart cities."

Government survey carried out in 2016 shows that every fifteen minutes, a child becomes a victim of sexual abuse in our country. However, the volunteers of the IIT Kharagpur chapter of child rights organization - Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Volunteer Chapter are bound to contribute to a change in the bigger picture.

Under project "Balrakshak", initiated in September 2016, 29 workshops have been carried out till date across eight schools of Kharagpur. These workshops are aimed at making the children aware of the danger of sexual abuse and the results too, have been optimistic. Many children and parents have found and raised their voice against the prevalent social evil.

For the first time, "Baalrakshak" workshop was carried out with the support of police administration.Mr. Alok Rajoria (S.P., Paschim Medinipur) and Mr. Y. Raghuvamsi (A.S.P., Kharagpur) extended their support and assured giving legal help. This latest workshop of this project was carried out on 20th May in Kharagpur Mission Living School(Bangla medium), Digra which witnessed an active participation of around 100 children and 25 parents.

We congratulate the volunteers of CRY, IIT Kharagpur for this step and wish them all the best for more such initiatives in the future that would underline responsibilities of students towards social welfare.

Vision India Foundation is inviting applications and nominations for the third edition of  ​​World Governance Expedition (WGE), ​ ​an international travel program to study best governance practices across the world, ​being organized in partnership with the Embassy of Israel​, on​ October 13-19, 2018. The applications are open until June 3, 2018. For application and more information, interested ones can visit- http://visionindiafoundation.com/wge/selection-process/

For nomination, one can visit- http://visionindiafoundation.com/wge/nominate/

In case of any further query, an email can be sent to wge@visionindiafoundation.com.

Prof. G. P. Rajasekhar, Professor, Department of Mathematics has been selected for the award of "Mathematician of the Year - 2018" instituted at NIT Warangal. He joined the institute in 2000 and currently also holds the position of Chairman, Career Development Centre. His research areas include Boundary integral methods for viscous flows, Hydrodynamic and thermocapillary study of viscous drops, Applications of binary mixture theory to biological tissues. 

Prof. Rajasekhar has already been a recipient of many prestigious awards and honors which includes Alexander Von Humboldt Fellowship for Experienced Researchers by Alexander Von Humboldt Foundation, Germany (2008), Royal Society (United Kingdom) - INSA Visiting Scientist (2004), INSA (Indian National Science Academy) Young Scientist Award in Mathematical Sciences (2002), Japan Society for The Promotion of Science (JSPS) Fellowship (1998).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for his future endeavours!

In what comes as a stupendous achievement, Team 'Multi-Storey Surveillance' representing Swarm, IIT Kharagpur has won the 1st Runner-Up position at the national level Robotics competition DRUSE 2018 (DRDO Robotics & Unmanned Systems Exposition), organised by DRDO. They also received a prize of Rupees 1 Lac for implementation of their project in which they had conceptualised and made 7 different robots for various purposes. The final round was held at Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Pune from 23rd May to 25th May 2018. 
The team developed a swarm of heterogeneous swarm robot system, which can map an unknown environment and provide specialised assistance to military or rescue personnel. The system consisted of multiple swarm robots, which was carried by a single carrier robot, each robot having some specialisation of its own, and together they could achieve multiple objectives. Their proposal was to develop a Multi-terrain heterogeneous Swarm System along with a versatile software stack for Surveillance of multi-storey buildings.
The event involved 3-stages, the first one being an idea-submission stage where over 1000 ideas were submitted. Based on that, 30 teams were selected for each of the six regions. Our team stood 2nd at the regional level held at Jadavpur University. From each region, 5 teams were selected, and in the national level, there were 30 teams. Teams had to give live demos for the regional and national round. While the team from MES College (Kerala) emerged as winners, the team from College of Engineering (Pune) finished as 2nd Runner-Up.
The entire Swarm, IIT Kharagpur team gave it their all and were preparing for this competition since November 2017. The enthusiasm shown by first years was also exemplary. The team also gives the credit to Prof. Somesh Kumar for being always helpful with his inputs and also as the PI (Principal Investigator) of the Swarm Robotics group.
DRDO Robotics and Unmanned Systems Exposition (DRUSE) is designed to serve as an open platform to popularize and synergize the national talent in the areas of robotics amongst students for conceptualization, design & development of unmanned systems for defence applications.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire Swarm team for their sparkling performance and wishes them best for their future endeavours. We wish that it would go a long way in serving as a much-needed influx of inspiration to the students involved in various research groups.

message:
As another project under the Science and Heritage Initiative (SandHI) of HRD Ministry, IIT Kharagpur has taken up the Varanasi Urbanism Project to retrace Ganga rivers' old routes around which ancient Varanasi thrived and see if they can be brought back to life. These channels have been found to be alive in layers underneath and if activated have the potential to solve the water scarcity and drainage/sewage issues of the hugely populated city. IIT Kgp’s partners are University of Columbia, IIT BHU, and Varanasi Municipal Corporation. 

Professor Joy Sen, the HOD of Architecture Department and also the SandHI coordinator of IIT Kharagpur said, "The city is actually sitting on a well-networked water flow system, which has been unused for centuries. Together with our partner institutions we have devised a plan on how to activate it without disturbing the overground structures much." The team is routinely sending the PMO draft searches of their research and the Prime Minister is known to have shown his keenness in the project also because it can aid the transformation of Varanasi to a smart city through native wisdom. The Departments of Architecture and Civil Engineering have teamed up for the project.

Source - https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/eye-on-future-iit-kgp-traces-lost-footprints-of-ganga-in-varanasi/articleshow/64250149.cms

IIT Kharagpur has extended support to work in tandem with West Bengal government to boost the "Kanyashree" project that was rolled out in March 2013 and has also been awarded by the United Nations in June last year. It aims to provide economic assistance for higher studies and contribute to the social upliftment of girls from poor families. 

Director Prof. Partha Prathim Chakrabarti believes that availability of all types of books on a single platform, National Digital Library of India (NDLI), can be integrated with the  "Kanyashree" project to provide better inputs. He further insists that IIT Kharagpur is coming up with centers for emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Internet of Things (IoT) which can be useful in order to improve the quality of learning within the project.

Source- http://www.millenniumpost.in/kolkata/iit-kgp-expresses-interest-in-kanyashree-project-willing-to-work-with-government-300364

To make the future engineers more receptive and empathetic towards the society, Nation’s top engineering colleges, the IITs, are adding Music and Dances along with other Fine arts and Humanistic studies as their core engineering courses. It has been many years since colleges like IIT Madras have been offering integrated MA programmes in Economics and English, while IIT Delhi offers two-year programme and IIT Kharagpur teaches even Law.

IIT Kharagpur is emerging as a center for arts and music for students as well as research scholars. It is focussing more on Indian classical music and musical instruments and has an ongoing collaboration with Pandit Ajoy Chakraborty in this field. Currently, IIT Kharagpur is providing training in music, fine arts, and the performing arts, and also is offering credit courses in the form of electives and micro- specializations. The center will also create national and international outreach programmes for dissemination and collaborative research on science and technology interventions in Indian classical music and arts. IIT Kharagpur intends to begin research on classic musical instruments to bring in innovative materials and processes to optimize cost and time on the making of instruments like sitar and sarod. The main motive behind all this is to create a deeper understanding of social values among the students and preserve the national heritage of the country.

It has been many years since colleges like IIT Madras have been offering integrated MA programmes in Economics and English, while IIT Delhi offers two-year programme and IIT Kharagpur teaches even Law.

IIT Kharagpur is emerging as a center for arts and music for students as well as research scholars. In a quite shocking and startling revelation, it has been found out that a person who has been heavily followed on social media platforms and claimed himself to be an IIT KGP mechanical graduate everywhere, is not actually a KGPian and he has duped many people of large sums of money including many KGPians. Mr. Niladri Sarkar had claimed himself to pursue MS at Mechanical Engineering Department of IIT KGP and having worked as External Research Associate in the Fluid Dynamics Lab of MIT. He also claimed to be pursuing research at IIT Madras and IIT Bombay at different point of times. A few months ago, when he was in KGP campus, he started approaching faculty members stating that he is an alumnus of IIT KGP and he is willing to collaborate with them for his MIT Project. However, when he was confronted by one of our alumni, Dr. Kaushik Mukherjee on sensing a foul play, he took down most of these claims from social media. Upon contacting the concerned MIT professor, it was also found out that his MIT claim was totally fake. He social engineered his way into IIT KGP. He started adding IITians (and KGPians) to his friend list. Upon seeing a lot of mutual friends, the other students added him. He then approached the junior batches posing himself as an alumnus who was visiting the college on the pretext of meeting some professors and doing research. Many students on the campus got swayed by his claims and his online activities. The students somehow thought of Mr. Niladri Sarkar as a great academician, probably all due to his Quora popularity! And this is why the students were generous enough to lend him money as and whenever he requested. He asked many students for money stating his poor financial conditions and most of them did lend him money which hasn’t been returned yet. The amount that has been taken by him from the students sums up to be a hefty amount. 
The following were the claims of Mr. Niladri Sarkar:
1) Mr. Sarkar claims himself to be an IIT KGP student in both his Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/niladri.sarkar.3701) and Quora (https://www.quora.com/profile/Niladri-Sarkar-5) profiles which is false.
2) He pursued MS under the supervision of Prof. P. K. Das, Department of Mechanical Engineering. We confirmed it from the professor and he denied knowing any such student under his guidance.
3) He has an Institute ID card which does not look like the regular ones that we have.
4) He claims to have three research papers none of which are available online since they are done in collaboration with DRDO and AIIMS. These research papers are available within IIT Council, that’s what he has told some people.
5) A mail from Prof. Indranil Manna, Director, IIT Kanpur praising his research works.
6) The Research Quality Index certificate stating that he scored 100/100 in research and obtained an AIR 1. This certificate is claimed to be issued jointly by IIT Kanpur. According to him, this certificate is issued once in five years. However, we weren’t able to find out any such Index or program being organised by any IIT or IISc.
7) Interaction with Prof. S. K. Dash, Head, Department of Mechanical Engineering and other Professors of the department in Nalanda Class Room Complex. 
8 ) The offer of direct PhD studentship from Prof. Pradip Dutta, Professor and Chair, Department of Mechanical Engineering, IISc.
9) A mail from Dean MIT expressing their willingness to participate in the Indian Research Quality Index Conference which is going to be organised by him at IIT Kharagpur. No such conference took place in reality.
10) Selection as External Research Associate in Fluid Dynamics Lab of MIT under the supervision of Prof. John Bush. Upon contacting Prof. Bush regarding the validity of the report, the document was found to be fraudulent. Prof. Bush denied having any such student under his supervision
11) A nice conversation with Prof. Souvik Bhattacharyya, Senior Professor and Vice-Chancellor, BITS Pilani.
 12) Telephonic interaction with Prof. Amitabha Ghosh, former Director of IIT KGP
13) The evaluation report of MIT Fluid Dynamics Lab. 
14) There is also one online article (https://www.kenfolios.com/dont-topper-successful-proved-style/) wherein he was claimed to be KGPian.
Most of these claims have been found false. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur requests all the students to beware of such people including him and do not get swayed by any kind of unauthentic claims. We, as a unit, need to be safe from such elements and take care so that such incidents do not occur. Stay alert, stay cautious! Here’re the relevant pictures including the claims that he has now been taken down.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 16 new photos.

message:
Homecoming 2018, a reunion for the batch of 1998, 2003 and 2008, is going to be organized at IIT Kharagpur from 17th to 19th August 2018 by Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur. The itinerary for the same has been released and can be viewed in the following image. A special and much-anticipated event in this reunion will be the conferment of 1st ever edition of 'Young Alumni Achiever Awards' and also the participants will get a chance to witness the 68th Foundation Day of the Institute where these awards would be conferred. 

For registrations and details, please visit: http://alumni.iitkgp.ac.in/Alumniweb/GoThroughFeatured?feat_id=3

Although a fair amount of time has passed since hosting of the Open House with the director in order to discuss the institute's situation and preparedness against any such unfortunate incident in future, a recent notice on the internal notice board caught our attention. The notice which is about the appointment of Council of Dean SA which consists of 10 professors with Dean SA as the chairman. Attached is the notice which bears the date 2nd November 2017 and suggests that the council had been formed within a week of the Open House as announced in the action plan. The council has been formed to assist the dean in his work of looking after the students of the institute. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the council all the best in its future initiatives and endeavours and assures that it will extend its helping hand whenever required.

A group of twenty LGBTQ students and alumni from IITs have filed a petition in the Supreme Court against the controversial section 377 of Indian Penal Code(IPC), which criminalises homosexuality and any kind of "unnatural" sex.

This 20-member group represents an informal pan IIT group Pravritti, comprising over 350 LGBT students, faculty, alumni and staff. The members deem Pravritti as a safe space to interact, connect and network and not an activist group. The petitioners believe that the existing law, which was last upheld in December 2013, is regressive and prevents them from living a life of dignity and has also led to mental trauma and suicidal tendencies in many members. 

A series of petitions have been filed over the past few months then and activists believe that this fresh petition by IITians would  
add more weight to accelerate what has been a two-decade-old legal battle for rights of LGBT community.

Source: https://thewire.in/lgbtqia/20-iit-students-alumni-file-petition-sc-section-377

Pavan Kumar Maddala, a first year UG student from the Department of Mechanical Engineering is suffering from hearing problem since his childhood. This problem has severely affected his first year at IIT Kgp as he was unable to listen to the lectures. Now, as suggested by the doctors he is in immediate need of a surgery failing to which he could lose his hearing ability forever. This surgery costs INR 10 lakhs. Considering the fact that he belongs to a poor background, the arrangement of this amount needs our immediate help. We urge the student community to come together and help this needy KGPian! 

For donation and details please visit- https://www.ketto.org/fundraiser/Helppavankumar#/action/edit

By now, some of you if not all, must have come to know about a gathering to be held this evening on the recent altercation going on in AMU. In what can be called as a bold move from the institute administration in curbing such political influence on the mindset of the student populace of IIT Kharagpur, the Dean of Students' Affairs has circulated a mail discouraging any such events which are organized with hidden political motives. He reiterated that tagging the name of IIT Kharagpur in such events which may escalate tension in society in the name of political affiliation, religion, caste and region can not be tolerated. Although he did not mention the extent to which the institute would be considering the severity of political motive, but the statement does send out a message regarding the degree of seriousness with which such detracting events are being taken into consideration by administration. Here is what the mail reads:
"It is being observed that some groups with political motivation are organizing some events in IIT Kharagpur but tagging the name of IIT Kharagpur. This is to inform you that such events are completely illegal and have no sanction of institute authority. IIT Kharagpur is an institution of national importance and we do not encourage any activity which escalates tensions in the society in the name of political affiliation, religion, caste and region. Our sole aim is to promote development of science and technology and nationalistic fervour among students.
We expect that students of IIT Kharagpur will not participate in any such event."

A mother can be best described as someone who takes place of all others but whose place no one else can take. A mother's love is a miracle that never ceases to be miraculous from the very day we are born. She always stands with open arms when we need a hug. Her heart always understands when we need a friend. She stands with stern eyes when we need a lesson. Her strength and love always guide us all parts of life. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone Happy Mothers' Day.

If you are feeling stressed but don’t know the right way to become stress-free, then this is the app coming to help you- ‘DhyanAndroid’. It consists of self-evaluation of stress levels through user feedback and instructive meditation for emotional stability. It is a first-of-its-kind app which not only assesses the cognitive performance, emotional intensity and aggression level but also creates a virtual simulation of a meditation room through thermal imaging and vibrations. Developed by Professor Aurobinda Routray, Department of Electrical Engineering, along with a team of researchers from IIT Kharagpur, the Android and iPhone variants of the app will be launched by June 10.
According to the developers, this app will help users become emotionally stable and bring depression under control. 

Source: https://www.gadgetsnow.com/tech-news/app-designed-at-iit-kharagpur-to-fight-stress/articleshow/64058316.cms?from=mdr

“Where the mind is without fear” are the lines which portrayed the true meaning of freedom and independence to colonial India under the British Raj and continue to inspire us to move forward in the direction of free thoughts, rational thinking, and ‘tireless striving’ towards our goals. The poem is a part of the Nobel winning work ‘Gitanjali’, a collection of poems, by Rabindranath Tagore. 
Rabindranath Tagore was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in the year 1913 becoming the first Asian to be honoured with the Nobel. Along with being a renowned poet, he was also a writer, novelist, visual artist, composer, playwright, and a philosopher. His works influenced a wide range of Indians during the freedom struggle. Such was the impact of his works that two of his compositions were chosen by India and Bangladesh as their National Anthems. Tagore always stayed away from the concept of separatist nationalism and urged the people to get over the narrow differences of casteism and other social evils. 
On his 157th birth anniversary, paying tribute to the revolutionary thinker, we hope that his ideas of freedom will be realised deeply as our nation progresses.

Charles Dickens once said, “There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humour.”  
Through humour, you can soften some of the worst blows that life delivers. And once you find laughter, no matter how painful your situation might be, you can survive. On the occasion of World Laughter Day, let us laugh and make others laugh. Let us happily face every moment in our life, emerge out as an ecstatic person and make the world a better place to live in.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a wonderful Laughter Day!

The morning of the 5th of May, 2018 witnessed what may be called a giant step towards progress - the service of Ola Pedal has been inaugurated in the campus. The service was flagged the green signal by the Institute in the presence of the Director, Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, the Dean of Students' Affairs, Prof. Somesh Kumar, the President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, Prof. William Mohanty and Vice President for the session 2017-18, Technology Students' Gymkhana, Mr. Mayank Srivastava, following which the group enjoyed a 2.2 ride. 

The Ola Pedal Service would have maintenance on a regular basis by the technicians of the company. The 'end ride' option would be followed by a rating and feedback form where the rider can lodge complaints regarding the cycles or the service. Thereafter, the particular Pedal would be inactive for a period of 24 hours for maintenance displaying a message that the Pedal isn't available if anyone tries to book it during that period.
Even though the maintenance would be ensured by the technicians at Ola, being the prime stakeholders in this Institute and all the property that belongs to it, it is our duty to help and maintain these resources and prevent their vandalism, as our own responsibility. The sustenance of these resources would be crucial for the benefit of the entire IIT KGP community and we, as the members, should ensure it. It is up to us whether we can help this system grow or be demolished at the hands of our ignorance and irresponsibility. It is who makes the system and it is us who destroys it too. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur believes that the IIT KGP community is responsible enough to understand and feel the importance of the service and would be ready to extend their help in sustaining the service and all the others, yet to arrive. Let us make the campus a better place to live in and a better, yet, in the eyes of the world.
Image Credits: Click Kgp
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.

The beautiful campus of IIT Kharagpur is waiting for you with a slight twist in its flavour. No need, now, to be afoot and toil in the scorching sun or get drained in the rainwater to reach your destination inside the campus. Ola Pedal is here and this has been made possible due to the great efforts of the Technology Students' Gymkhana. Now you can pick up a cycle from any of the Ola Parking Zones, majorly in the Halls of Residence, Main Building, Vikramshila and Nalanda. Using the cycles would cost you INR 5/- for the period of 15 minutes exclusive of taxes and would amount to about INR 6/- for the period including them. Just download the regular Ola Mobile App and you can book the ride, cashless and hassle-free. Enter the number below the QR code at the rear mudguard or the lock module of the cycle with the App and your cycle unlocks, ready to give your hair, the sway in the cool breeze of Kharagpur. The Ola Parking Zones are the only spots where the ride can begin or end. You can lock or unlock the cycle at any place other than these zones but the ride will continue to be chargeable in that case. The cycles cannot be taken outside the campus. 

The cycles have adjustable seats, tubeless tyres, anti-slip chains and anti-rust alloy rims that make them effective to use.

The inauguration ceremony for the service will be held on 5th May 2018 from 10.30 AM. Also, it must be noted that only a few out of the forty locations will be active until July. The department locations will be active from July. More locations where the cycles would be stationed might be targetted in the future and it is when our campus would truly become easily accessible to everybody. 

Detailed features and functioning of the facility and the list of the Ola Parking Zones will follow soon.
With this hope and full appreciation to the efforts and success of Mr. Seemant Jay and the Technology Students' Gymkhana, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone happy, safe and easy rides from anywhere to anywhere on this beautiful campus.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.

message:
The beautiful campus of IIT Kharagpur is waiting for you with a slight twist in its flavour. No need, now, to be afoot and toil in the scorching sun or get drained in the rainwater to reach your destination inside the campus. Ola Pedal is here and this has been made possible due to the great efforts of the Technology Students' Gymkhana. Now you can pick up a cycle from any of the 40 locations to any other of these locations including 15 Halls of Residence and 25 other prime locations spanning the beautiful IIT Kharagpur Campus. Using the cycles would cost you INR 5/- for the period of 15 minutes exclusive of taxes and would amount to about INR 6/- for the period including them. Just download the regular Ola Mobile App and you can book the ride, cashless and hassle-free. Scan the QR code at the rear mudguard or the lock module of the cycle with the App and your cycle unlocks, ready to give your hair, the sway in the cool breeze of Kharagpur. You can lock and unlock the cycle anywhere on the campus using the QR code but the ride can be begun or ended at the 40 locations inside the campus only. The service is expected to be fully functional by the 3rd of May 2018.
More locations where the cycles would be stationed might be targetted in the future and it is when our campus would truly become easily accessible to everybody. With this hope and full appreciation to the efforts and success of the Technology Students' Gymkhana, Awaaz IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone happy, safe and easy rides from anywhere to anywhere on this beautiful campus.

message:
With profound grief and deep sorrow, we inform you all the sad demise of our beloved student Veeral Sheth in an unfortunate road accident yesterday morning. He was a third-year undergraduate student of the Department of Biotechnology and a boarder of the Rajendra Prasad (RP) Hall of Residence. 
He served as Sponsorship and Marketing Head and then as Core Team Head in the Spring Fest team, IIT Kharagpur. Always bubbling with spirit and full of enthusiasm, he was an amiable, kind-hearted and a gem of a person. 
This is an irreparable loss for the entire KGP community. May God grant enough strength to his friends and family to bear this great loss. We all pray for the peace of the departed soul.

In an initiative to strengthen the health and medical facilities on the campus, the IITKGP Foundation US has donated a high tech ambulance to IIT Kharagpur.
The medical equipments include transport ventilator, defibrillator, syringe pump, suction pump, fully regulated oxygen supply system for patients, patient monitor for BP, ECG, oxygen saturation in blood, respiratory rate, pulse rate and a foldable stretcher trolley for comfortable transfer of the patient to and fro the ambulance. The ambulance has dedicated batteries and alternators for uninterrupted power supply and air-conditioning one for the patient cabin irrespective of the engine function. 

http://www.millenniumpost.in/kolkata/iit-kgp-alumni-design-customised-ambulance-for-patients-gift-it-to-alma-mater-296359

General Championship 2017-18 || Final Standings

This edition of General Championship saw spectacular participation from various halls of residence in an extravaganza of various sports, cultural and technology events. The zeal and enthusiasm of the participants were striking during the events and so was during the award ceremony held on April 13, 2018, in the Kalidas Auditorium. Though each and every hall tried the best of them, a handful of them excelled and received the much-desired trophies and cups in an aura filled with the tempo-shouts and bliss. 

The final standings of each General Championship are as follows:

||General Championship Social & Cultural||

The battle for the trophy went up to the last event and the competition between RK and Patel ultimately ended up in favour of RK. Both RK and Patel conquered over the cups in 4 categories.
1. RK (913.3 Points)
2. Patel (888.3 Points)
3. Azad (545 Points)

Dramatics Cup - RK
Fine-arts Cup - RK
Entertainment Cup - Patel
Literary Cup - Patel

||General Championship Sports & Games||
1. Azad (70 Points)
2. MMM (42 Points)
3. LBS (36 Points)

||General Championship Technology||
1. LBS (420 Points)
2. Azad (335 Points)
3. RP (330 Points)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and appreciates the participants for putting their efforts. For further details and event wise points distribution, follow the link: http://awaaziitkgp.org/GC201718.php?page=gc

Recently, one of our fellow students, Mr. Nanda Kishore, a fifth-year student from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering succumbed to a multiorgan failure in a hospital in Kolkata. The sad demise took place owing to tuberculosis which was identified during his operation of appendicitis there. Though the first operation was successful, he could not recover and died after continuously struggling for 21 days. 

The Senate along with the faculty members from Administration, being concerned about the poor financially state of his family, have decided to raise a fund of INR 300000 including the expenses for his treatment to help them sustain for a year and find a stable option with time.
 
Here is the link to the fundraiser for Mr. Nanda Kishore: https://www.ketto.org/fundraiser/nandkishore?utm_source=campaigner&utm_medium=fbpageshare&utm_campaign=nandkishore&utm_content=440586

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the students’ community to help the family of Mr. Nanda Kishore to the best of their capability and prays for the departed soul to rest in peace.

Time and again KGPians have showcased their brilliance in the entertainment industry and this time it is the National Film Awards where their talent has been rewarded.
 
A non-feature film titled "The Unreserved", made by two of our alumni, Ashay Gangwar and Samarth Mahajan, has been awarded the National Film Award for the year 2017 for best On-Location sound recordist. 

This is a moment of pride for the KGP student community and simultaneously highlights how hard work when coupled with passion, leads to unprecedented results.

||New Course on Functional Materials & Devices|| 

Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur commences a new course namely ‘M.Tech. in Functional Materials & Devices’ which replaces the earlier Solid State Technology (M.Tech.) course from the very next academic session. 

The newly introduced course structure comprising of a good range of interdisciplinary courses from Dept. of E & ECE, Materials Science Centre, etc. aims to produce a better workforce which can tackle the modern challenges in industries. Apart from the elemental constituents, courses on Computational Methods, Science & Technology of Nanomaterials and Advanced Experiments in Solid State Technology are also included in the curriculum. 

With a total of 25 seats, applications are invited from the students of Applied Electronics & Instrumentation, Applied Electronics Engg., Electronic Instrumentation & Control, Electrical & Electronics Engg., Electronics Engg.- Design & Manufacturing, Engineering Physics, Physics/Applied Physics and Material Science & Engineering.

The applicants with following qualifying degree can apply for the same:
1. B.E./B.Tech. or Equivalent 
2. M.Sc. (With Mathematics both at +2 and B.Sc. level) 
The deadline for online application for submission is April 18, 2018 (Wednesday). 

Interested students may follow the link below for the application: http://gate.iitkgp.ac.in/jmp/?id= 
More information can be gathered right from the Admission Brochure 2018: http://gate.iitkgp.ac.in/jmp/doc/jmp2018_brochure.pdf

message:
In what can be termed as a historic event for alumni-generated funding of IITs, Shion Deysarkar, CEO of Datafiniti and son of US-based entrepreneurs and IIT Kharagpur’s alumni Dr. Asoke Deysarkar and Dr. Ruma Acharya Deysarkar, has donated a whopping sum of 2 crores to his parents’ alma mater in what is a first of its kind instance. 

A MoU has been signed regarding the funds and it will be utilized towards setting up three Chair Professorships in the domains of Geology & Geophysics, Chemical Engineering and Chemistry/Mining Engineering at IIT KGP’s Asoke Deysarkar and Ruma Acharya Centre of Excellence in Petroleum Engineering.

Shion Deysarkar, who is American by birth and upbringing and a data scientist from Carnegie Mellon University, says that this is an opportunity for him to help his parents continue their work at IIT-KGP and also finds it as an interesting way to merge Indian and American academic cultures to create mutual beneficiaries. 

The director Prof. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti and the recently appointed Dean of Alumni affairs Prof. Subrata Chattopadhyay warmly welcomed this move and reckoned that this amount would not only be of great importance for IIT Kharagpur to maintain its legacy in several initiatives but also prove to be an ice-breaker for Alumni progeny to associate themselves with the culture of contributing to the IIT ecosystem.

Source: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/education/in-a-first-us-based-son-of-iit-kharagpur-alumni-donates-rs-2-crore-to-parents-alma-mater/articleshow/63716574.cms

As the academic session is nearing its end, it's high time for felicitation to those who have done exceptionally well in their fields during their stay at KGP. Here is the list of Gymkhana Awardees for the academic session 2017-18. The awardees are announced separately in the fields of Social and Cultural, Technology and Sports and Games. The awards will be given in the Gymkhana Awards Distribution Ceremony to be held on 13th April 2018, 6 PM onwards at Kalidas Auditorium. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them!
Credits: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur

message:
Our fellow KGPians have now and again made the country proud with their innovative ideas being showcased at the best of the platforms in the world. This time, it’s the Team Infinity from IIT Kharagpur which bagged the third prize in the Innovation Summit Bold Ideas Competition at Paris organized by Schneider Electric, one of the biggest players in the field of renewable energy. The team consisting of Nawazish Parwez, Nihal Gupta, Soumya Dubey, Akash Kumar and Gaurav Kumar  (right to left in photograph) performed exceptionally well in the first round of the competition that saw a participation of more than 240 teams from 40+ countries all around the world to secure a place among the top 10 teams to showcase their talent in the summit to be held in Paris. Their idea was based on the hybrid solar panel which increases the efficiency of the existing conventional system, using the modern principles of Materials and Environmental Engineering. The idea was appreciated by the judging panel consisting of environmentalists and scientists all around the globe.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them for bringing laurels to the institute and encourages the student community to participate in such competitions.

A soon-to-be-published book "Groundwater of South Asia" edited by an IIT Kharagpur Associate Professor, Prof. Abhijit Mukherjee, suggests setting up of a “Groundwater mission” which would help to tackle the problems associated with hydraulic dissipation in the South-Asian region, mainly comprising arsenic and fluoride pollution and storage anomaly. 

Attached to the Department of Geology & Geophysics in the institute's School of Environmental Science and Engineering, Prof. Mukherjee has worked in different parts of South Asia, looking at groundwater issues for almost two decades.

It is noteworthy that despite being the fruit-bearer of three large water systems, almost half the water that enters the South Asian hydrologic system is dissipated by poorly understood and quantified processes. Although there have been several projects to accelerate and improve the drinking water supply in India, such as “Rajeev Gandhi Drinking Water Mission” and “National Rural Drinking Water Programme”, Prof. Mukherjee’s book recommends that there is a dire need of a groundwater mission on similar lines.

Source: http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/groundwater-mission-can-address-a-host-of-problems-iit-kharagpur-scientist-118041000344_1.html

Around a month ago, most of us witnessed some great effort put in by few halls in the Inter-Hall Gardening competition and the fresh pictures of lovely gardens were enthusiastically shared. Unfortunately, or rather habitually, the gardens haven’t taken long to topple off the peak. Given that lot of effort by Hall staffs and considerable money (as high as Rs. 50,000) goes into preparation for this competition, we must ponder over the meaningfulness of this competition and alter our approach to the maintenance of Hall gardens.
Find the full report here: https://medium.com/@awaazofiitkgp/curious-case-of-inter-hall-gardening-45bfe3dfd56c

Here is the list of students awarded MCM Scholarship as Residual Vacancy for the year 2017-18.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the students who have not updated their details with the ERP, to update them as soon as possible or update them at the Accounts Section in the Main Building, as it creates hurdles in such crucial processes.

West Bengal has always been rich in culture and heritage, also due to the British rule of East India Company establishing its roots in India through Kolkata. But we have lost our culture, haven’t we? If not fully, then to a great extent. 

The Department of Humanities and Social Sciences of IIT Kharagpur is teaming up with the University of Liverpool, UK to aid conservation efforts in the state of West Bengal and help in protecting the cultural heritage of cities and towns along the course of Hooghly river. The places where the project will focus are Bandel, Chinsurah, Chandannagar, Serampore, and Barrackpore which are former trading posts and garrison settlements along the Hooghly. The project is being jointly funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK and the Indian Council for Historical Research.

Source- http://indianexpress.com/article/cities/kolkata/iit-kharagpur-kicks-off-project-to-aid-conservation-5129442/

The Technology Students’ Gymkhana has introduced 3 new positions of Institute Girls’ Sports Secretaries in order to enhance the sporting culture among the girls of IIT Kharagpur. The 3 representatives for the office of Institute Girls' Sports Secretaries shall be nominated by the panel under the Technology Students’ Gymkhana. All girls with an experience of a minimum of one academic year can apply for the post. Applications are invited for these positions of responsibility of immense importance for the academic session 2018-19.  

Interested ones can mail their sports resume to gsecsportsiitkgp@gmail.com before 12 noon, 12th April 2018. For further details regarding the post, do refer the document attached below.
https://tinyurl.com/GirlSportsSecy

Other three candidates Sheet Kushal, Altamash Zaidi and Samruddhi Pataskar will act as the heads of IWG as per the undertaking signed.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates them and wishes them all the best for their tenure.

The Internal SOAPBOX for the election of General Secretary, Students' Welfare, Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur for the academic session 2018-19 is going to be held today at the Old Badminton Court, TSG from 6:30 pm. Here are the proposals of the five candidates namely Abhrajit Saha, Mohammad Altamash, Ruchin Raj, Samruddhi Pataskar and Sheet Kushal: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/161_C8Z9TTbebCHyPoFdw4btjXKW4FgwS

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur requests the KGP student community to go through the proposals and attend the SOAPBOX to ask relevant questions to the candidates. Although the students will not vote in this election, their questions may well impact the election process. The students can ask their questions through this Google form, from which the moderators will pick relevant questions. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdXZdUz-UdwQFUQOM_2vbG5aav6PWZ7BQw8BzCRCKVo5cmhWw/viewform

Those innocent children from Nursery and LKG classes took everyone in Kalidas auditorium back to their childhood when they danced, albeit without much appreciable coordination among themselves, but this is what makes them children and brought a smile on everybody's face. Gopali Youth Welfare Society celebrated 'Aashayein', the tenth annual day of Jagriti Vidya Mandir, a school run by the society which has lighted the lives of 200 underprivileged children, on 7th April. Professor Somesh Kumar, Dean of Student Affairs graced the occasion as the chief guest and Prof. Mrigank Sharad, Dept. of Electronics & Electrical Communication Engineering, Prof. Seema Singh, Dept. of Humanities and Social Sciences and Mr. Mrinal Kanti Bhanja, Founder and President of Gopali Youth Welfare Society graced the function as guests of honour and praised the members of GYWS for their selfless work. 
To know more about the Gopali Youth Welfare Society, please visit: http://awaaziitkgp.org/gyws.php

Voting for the election of the next set of office bearers is underway at the Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur. Students are pouring in large numbers. There are two voting booths, one in the Assembly Hall (on the right, near Squash Court) and another in the Old Badminton Court (on the left, near president's and sports officer's office). However, there is scorching sun out there but that doesn't seem to deter the spirits of voters. Apart from the lunch break from 1 to 2 PM, the voting will go on from 2PM to 6PM.
What are you waiting for? Go and cast your vote! 
#Your_Choice_Your_Vote_Your_Voice
#Aapka_Vote_Aapki_Awaaz

World Health Day is celebrated on 7th April every year in a hope to raise awareness among people about the importance of health and well-being in our lives and how our own habits affect our mental as well as physical health. The theme for World Health Day 2018 is “Universal Health Coverage: Health for all”. On the occasion of World Health Day, let us pray for everyone’s well-being, improve our lifestyles and take one step ahead towards a healthy life.

Also, let us come up and vote to choose the right candidates in TSG Elections 2018. We control our own destiny to a large extent. Let us break the system of our vote getting influenced by others. Voice your own opinion.
#YourChoice_YourVote_YourVoice
#HealthForAll

Have you ever thought what happens, after the candidates are elected, to those proposals? Should the VP and other elected TSG representatives be asked to give a public review of their proposals? 
A question that has time and again surfaced and the opinion of the student community has always been positive about it with 95.63% of poll respondents accenting in a poll carried out by Awaaz last year. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents a summary of the proposal updates of the General Secretaries, Sports and Games, Harsh Saraf and Manish Datta. However, their counterparts for Technology (Anmol Shakya and Anusha Sharan) and Social and Cultural (Vaibhav Dusad and Aman Choudhary) didn't give the Proposal Updates to Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur.

The video for the interview can be found here: http://bit.ly/GSecSports

The elections in KGP have always been amongst the high octane affairs and the proposals made by the candidates may well be driven by the energy and powerful ambitions rather than the proper feasibility study. Most of the times, one year may be a time duration too small for carrying out the tasks according to the proposals. We also consider that the representatives have so many other issues to deal with. We believe that the students must get to know what happened in a particular representative's tenure so that everyone has a record that can help the subsequent representatives in taking further decisions.

message:
Have you ever thought what happens, after the candidates are elected, to those proposals? Should the VP and other elected TSG representatives be asked to give a public review of their proposals? 
A question that has time and again surfaced and the opinion of the student community has always been positive about it with 95.63% of poll respondents accenting in a poll carried out by Awaaz last year. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents a summary of the proposal updates of the General Secretaries, Sports and Games, Harsh Saraf and Manish Datta. However, their counterparts for Technology (Anmol Shakya and Anusha Sharan) and Social and Cultural (Vaibhav Dusad and Aman Choudhary) didn't give the Proposal Updates to Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur.

The video for the interview can be found here: http://bit.ly/GSecSports

The elections in KGP have always been amongst the high octane affairs and the proposals made by the candidates may well be driven by the energy and powerful ambitions rather than the proper feasibility study. Most of the times, one year may be a time duration too small for carrying out the tasks according to the proposals. We also consider that the representatives have so many other issues to deal with. We believe that the students must get to know what happened in a particular representative's tenure so that everyone has a record that can help the subsequent representatives in taking further decisions.

message:
IIT-KGP’s path-breaking project of the bio-electric toilet has won the Prime Minister’s Swachha Bharat Award!

The civil engineering department of IIT-KGP, with the assistance of School of Environmental Science & Engg. and P K Sinha Centre for Bioenergy has made a bio-toilet, whose giant flush needs to be filled with 500 litres of water, which then recycles itself for a lifetime of use, which can stretch up to 15 years. Moreover, the waste can also be used to generate electricity!
Prof. Makarand Ghangrekar of the civil engineering department, who is the project leader, believes that the toilet would solve the problems of water crisis associated and meet the needs of rural sanitation. 
Follow the link below for the complete news report
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/iit-kgp-builds-bio-toilet-wins-pms-swachh-bharat-award/articleshow/63572387.cms

The Ministry of Human Resource Development released the annual rankings of colleges under the National Institutional Ranking Framework, which ranks the best colleges and universities in India. IIT Kharagpur has slipped one place in the overall rankings, dropping from 4th to 5th position despite an increase in the overall score from 68.43 to 71.39 (out of 100). IISc Bengaluru continues to be on the top of the overall rankings.

IIT Kharagpur's score under "Outreach and Inclusivity" (OI) parameter has seen a significant decrease from a total of 72.85 to 56.16. There is also a drop from  64.72 to 62.1 in the score of "Perception" which involves the perception of students, employers, investors, and public.

However, in a remarkable feat, IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the first rank in Architecture rankings with a total score of 78.41. 
Also, Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law, IIT Kharagpur (RGSOIPL) and Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur (VGSoM) have bagged fourth and seventh position respectively in Law and Management categories which stands testimony to KGP's excellence in the respective fields despite the presence of top-class NLUs, IIMs and other premier universities.

Picture Courtesy: Partha P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur.
For more details, please visit https://www.nirfindia.org/2018/OverallRanking.html

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur invites applications for the Gymkhana Awards in Technology, 2017-18 for the following awards:

1. G.S. Sanyal Cup 
2. Institute Order of Merit
3. Honourable Mention
4. Ankik Dhar Trophy (Outgoing All rounder with involvement in all three events Sports and Games, Social and Cultural and Technology and exceptional performance in at least one of them)
5. Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)

In the resumes following information can be included:

1. Inter IIT Participation, and achievement if any
2. Intra and Inter College/University Participation in competitions, and achievement if any
3. Participation in various national and international conferences as a student of IIT Kharagpur, and achievement if any
4. Meaningful projects and technical paper publications
5. Positions of Responsibility held at the Gymkhana or any other organisation in the institute
6. Any other contribution to IIT Kharagpur at the Institute level

Any student awarded punishment by the Standing Disciplinary Committee of the Institute/Examination Malpractice Prevention Committee of the Institute shall not be eligible for Gymkhana awards.

Mail your resumes and relevant documents (for the verification of credentials) to tech.gymkhana@gmail.com at the earliest.

Application Deadline - 6th April 2018, 11.59 PM.

No applications beyond the deadline will be entertained.

3. Participation in various national and international conferences as a student of IIT Kharagpur, and achievement if any
4. Meaningful projects and technical paper publications
5. Positions of Responsibility held at the Gymkhana or any other organisation in the institute
6. Any other contribution to IIT Kharagpur at the Institute level

Any student awarded punishment by the Standing Disciplinary Committee of the Institute/Examination Malpractice Prevention Committee of the Institute shall not be eligible for Gymkhana awards.

Mail your resumes and relevant documents (for the verification of credentials) to tech.gymkhana@gmail.com at the earliest.

Application Deadline - 6th April 2018, 11.59 PM.

No applications beyond the deadline will be entertained.

In a further development in the recent case of candidature form being torn, we were today approached by the concerned stakeholder who had claimed that his form was torn, to get his public apology issued through our page. Here it goes:
"Dear KGP Junta,
This message is regarding the complaint I have filed with the administration about the misconduct in the election process by two undergraduate students of a certain Hall of Residence.
The Dean (UG), Election Officer and other Professors present in the meeting brought to my notice that my act of letting KGP populace know about the said incident and the contents of the e-mail conversation in which I was a party too, through campus media bodies without proper consent of the authorities was a mistake. I sincerely apologize to all the KGP students and the professors involved in for the way I handled this matter.
Regards
Application No. ** "

IIT Kharagpur, a few months ago, observed growing discontent against the facilities and functioning of B C Roy Technology Hospital among its students. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur requested the students to respond to a google form where they could let us know about the problems the student community is facing in view of an allegedly incompetent hospital that is meant to serve a population of around 20,000 people. The form was received by the KGP community with utmost sincerity and close to 900 responses were recorded of which some contained valuable suggestions too. This report is a compilation of the problems that the hospital is facing and possible solutions considering the practical situation of the institute.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/bc_roy.php

Academic passion and hard work when coupled lead to astonishing results. Who better to personify these words than Dr. Sanghamitra Bandyopadhyay, an internationally recognized researcher in Computer science, specializing in computational biology and currently the director of the Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata. She completed her M. Tech in Computer science from IIT Kharagpur in 1993 with Dr. Shankar Dayal Sharma Gold medal and Institute Silver medal.

Dr. Sanghamitra has worked in various Universities and Institutes worldwide including USA, Australia, Germany, China. She has authored/co-authored more than 300 research articles in international journals, conferences, and book chapters, and published six authored and edited books. She was awarded the prestigious Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize in Engineering Science in 2010, Infosys Prize 2017 and Third World Academy of Science Prize, 2018.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a lucky chance as she took out time from her incredibly hectic schedule to interact with us. In this edition of our series "JEWELS OF KGP", we present to you a tale of extreme dedication through an insight into the life of this widely respected researcher and administrator.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/sanghamitra.php

General Championship Summary

General Championship Sports and Games 2017-2018

Azad sealed this year’s General Championship Sports and Games converting last year’s silver to gold this year. Apart from lawn tennis, the finals for all the other sports and games have been concluded. Currently, MMM stands at the second position. If MS manages to win GC Lawn tennis then it would be the bearer of the second position provided MMM is not able to win third place play-off for lawn tennis.

The current standings are:
1. Azad (61 points)
2. MMM (38 points)
3. Nehru (33 points)

General Championship Technology 2017-2018

Continuing its legacy, Azad continues to be at the first position currently. Two events are yet to be conducted, namely OpenSoft and Hardware Modelling. The results of Maths Olympiad are yet to be declared whereas there is an ambiguity in the results of ChemQuest which would soon be resolved in the coming sub-committee meeting.

The current standings without considering the current result of ChemQuest are:
1. Azad (265 points)
2. RP (225 points)
3. LBS (175 points)

General Championship Social and Cultural 2017-2018

Out of 22 events, 7 events are yet to be conducted. RK manages to hold the first position leading Patel by 70 points. There is a massive difference between the first position and the third position of over 200 points. 

The current standings are:
 1. RK (525 points)
 2. Patel (455 points)
 3. Azad (315 points)

For further details, check 
http://awaaziitkgp.org/GC201718.php?page=gc

Gymkhana Elections are less than a week away and the KGP community is keeping social media abuzz with related content. The voters and their mindset play a major role in shaping up of the future of the institute, and the right mindset will be achieved if and only if everybody has the basic knowledge of the issues pertaining to the campus and the electoral process. 

Common people don't get to share their viewpoints with the authority on those issues and this survey aims to reduce the gap and let the voices be heard. The survey form constitutes of two parts, one about the electoral process, and another about the issues ranging from mess and placements to hospital and counseling centre. Your problems can only be solved if you state them. So, give a minute or two to fill this form out, state your queries and suggestions and give yourself an opportunity to be a prominent part of the institute.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the student community to fill up the form before Tuesday [03/04/2018] midnight so that the survey report may be published early enough.
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfzzBQe-8IcD4ZmHzRFpZ1Qs3r0PpLLX8jc8FpEKrUdSsEZlg/viewform

“Bring a life back to power. Make blood donation your responsibility”, with similar message Blood donation camp was organized by Kharagpur Voluntary  Blood Donors Forum and NSS, IIT Kharagpur on 31 st March 2018 from 10 am to 2 pm in Old Badminton Court, Technology Students' Gymkhana under the guidance of Prof. Arghya Deb with around 84 enthusiastic volunteers turning up for the camp. Volunteers were also awarded certificates for this noble work for giving someone a new life as one can't do much about the length of his own life, but by donating blood one surely can do something with its' width and depth. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur expresses its' gratitude for all those who donated blood and appeals the student community to increase their involvement in these kinds of activities.

Volunteers were also awarded certificates for this noble work for giving someone a new life as one can't do much about the length of his own life, but by donating blood one surely can do something with its' width and depth. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur expresses its' gratitude for all those who donated blood and appeals the student community to increase their involvement in these kinds of activities.

message:
In the recent case of a student being intimidated and his form getting torn, Awaaz got to know another side of the story. Here's the other side of the issue as expressed by concerned stakeholders. This is what they have to say (this is strictly their side of the story and not Awaaz's):
"This recent issue has already gained a lot of momentum, though in a bad way, however, we would like to make a few things clear. The student, who claimed to have been mishandled on our part, left out a great deal of information regarding the whole incident.
First of all, we encourage any student who wants to contest for elections to come forward through proper channels, or at least contest with the right intentions.
Entrusted with the job role of working for the hall members and the betterment of college, it is our responsibility and duty to encourage students to contest for the posts. We approached the student to understand his level of clarity regarding the post he was applying for and his intentions. On understanding that the whole affair was because of a bet between the said student and his friend from another hall of residence, we found out that they were playing around with the election process, simply competing among themselves just to see who gets more votes. This is the kind of behaviour that shames the student community and gives KGP elections a bad name.
Hence, we advised the student against filing a nomination as this degrades the seriousness and undermines the respect this post commands. After this, we again approached the student and encouraged the student to formally contest, with our support, provided his intentions were clear and just. However, the student backed out and said the whole affair was just a joke, or a prank, on his part and he never had any serious intentions of contesting. 
If the student has any proof of any of what he claims to have happened, we encourage him to come forward and present it to the student community.
It was an immature act of fiddling up with the elections and we highly condemn this kind of act which disrespects the posts of VP,  TSG."

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur contacted the other concerned stakeholder who affirmed that another student who had also taken candidature form, accepted the fact that they both were doing it just for fun and they were not serious about it at all.

We, at Awaaz, have just tried to present the viewpoints of both the sides and do not claim any particular viewpoint of these two to be true. We do not intend to shove any particular viewpoint as absolute truth down the throats of students community.

Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, Associate Professor, Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering has been awarded Abdul Kalam Technology Innovation National Fellowship by the Indian National Academy of Engineering. He joined the institute in 2005. His research areas include Medical Image and Signal Processing, Content-based Medical Image Retrieval, Continuous Authentication, Video Processing.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes our professor all the best in his future endeavours!

Our Alumni keep showering their love time to time for their alma mater. This time it is the IIT Kharagpur Foundation (IITKGPF) in the United States who has offered to fund the foreign internships of students who wish to pursue high-quality research and professional internships at reputed global universities such as the University of Cambridge, University of Columbia, MIT and University of Chicago among others. The IITKGPF is a not for profit organization headquartered in Nebraska. 14 students from various disciplines have been selected as part of the IITKGPF's 'Award Program for International Internships' which was launched in March. The reputation of the host institution, the quality of proposed research and the academic standing of the student are taken into account before giving the final awards. The students will receive monetary grants upto USD 3000 through direct payments for eligible expenses like airfare, stay and so on. The move will encourage the students who miss out on the opportunities due to huge travel expenses and cost of living.

Source- http://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/in-a-first-iit-kharagpur-alumni-foundation-to-fund-overseas-internships-118032900549_1.html

The first phase Pre-Conclave of the 2nd Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) Youth Conclave was hosted by IIT Kharagpur from 23rd March to 25th March 2018. The Opening Ceremony was inaugurated by Prof. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti (Director), Prof. Sriman Kumar Bhattacharyya (Deputy Director), Prof. Manoj Kumar Tiwari (Dean of Planning and Coordination) and Prof. Jayanta Mukhopadhyay. INAE Youth Conclave aims at facilitating the engagement of Indian youth in engineering activities at national level. 

This time competition was divided into three categories and then further subdivided into a total of six events as follow: 
(1) Academic Planning
(2) Product Design and Development
          (i) Town Planning
          (ii) Optimising Food Chain Aspects
          (iii) Swach Bharath Abhiyan
(3) Mobile Application Development
          (i) Health Care App Development
          (ii) Digitalisation in Agriculture 

The results of the Pre-Conclave are as follow:
(1) Academic Planning
          1st Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 166)
          2nd Prize: MMM Engineering College, Gorakhpur (Team 244)
          3rd Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 252)

(2) Town Planning
          1st Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 129)
          2nd Prize: PSG Institue of Technology and Applied Research (Team 75)
          3rd Prize: Techno India, Salt Lake (Team 25)

(3) Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
          1st Prize: Raj Kumar Goel Institute of Technology & Management (Team 81)
          2nd Prize: IES IPS Academy, Indore, M.P. (Team 82)
          3rd Prize: VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology, Hyderabad (Team 56)

(4) Optimizing food chain aspects
          1st Prize: School of Aeronautics, Neemrana (Team 97)
          2nd Prize: Ambedkar Institute Of Technology For Handicapped, Kanpur (Team 136)
          3rd Prize: Chandigarh University, Gharuan, Mohal (Team 140)

(5) Healthcare app Development
          1st Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 139)
          2nd Prize: Chettinad College of Engineering & Technology (Team 100)
          3rd Prize: Chandigarh University (Team 165)

(6) Digitalization of Agriculture
          1st Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 123)
          2nd Prize: Bhagalpur College of Engineering, Bhagalpur (Team 201)
          3rd Prize: Chandigarh University (Team 155)

In the second phase of INAE Youth Conclave, the shortlisted teams will be developing the existing solutions and solving new problems related to their problem statement. The final presentation will be on 10-12 August 2018. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the shortlisted teams and wishes all the best for the final conclave.

A condolence meeting will be organized at 6 pm on 31st March in the common room of Nehru Hall of Residence due to the sad demise of Nanda Kishore. He was a fifth-year undergraduate student in the department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering. He was suffering from Intestinal tuberculosis which was detected very late. Though the surgery was successful, he had multiple organ failures and passed away on the night of 28th March. Dean SA and Dean UG are expected to be present for the same. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the student community to attend the condolence meet and pray for the peace of his soul.

Semifinals || Lawn Tennis || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

Semifinal 1: MS vs MMM 
1. Singles: Prathamesh Chavan (MS) beats Sauramya Pandey (MMM) by 7-6, 2-6, 6-4.
2. Doubles: Prathamesh Chavan and Parush Patel (MS)beat Sauramya Pandey and Anshuman Kumar (MMM) by 6-2, 6-2.
MS defeated MMM by 2-0.

Semifinal 2: AZ vs LBS 
1. Singles: Arpan Pallar (AZ) beats Mandar Auti (LBS) by 6-1, 6-1.
2. Doubles: Kunaal Punj and Nishant Kumar (AZ) beat Krishna Chaithra and Akhil (LBS) by 6-4, 6-1.
AZ defeated LBS by 2-0.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them all the best for finals.

Finals || Chess || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

3rd place play-off: LLR vs PH (2-1)

Board 1- Sandeep (LLR) won against Vedant Dixit (PH)
Board 2- Gigyasu Jain (PH) won against Aman Besara (LLR)
Board 3- Aman Anand  (LLR) won against Kunal Aggarwal(PH)

LLR won the match by 2-1 securing the bronze.

Finals: HJB vs MS (2-1) (Blitz)

Board 1- Prithwi Sinha (HJB) won against Saurabh Desai (MS)
Board 2-  Ramamurthi (MS) won against Akhil Andasu (HJB)
Board 3- Vivek Gupta (HJB) won against Aravindh Swaminathan (MS)

HJB won the match by 2-1 winning the gold.

The final hall standings are as follows:

Gold- HJB
Silver- MS
Bronze- LLR
4th Position- PH

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and the participants!

Mahadevi Varma, widely regarded as the ‘Modern Meera’, was a Hindi poet, freedom fighter, woman's rights activist and educationist. Considered to be one of the four pillars of ‘Chhayavaad, which was a literary movement of romanticism in modern Hindi poetry, she has been awarded various honours including Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan, Sahitya Akademi Fellowship and Jnanpith Award. Her works reside in the hearts of thousands of lovers of Hindi literature. Many of us must be remembering ‘Gillu’, ‘Neelkanth’ and ‘Mere Bachpan Ke Din’, some of her great works included in textbooks.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur remembers Mahadevi Varma on her 111th birth anniversary and salutes her contribution to Hindi Literature.

Technology Intervention in Indian Agriculture can make a BIG difference in lives of millions of people. AgNEXT is an initiative of the Prof. Mrigank Sharad, an assistant professor at the department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering, IIT Kharagpur. It offers a platform to ideate, innovate, prototype and commercialize impactful technology solutions and services. AgNEXT is working on several different verticals that are coordinated by dedicated experts. It has a team of senior KGP students leading different target products and currently it is looking forward to inviting new enthusiasts. With AgNEXT you get to participate and lead development of products and solutions that are based on real needs of Indian agriculture and can have significant impact on the rural economy. It is looking forward to a long term association with KGPians who are passionate about using their talents and skills for socially relevant and impactful technology solutions for rural India! Rewards, fellowships and recognition will follow passionate effort and coordinated outcomes!

Please fill out the following form if you are interested:

https://goo.gl/forms/4aLxDfGRhf7zfeXN2

The Leadership Summit 2018 organised by the Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur  saw four of IIT Kgp's Alumni coming on stage to tell the students about their experiences of leading teams in various spheres whether it is being the CEO of a big multi-national company, an administrative lead post in the government or leading a successful startup team. The meet featured Mr. Modan Saha who is the CEO of Tata Strategic Management Group, Mr. Sandipan Deb who is Editor-Director at Swarajya, Mr. Sachchidanand Rai, the Chairman of Eden Realty Group and Mr. Shrey Goyal, the founder of Sustainable Growth Initiative. They laid down the importance of benevolence and honesty while simultaneously being sharp and smart in your approach to climb the steps in the corporate world. Citing their experiences, they told how you have to respect and admire your teammates in order to gain back their respect for you as a leader. Each of us can become a leader if we believe in ourselves and make full use of the opportunities coming our way. They also emphasised the fact that how IITians have been serving for the betterment of humanity and how they have made a special place for themselves in the world. It was inspiring to hear from them what it means to be a true leader.

message:
General Championship 2017-2018 | Technology

Technology general championship consists of 10 events out of which only 3 events have been concluded so far. 

Ad-Design: A total of 13 teams participated in the Inter-Hall Ad-Design competition. The problem statement was "Disconnect from technology and Reconnect with each other". Teams were required to design an advertising campaign for a mobile application that makes the smartphone go totally blank for a pre-defined period of time so that people can take some time off their phones and connect with people in real life. 
Gold - RP Hall
Silver- Nehru Hall
Bronze - RK Hall

Data Analytics: A total of 10 teams participated in Inter-Hall Data Analytics Competition. The problem statement was related to the performance of mutual funds. 
Gold - Azad
Silver - RP
Bronze - SN / IG

Product Design: A total of 9 teams participated in Inter-Hall Product Design Competition. 
Gold - LBS
Silver - Patel
Bronze - Azad

Final Standings: 
RP - 120 points
Azad - 115 points
LBS - 100 points
Patel - 60 points
Nehru - 45 points
RK and SN/IG - 30 points
Disclaimer: Final standings may change after the subcommittee meeting.

Celebrates the spirit of student innovation in all the fields of engineering, science, technology, and design through extremely affordable/frugal solution, Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards were given to those who had the courage to push the technological edge. Dealing with numerous aspects like communities at grassroots, co-creation with grassroots innovators, manufacturable technologies for saving or generating energy, sanitation, water purification, saving material consumption, biotechnology and medical devices, diagnostics, assistive devices for physically challenged, and all others areas of social and industrial applications, overall 23 awards were given to students of various Indian institutes. Bikash Ranjan Tiwari and Md. Tabish Noori from IIT Kgp while working under the guidance of Prof. Makarand Madhao Ghangrekar received this award 
 Award summary is as follows :
• IIT Madras – 3
• IIT  Bombay - 3
• IIT  Delhi - 3
• IIT  Kharagpur - 2
• IIT  Hyderabad - 2
• Institute of Chemical Technology Mumbai-2
• IIT  Kanpur - 1
• IIT Roorkee - 1
• IISC  Bangalore - 1
• IIT  Guwahati -1
• Tezpur University, Assam -1
• National Dairy Research Institute, Bangalore -1
• Dr D.Y. Patil Vidyapeeth Pune - 1
• Don Bosco High School Assam - 1
 

For further information one can follow the given link :
http://gyti.techpedia.in/award-list-2018.php

Founded by Deepak Malhotra and Rajan Bajaj, SlicePay is a digital payment platform which was founded with a mission to simplify payments for the young. Rajan Bajaj is an IIT Kharagpur alumni who graduated from the institute in 2014 with a degree in Civil Engineering. Rajan Bajaj, Co-Founder and CEO of SlicePay says, “Students’ spending power has significantly increased over the last few years as Indian parents now spend more on education, leading to a strong need for a frictionless lending solution for millennials”. We got an opportunity to interact with him.

http://awaaziitkgp.org/kye_slicepay.php

"Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.”
The annual art exhibition is being organized by Spectra, IIT Kharagpur from 24th to 26th March during 10AM-10PM at Assembly Hall, Technology Student's Gymkhana.  Awaaz IIT Kharagpur urges the student community to grab this opportunity of appreciating the true art as when an artist gives form to revelation, his art can advance, deepen and potentially transform the consciousness of the 
 entire community.

Quarterfinals || Lawn Tennis || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

Quarterfinal 3: LBS vs VS (2-0)
1. Singles: Krishna Chaithra (LBS) beat Naveen (VS) by 6-0, 6-0.
2. Doubles: Krishna Chaithra and Akhil (LBS) beat Ayush Shukla and Nikhil Maan (VS) by 6-2, 6-1.

Quarterfinal 4: MS vs RK (2-1)
1. Singles: Kunal Pattanayak (RK) beat Duttrateya Das (MS) by 6-4, 6-2.
2. Doubles: Prathamesh Chavan and Parush Patel (MS) beat Kunal Pattanyak and Shailesh Mishra (RK) by 6-1, 3-6, 10-3.
3. In the last match, Prathamesh Chavan (MS) defeated Pankaj (RK) by 6-0.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them all the best for semifinals.

2. Prathamesh Chavan and Parush Patel (MS) beat Kunal Pattanyak and Shailesh Mishra (RK) by 6-1, 3-6, 10-3 in doubles encounter.
3. In the last match, Prathamesh Chawan from MS defeated Pankaj from RK by 6-0.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them all the best for semifinals.

The match ended with 1-1 after full-time. However, Nehru won the Penalty Shootout. 
Result: Nehru won the match and bagged the Gold Medal whereas Patel achieved the Silver Medal.

Third Place Decider Match: RK vs RP
Result: RK won the match by 2-1 and bagged the bronze medal.

The final standings are as follows:
First Position: Nehru
Second Position: Patel
Third Position: RK
Fourth Position RP

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the teams.

message:
"है नमन उनको कि जो यशकाय को अमरत्व देकर,
इस जगत के शौर्य की जीवित कहानी हो गये हैं | 
है नमन उनको कि जिनके सामने बौना हिमालय, 
जो धरा पर गिर पड़े पर आसमानी हो गये हैं |"

Yesterday, on the account of Shaheedi Diwas, a rally was organized by Samvaad in association with Technology Students' Gymkhana, followed by a Kavi Sammelan by Technology literary Society. The rally, which started at Gymkhana and concluded at the Nehru Museum, was full of enthusiastic sloganeers who enchanted patriotic slogans like 'Vande Mataram', 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'. At Nehru Museum, proceedings started with the National Song, followed by words of Bhagat Singh which reads as, " They may kill me, but they cannot kill my ideas. They can crush my body, but they will not be able to crush my spirit ". Further, the anchor narrated the history of Hijli detention camp and two freedom fighters who were hanged there (Hijli detention camp)- Santosh Kumar Mitra and Tarkeshwar Sengupta. Thereafter, the president of the event, Prof Virendra Kumar Tewari (Agriculture & Food Engineering Department) spoke about the comparison between the mentality of those youth freedom fighters with nowadays youth about freedom. Then he welcomed Chief Guest of the event, Commander Veerendra Kumar Jaitely, an IIT Kgp alumnus.

Commander Jaitely saluted the brave freedom fighters and then told about one shaheed of IIT Kharagpur, V.K.Jain (INS Khukri) from Electronics Department, 1966 Batch. He gave an idea about the fight for freedom and inspired us to fight for our country for taking it to the top. Thereafter, Kavi Sammelan began which witnessed many extremely talented students recite their verse. The event concluded with the National Anthem.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages student community to conduct more such events and actively participate in it!
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 14 new photos — with Venkappayya Desai and 3 others.

The YES!+ Society at IIT Kharagpur is conducting life skills workshops for the youth - YES!+ (Youth Empowerment & Skills Workshop) by the Art of Living from 23rd to 25th March. YES!+ is a soft skill & personal development workshop designed specifically for college students. 

Timing: 18:00- 21:00 (weekdays) 9:00 -13:00(weekends) , 23rd to 25th March, 2018
Donation: Rs. 800/-
Venue: Technology Students' Gymkhana

For registration and more information, interested ones can fill up the google form- https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1yGEMacXFPeigwjo9_xaiFo6PIqBVn4jCTz5fx02yTgI/viewform?c=0&w=1&edit_requested=true.
