In an attempt to build indigenous technologies for commercial usage our institute is working on developing an ecosystem of budding technical entrepreneurs. One such projects on 'Rain and Fog removal from Video Sequences' has been taken up by Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay and his team. Patents have been filed in US, Europe and South Korea. Basic application has been shown to work and is being approached by the world top leaders in Defense and Transportation. Another projects in progress are 'Development of Biometric Authentication systems'. To scale up the work and improve the commercial viability of the product, interns are being hired to work in the following related fields. Interested and enthusiastic students are invited to fill in the google form below. They will be invited to the recruitment drive soon.

Interns required in the following domains : Product Development, Android Programming, CUDA C, Image Processing, Machine Learning

Eligibility : Anyone interested is invited
Time Period : Summers 2018 and beyond
Stipend : Will be provided on the basis of alloted work

For any queries contact: Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, Department of E&ECE, IIT Kharagpur

Application form link : https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScApGKNNnKv9BNjIuORKCb2svMeP_5FUiyBGxOOWqjCMFKjjg/viewform?usp=sf_link

One of our editors had a discussion with the officers of Academic Section (UG) and Accounts Section regarding the Inspire Awards as the awardees have not been credited with the scholarship amount.

Quarterfinals || Lawn Tennis || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

Quarterfinal 1: MMM vs HJB (2-0)
1.In singles, Suramya Pandey (MMM) beat Akhil Andasu (HJB) by 7-5, 3-6, 6-3 in a hard-fought contest.
2. Suramya Pandey and Anshuman Kumar (MMM) defeated Sanket Mondal and Manish Dutta (HJB) by 6-2, 6-3 in doubles encounter.

Quarterfinal 2: Azad vs RP (2-1)
1. Kunaal Punj(Azad) handed an easy defeat to Rajat Gupta (RP) by 6-3, 6-0 in the first singles match.
2. The duo of Kunaal Punj and Nishant Kumar (Azad) lost to Mihir Kirloskar and Rajat Gupta of RP in doubles encounter by 5-7, 4-6 in a close contest, thus leading to a decider singles match.
3. In the last match, Nishant Kumar from Azad defeated Mihir Kirloskar from RP by 6-4, 6-3 helping Azad qualify for the semifinals.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them all the best for semifinals.

What after graduation? It’s quite confusing for any student with numerous possibilities in corporate jobs and higher education. Provided both of them possess opportunities of their own kind with them, it’s immensely helpful to start thinking at an early stage. International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is organising a Panel Discussion with the graduating students who have secured MS/PhD offers from various renowned foreign universities. Besides, the panel will be guiding the students through the application procedures for MS/PhD in various universities. Be there to get your doubts cleared regarding higher education!

Semi-finals || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Hockey

NH vs RP (3-0): Nehru defeated RP by 3-0 as their tough defence did not let RP open their account. With this, Nehru qualified for the finals.

PH vs RK (2-0): PH booked the final berth by handing over a 2-0 defeat to RK.

With this, we have got our two finalists of the Inter-hall Hockey Competition. With NH vs PH in the finals, it is expected to be a tough game and both teams are expected to give their best. 3rd place play-off will be played between RP and RK.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them all the best for their upcoming match!

Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur, Metakgp, Lean In, IIT Kharagpur and Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS are organising the first KGP Developers' Meet on 18th March 2018, 5 pm in S.N. Bose Auditorium, Main Building. The purpose of the event is to bring all the developing enthusiasts together to discuss on projects for the betterment of the KGP community. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages the interested students to attend the event.

message:
Recently, Awaaz had conducted a survey to gauge the needs of the campus in terms of basic amenities. Here're the results of the survey that goes on to show that there's a need for some basic amenities (shops etc.) at some public places in the campus that we don't have right now. And if they will be there, it would cater to the needs of all the KGPians. Give this report a read! 
All your reasonable suggestions have been forwarded to the administration and we believe that they would be acted upon soon.
Link: http://awaaziitkgp.org/basic_amenities.php

Finals || Football || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

BRH vs JCB: 1- 0 

The breathtaking finals witnessed a tight play from both the teams throughout the match. Each of the teams left no stone unturned to score a goal against each other but the game came to the end with a single goal from Dampuia Fanchun (BRH) that led BRH to conquer the Gold and JCB had to content with the Silver. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for their excellent performance!

Players who outshone in different categories are as follows: 

Man of the Tournament: Dampuia Fanchun (BRH)
Man of the Match: Ritabrata (BRH)
Leading Goal Scorer: Chetan Rana (LBS)
Best Defender: Vasant Kumar (LBS)

Following are the final standings of the Football:

Gold: BRH
Silver: JCB
Bronze: LBS

Congratulations to all the players who made this event worthwhile with their active and lively participation!

3rd Place Playoff || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Football

LBS vs Azad

LBS took home bronze by comfortably defeating Azad with the score reading 4-0. The first half saw quick goals with Ijas (10th minute), Kunwar (18th minute) and Chetan (42nd minute) finding the net. Chetan scored a brace as he netted for the second time in the 53rd minute.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team.

3rd Place Playoff || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Football

LBS vs Azad

LBS took home bronze by comfortably defeating Azad with the score reading 4-0. The first half saw quick goals with Ijas (10th minute), Kunwar (18th minute) and Chetan (42nd minute) finding the net. Chetan scored a brace as he netted for the second time in the 53rd minute.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team.

"This magical, marvellous food on our plate, this sustenance we absorb, has a story to tell. It has a journey. It leaves a footprint. It leaves a legacy. To eat with reckless abandon, without conscience, without knowledge; folks, this ain’t normal.” In series of celebrating the 'Gratitude Month' and to remind the student community to express their gratitude to those crucial people who consistently work to make their stay at Kgp elated and gleeful, another random act of kindness was being displayed by IWG members under which they served food to mess workers along with other students in the LBS hall of residence. Entire IWG team appealed students to swell with gratitude and allow it to overwhelm and thank those workers who uninterruptedly work serving 4 meals a day, for 7 days a week. 

The idea being that benefit of expressing gratitude would surely go beyond a sense of self-worth, self-efficacy, and trust between the student community and those on whom student community is dependent as gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates the efforts made by entire  IWG team to create a copacetic atmosphere in the campus.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them all the best for the final match!

LBS vs JCB

Finals || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Volleyball
 
RK vs MMM1 (3-2): In the jam-packed Volleyball court, the final match was played between MMM1 and RK.  RK dominated the first set, winning it by 25-14. But MMM1 was in no mood to bow down and made a great comeback by winning consecutive sets by 25-18, 27-25 respectively. RK bounced back in the game and won the 4th set by 25-22, setting up the final for an exciting finish. Both the teams fought with full energy but it was RK who came on top, winning the decider set by 15-9 and finally the match by 25-14, 18-25, 25-27, 25-22, 15-9.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a brilliant show and the winning team for becoming the champions!

Most of us have had a teenage fantasy for machines, vehicles and technology, but hardly anyone fuels his fantasies in a way that Mr. Siddartha Khastgir, a KGP graduate who is now a globally recognized researcher, has done! 
In this article of our series “Jewels of KGP”, we are delighted to present before you this young talent who transformed his boyhood love for hot wheels and formula one racing into building autonomous cars! While he was an undergraduate student of Mechanical Engineering in KGP, Siddartha took a giant leap for his passion of cars as he procured a funding of 1 Million from Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC), IIT KGP and founded Team KART-Formula SAE Team of IIT Kharagpur in his third year of engineering.
He currently pursues research at the University of Warwick in autonomous vehicles. Recently, he has also been named in the prestigious Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018- Industry List for research contributions which have delivered impact to the automotive industry. 
Awaaz got a chance to interact with Siddartha and this conversation gives a glimpse into the professional and personal life of this realistic optimist who has never believed in giving up!
http://awaaziitkgp.org/siddartha.php

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur brings to you the digital format of the February newsletter which contains a detailed report on the problems pertaining to the B C Roy Technology Hospital, the survey report on the need for Basic Amenities at different places of the campus along with regular columns like Jewels of KGP, Humans of KGP. Don't miss out on the Panji Dude and Cartoon Kona, Bhaat and the editorial on Aadhar. 
Suggestions and feedbacks are always welcome that help us grow from strength to strength and address the grievances of the student community as an active media body.

LLR vs AZ
AZ won by 2-1
Aman Gupta (AZ) lost to Shashank Jaipuria (LLR) by 5-8.
Kunaal Punj and Nishant Kumar (AZ) beat Shashank Jaipuria and Shashi Kant (LLR) by 8-1.
Nishant Kumar (AZ) beat Shashi Kant (LLR) by 8-0.

RK vs BRH
RK won by 2-0
Kunal Pattanayak (RK) beat Naseeb Gill (BRH) by 7-1.
Kunal Pattanayak and Shailesh Mishra (RK) beat Naseeb Gill and partner (BRH) by 7-0.

Sauramya Pandeya (MMM) beat Shashank Jaipuria (LLR) by 8-0.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams!

message:
This Women's Day, let's talk about one of the recent initiatives taken by a group of girls who came together and founded the IIT Kharagpur chapter of Lean In i.e., Lean In, IIT Kharagpur! They are a group of peers who meet weekly to share personal experiences, discuss weekly goals and provide professional support in a place of confidentiality and trust. They talk openly about their ambitions and encourage each other to take on new challenges. At a place like IIT Kharagpur, the skewed gender ratio results in a number of biases. By bringing a discussion about these biases, they want to help people, both men and women to fight against them. 
Lean In Foundation is a nonprofit organization founded by Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg in 2013 following the success of her book titled Lean In. The foundation is dedicated to offering women the ongoing inspiration and support to help them achieve their goals. Inspired by the success of other circles around the globe, they started a Lean In circle at IIT Kharagpur.
Give this a read: http://awaaziitkgp.org/leanin.php

'Woman' is the culmination of all human abstracts. Her innocence can be felt in the form of a daughter, her care as a sister, warmth in form of a friend, passion in form of a beloved, her dedication as a wife, her divinity in form of a mother, her blessings in form of a grandmother. She is a complete circle who has the power to create, nurture and transform.
The entire Awaaz family wishes all a very Happy International Women’s Day!

message:
Yet another proud moment for KGPians! Shri Vinay Kumar (IFS: 1992), an IIT KGP alumnus, has been appointed as India’s new ambassador to the Islamic Republic Of  Afghanistan. He is currently serving as Joint Secretary at the Ministry Of External Affairs in New Delhi and is expected to take up his assignment shortly. As said by the ministry, he has held various positions, including an assignment in India’s permanent mission to the United Nations. 

On the behalf of entire KGP community, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes him all the best for his tenure!

Source- http://mea.gov.in/press-releases.htm?dtl/29528/Shri+Vinay+Kumar+appointed+as+the+next+Ambassador+of+India+to+the+Islamic+Republic+Of+Afghanistan

https://www.pajhwok.com/en/2018/03/03/kumar-replaces-vohra-indian-ambassador-kabul

General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Volleyball

Match 1. MS vs HJB 
MS won by 25-7, 25-12 comfortably in straight sets.

Match 2.  NH vs JCB 
NH decimated the opponents 25-7, 25-7 in straight sets.

Match 3.  LBS vs LLR. 
LBS won by 25-10, 25-27, 25-14, with LLR looking to come into the contest in the second set but losing their momentum in the last one.

Match 4. MMM-2 vs PH
PH won by 25-17, 25-16.in straight sets.

Match 5. RP vs AZ
RP won by 25-13, 25-15 in straight sets.

Match 6. BRH vs VS.
BRH won by 25-17, 25-19 in straight sets.

message:
25,000 likes!
A journey that started way back in 2006 with a monthly newsletter has now evolved into a full-fledged media body working day and night to keep the campus aware and involved. 

It is the unswerving trust of the KGP community that infuses belief in us and powers us to present all the latest happenings, academic information and administrative updates. Your relentless support, at times in the form of positive criticism, helps us raise daily-life issues faced by the students which in turn plays a vital role in many in-campus reforms.   

Sticking to our ideals of unbiased, authentic and fearless journalism, Awaaz hopes to keep its tireless determination to serve intact and continue scaling new statistical and journalistic heights.

With the following lyrical rhythm reflecting all your love and faith, Awaaz thanks all of you for your continuous support.

राह को मंज़िल से लड़ना अच्छा लगता है।
कल तक जो किनारा नज़र आता था,
आज मील का पत्थर है।
कितनी ही कहानियों की कश्ती 
किस्सों का चप्पू थामें,
हमें इतनी आगे लें आईं हैं,
कि यादें अब सुनहरा साहिल सा प्रतीत होतीं हैं।
अब भी उतार चढ़ाव की लहरें गुफ्तुगू 
करती हैं हमसे,
लब खामोश रहने के लिए नहीं होते।
एक कलम क़ायनात तो नहीं 
हालात ज़रूर लिख सकती है,
लिखा हुआ तो बदलता नहीं,
पर हालात ज़रूर बदलते हैं।
लिख कर चीखो
या बोल कर,
पर खामोश रहना 
सबसे खतरनाक होता है।
सबसे ख़तरनाक होता है 
मुर्दा शांति से भर जाना
तड़प का न होना
सब कुछ सहन कर जाना।
आवाज़ तुम में हैं
आवाज़ मुझमें हैं,
बस लगाने की देरी है।

5th edition of Kharagpur Open Tennis was organised at IIT Kharagpur on 3rd and 4th March. The event saw participation from different corners of West Bengal competing for the top honours and results were as follow:
* Open Singles *
Winner:            Kunaal Punj
Runner-up:      Anurag V.V.
Semi-finalists:  Kunal Pattanayak
                        Prathamesh Chavan

* Open Doubles *
Winner:            Souramya Pandya & Anurag V.V.
Runner-up:      Kunaal Punj & Akhil Andasu 
Semi-finalists:  Prof. Rajendra Singh & Mr. Vivek Pandey
                        Kunal Pattanayak & Prathamesh Chavan

*Women's category*
Matches were not held due to lack of sufficient number of girl participants.

* Veteran Singles *
Winner:            Mr. Sudipta Datta
Runner-up:      Mr. Gailey
Semi-finalists:  Mr. S. Bakshi

* Veteran Doubles *
Winner:            Prof. Rajendra Singh & Dr. Prabhakaran
Runner-up:       Mr. Gailey & Mr. Gurung
Semi-finalists:  Mr. S. Bakshi & Mr. Kannan
                         Mr. Sudipta Dutta & Mr. Anjan Bhattacharya

Presentation ceremony saw the presence of dignitaries including Prof. S. K. Bhattacharya (Deputy Director), Prof. Bhrigu Nath Singh (Dean, HR), Dr. M. B. Dey (Special guest), Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG) and Prof. Rajendra Singh. Deputy Director sir emphasised on the sportsman spirit and importance of sports in our student life. Winning isn't everything. We need to move forward and keep trying. He thanked players for participating in this competition. Prof. B. N. Singh lauded the efforts of organising committee and participants. When people are on the field, they forget everything and only think about winning. he also congratulated the winners. President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, Prof. William Mohanty explained about the overhauling of infrastructure and said that there are more tennis courses coming up which will improve the scenario.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 41 new photos — with William Mohanty and 4 others.

message:
Inter Hall Gardening Competition was held on 4th March 2018 (Sunday) where all the participating Halls came up with unique ideas and themes. All the participating Halls showed great zeal and enthusiasm and with the help of staffs, they succeeded in conveying the various messages that were intended for all of us!

Results are as follow:
Gold - Azad Hall - Save girl child and women empowerment
Silver - MMM Hall - Monumental structures of IIT KGP and Konark temple wheel
Bronze - Nehru Hall - Devotional things including Maa Kali and Swastika sign
Consolation Prize - JCB Hall - Conserve water and save the earth

We are very much thankful to our esteemed judges who took some time out of their busy schedule to judge the competition. Jury panel consisted of Mrs. Kajal Bhattacharya, Mrs. Sagarika Dasgupta and Mrs. Preeti Padma Das. They played an important role by minutely observing each and every garden and came out with the unanimous decision.
However, some of the Halls didn't take part in this competition and it can be attributed to various reasons such as lack of funds, and lacklustre approach because of this event not being included in General Championship etc.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and would like to thank all the students and staff members who came up with brilliant ideas to be conveyed through flowers!

message:
In this era of entrepreneurship and startups, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur sees it as its responsibility to share some of the successful startup stories. Here we present to you the story of Mr. Praveen Wadalkar, Co-Founder and CEO of Techizer Tech Solution Pvt. Ltd. (www.techizerindia.com), a highly specialized Pharma Digital Marketing firm that focuses on leveraging technology to build strong pharmaceutical brands. We got a chance to interact with him during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit organised by the Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur last month. By passion, Mr. Wadalkar is a motivational speaker, Business storyteller, and corporate trainer. Aside from having delivered 2 TEDx talks he is also ranked among top 10 competitive public speakers in international speech contest 2017 at District 98 by Toastmasters International. 

He started his career in Cipla in 2001. As a marketing specialist, he was involved in brand building and strategy development. Progressively he went on to head the marketing function at Mylan Pharma. A US-based pharmaceutical organization. After 10 years of Specialized work in the pharmaceutical sector, he started his own IT firm Techizer which today employing around 75 employees and providing strategic IT solutions to more than 100 pharmaceutical companies in Asia.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur in association with the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) organized a bilateral cricket series that featured two 3-day matches between Bangladesh U-15 and Bengal U-15 cricket teams in the Tata Sports Complex during 19– 25 February 2018. 
The results were as follow:
MATCH: 1st three-day match between CAB U15 & BCB U-15
Date: 19-21 February 2018
Toss: CAB U15
Result: Match drawn

CAB U15 1st innings 240 all out in 57.1 overs (Taufiquddin Mandal 174; Azizul Hakim Rony 16.1-2-41-5 and Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 14-03-45-4)

BCB U15 1st Innings 401 all out in 108.5 overs (Aich Mollah 78, ASM Zulkar Nayeem 75,  Sazzad Hossain Miraj 58 runs; Jayesh KR Singh 11-1-34-2, Prince KR Singh 13.5-02-42-2)

CAB U15 2nd innings 266 for 7 in 91 overs (Abhishek Porel 61,  Mushtaq Ahmed Mondol 51, Taufiquddin Mandal 50; Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 28-11-60-4)  

MATCH: 2nd three-day match between CAB U15 & BCB U-15
Date: 23-25 February 2018
Toss: CAB U15
Result: Match Drawn

CAB U15 1st innings 191 all out in 76.1 overs (Mustaq Ahmed Mandal 32; Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 23.1-13-27-05, Aich Mollah 08-04-11-2)

BCB U15 1st Innings 226 all out in 100.3 overs (ASM Zulkar Nayeen 57; Siddhaeth Singh 26-07-46-3)

CAB U15 2nd innings 249/9 in 77 overs (Abihishek Porel 107*; Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 29-09-54-5)

The series also witnessed the presence of Mr. Avishek Dalmiya, Joint Secretary, Cricket Association of Bengal, Mr. Pranab Roy, Former Cricketer of Team India and Mr. Dipu Roy Chaudhury, Former Cricketer of Bangladesh.

Picture Credits: Prof. William Mohanty
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 19 new photos — with William Mohanty and Somesh Kumar.

CAB U15 1st innings 191 all out in 76.1 overs (Mustaq Ahmed Mandal 32; Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 23.1-13-27-05, Aich Mollah 08-04-11-2)

BCB U15 1st Innings 226 all out in 100.3 overs (ASM Zulkar Nayeen 57; Siddhaeth Singh 26-07-46-3)

CAB U15 2nd innings 249/9 in 77 overs (Abihishek Porel 107*; Mahfuzur Rahman Rabby 29-09-54-5)

The series also witnessed the presence of Mr. Avishek Dalmiya, Joint Secretary, Cricket Association of Bengal, Mr. Pranab Roy, Former Cricketer of Team India and Mr. Dipu Roy Chaudhury, Former Cricketer of Bangladesh.

IIT Kharagpur to boost Artificial Intelligence education supported by Capillary Technologies

Whether it is explicitly acknowledged or not, in this era of technology, AI has been an effective tool, bridging the gap between data scientists, lawyers, sociologists, and economists studying its implementation. After developing a deep expertise in the area of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Sciences and its applications in several critical domains over a long period of time, IIT KGP has again set a benchmark by setting up a first of its own kind Center of Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Research covering education, training, research, projects, incubation and entrepreneurship in AI and related domains to fulfill the need of AI technologies. The Center, which will be seed funded by Capillary Technologies Limited, for an amount Rs. 5.64 crore for setting up computing infrastructure, hardware simulation platforms, software and designing the coursework, would be started with teaching and learning and knowledge dissemination program.
The curriculum will include short-term credit courses and certificate program for internal and external students along with industrial training programs. For further information, one can visit the following link:

https://indiaeducationdiary.in/iit-kharagpur-boost-artificial-intelligence-education-supported-capillary-technologies/

One and half year ago, an RTI filed to the MHRD had revealed that the annual electric bill paid by IIT Kharagpur to the Ministry of Energy & Power Distribution, Govt. of West Bengal, has surged steeply from Rupees 16 crores 18 lakhs in 2011 to an almost double of 31 crores 46 lakhs in 2016. And this figure has been relentlessly increasing day by day. While most of this surge can be attributed to the increased infrastructure in this period, misuse and wastage of electricity also play a pivotal role in this colossal figure. Many time, we are seen to leave the lights and fans running while we go to the class; not because of our unwillingness but because of our carelessness.
And guess what? It's our irresponsibleness that's been adding to the expenditure and consumption figure day by day. For the last couple of months, our reporters have been observing the common habits that we KGPians have when it comes to using electrical appliances. What we've found is that there has been a huge insensitiveness towards the wastage of electricity. Many lights and fans remain on even when there is absolutely no need of that. While most of this has been observed in the Academic Complex and Halls of Residences, it has been seen in various Departments, street lights on roads etc. Even if we see it happening right in front of us, we either simply don't care or it seems too demanding for us to get that fixed. This completely reflects the fact that we, as a community, have failed to deliver on the responsibilities.
We should never forget that there are still more than 150 million people in our country who do not know how does it feel to spend nights with lights! All it needs is a small initiative from your side and all you have to do is to switch a button off or find the concerned person (in case of street lights) and get it switched off. We, from Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urge each one of us to use the electricity judiciously and encourage our friends towards the same. After all, each and every small contribution counts!

message: Hall Management Centre (HMC) has recently issued a notice urging the students to remove Air Conditioners (ACs) and other high power consuming appliances that have been installed without seeking any permission from the authorities by 7th of March. While it is illegal to install such appliances without necessary approvals, the electrical lines have not been designed for such heavy loads which in turn endangers the safety of the students.

It comes as no surprise that one of the KGP teams have won the national level analytics challenge conducted by EXL. The team of Sanskar Rawat and Shreshth Khare showcased their analytical skills to outperform all the other teams and grab the winner's trophy. EXL Excellence Quotient 2018 was an Analytics-cum-Business case challenge in which teams were asked to redesign the mall and optimize its layout earning more revenue to the owners. The competition was open to 20 premier academic institutes across the country including 8 IITs and 7 NITs. A total of 680 teams registered out of which 63 qualified through 1st Round and only 6 teams made it through the 2nd Round to the National Finals. The teams were invited to present the case at Gurgaon on 26th February 2018. Team INSIDIOUS from IIT Kharagpur secured the 1st position thereby bringing laurels to the institute and stamping their authority at national level.
Both team members find this field of business analytics very alluring. The winning team also pocketed a cash prize of Rs.1,00,000 along with certificates and a winning trophy.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!

message:
We are in an age where the struggle for a decent enough living overpowers the all-round abilities within us. In this edition of  “JEWELS OF KGP”, we have a person who has practiced and realized the meaning of all-round abilities in life. Presenting to you, Mr. Shailendra Kumar, one of the best all-rounders of 87' batch and the founder of Nalanda 2.0, a California based think-tank corporation that aims at improving the quality of higher education.

After completing his graduation in 1987, he applied his engineering skills in the automobile industry for two years. Thereafter, he pursued his MBA from Indiana University,  Bloomington. From 1991 to 2006 he was an executive in several Fortune 500 and Silicon Valley-based corporation such as Applied Materials,  FMC Corporation, and Lam Research, and he was co-founder and CEO of two startups. However, Shailendra Kumar realized his true potential when he spent around six years as an administrator for higher studies at UC Berkeley and San Diego. He spent over 16 months writing his book "Building  Golden India:  How to unleash India's vast potential and transform its higher education system". Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with him and here we present an insight into his motivational professional and personal life.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/shailendra_kumar.php

Ramya Veerubhotla, a Research Scholar from the Department of Biotechnology, has won the Platinum Award in the KPIT Sparkle 2018 for her innovation of a flexible and disposable battery that could generate power using the bacteria in sewage water. Among the twelve thousand students from across the country, she has been awarded the first prize for the novelty, affordability and the commercial viability of the proposed idea. 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Ramya Veerubhotla and her PhD supervisor Prof. Debabrata Das for such a grand success!

Follow the links below for further information:
https://www.news18.com/news/india/iit-kharagpur-student-develops-paper-battery-using-sewage-water-1673189.html; https://sparkle.kpit.com/audience/winners

In this era of entrepreneurship and startups, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur sees it as its responsibility to share some of the successful startup stories. Here we present to you the story of Mr. Arijit Ray, Co-Founder & Managing Partner at PAPERBOAT BRANDWORKS. We got a chance to interact with him during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit organized by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur. He is a 1992 batch graduate from Delhi University.
                          Arijit is a proven Marketing and Advertising Professional with 24 years of experience across various domains with leading multi-national agencies like Rediffusion Y&R, McCann Erickson, Dentsu, DDB Mudra, Saatchi & Saatchi. Arijit started his entrepreneurial journey at Paperboat Brand works recently after he moved on from Dentsu Communications. Where he led the agency over 2 years as CEO and oversaw its journey to acquire 14 new businesses, expand across geographies and become the fastest growing agency of the Dentsu Network globally. 
                        Paperboat Brandworks, a creative communications company striving to understand brands in the new era, to offer smart, effective and memorable creative solutions across the spectrum. With a collective experience, ARIJIT RAY along with his partners bring to the table a very potent fusion of strategic, creative & business capabilities that are relevant to solve and add values to the complex communication and marketing problems of brands in this new age. Paperboat effortlessly works on all kinds of media from print to outdoor to electronic to digital and offer end-to-end integrated creative solutions that are relevant to your brand and category.
                         Arijit was featured in Business Standard in 2010 in the Frontrunner section that tracks young achievers in Corporate India. In 2012. he was one of the few leaders to be profiled by Brand Equity, the advertising and marketing supplement of Economic Times.

The word 'rape' itself sounds so vicious and that too of an eight-month-old girl is barbaric and shameful. The incident happened in New Delhi on 28th January when the girl, whom we are referring to as Chhutki, became the victim of the most monstrous act that a 28-year-old cousin can do. She was raped and left abandoned in a pool of her own blood. The child's father is employed as a daily wage labourer, while her mother works as a domestic help in the houses nearby. 
Chhutki needs extensive medical support, and The Quint, in association with BitGiving, has launched a crowdfunding campaign for the infant that can support the poor family through the tough times.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the students, faculty, and staff of IIT Kharagpur to contribute their bit so that Chhutki may lead a life of dignity after she gets well. 
#HelpChhutki Win This Fight

To contribute to crowdfunding, Please visit: https://www.bitgiving.com/chhutki or https://www.thequint.com/news/india/8-month-old-raped-in-delhi-donate-to-help?utm_source=facebook&utm_medium=smugglr&utm_campaign=HelpChhutki&utm_term=facebook%20bot

As promised in the Union Budget 2018 in what can be considered to be a significant step in promoting research in premier institutions of the country, the application forms for the Prime Minister Research Fellowship will be available on the newly launched portal www.pmrf.in from 24th February 2018.

Selected Candidates will be offered admission to Ph.D. program in one of IITs/IISc with a fellowship of Rs.70,000/- per month for the first two years, Rs.75,000/- per month for the 3rd year, and Rs.80,000/- per month in the 4th and 5th years. Apart from this, a research grant of Rs.2.00 lakh per year will be provided to each of the Fellows for a period of 5 years to cover their academic contingency expenses and for foreign/national travel expenses. The fellowship scheme aims at attracting the talent pool of the country to promote research in IITs and IISc.

Final year or graduate students enrolled from 4-year or 5-year courses in Science and Technology streams from IISc/IITs/NITs/IISERs and centrally funded IIITs with CGPA above 8.0 are eligible for applying for the fellowship. For more information, please visit the portal www.pmrf.in

In a third-party audit of some top educational institutions of the country conducted by Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI), all campus kitchens except for those in IIM Ahmedabad and IIT Roorkee failed to pass the audit. While IIT Kharagpur wasn't on the radar of auditors, IISc, Bangalore; AIIMS (Delhi, Jodhpur); IISER, Kolkata; IIMs (Ahmedabad, Kozhikode); and IITs (Mumbai, Guwahati, Delhi, Chennai, Roorkee and Kanpur) were the ones where kitchens were thoroughly examined for parameters like cooking area's maintenance, use of safe utensils/equipment, maintenance and sanitation, personal hygiene etc.
Rodent droppings in kitchens, overflowing sinks, pest infestations, unnetted drains, and storing food/ raw materials on the floor, water stagnation around sink area, choked/non-functional bathrooms for the staff, using food storage areas as changing rooms by staff were some of the common issues that auditors found in the kitchens which performed poorly in the audit.

Source: https://www.newsbytesapp.com/timeline/India/16180/80914/inside-the-kitchens-of-india-s-top-educational-institutions?utm_source=timeline-desktop&utm_medium=share-whatsapp&utm_campaign=PageExtras

Match: AZ (Rana & Abhinav) vs LLR (Siddhanth & Akhilesh)

Azad didn’t let LLR have a single chance to bounce back and defeated the opponent by 3-0 in the first two matches out of three. Hence, Azad advances into the semi-finals.

This year IIT Kharagpur is organizing the 2nd Edition of the INAE Youth Conclave here at IIT Kharagpur!

The Conclave provides an opportunity to the students for showcasing their abilities in 6 exciting competitions across the domains of Academic Planning, Product Design & Development, and Mobile App Development.

Deadline for submission of abstracts is 1st March 2018. Shortlisted teams will be invited to the Pre-Conclave from 23rd-25th March 2018 at IIT Kharagpur for presentations, after which they can work on their idea for a 4-month period till the final round from 10th-12th August 2018.

Prize money worth Rs.13.5 lakhs to be won!

For further details, visit the website: http://inae2018.iitkgp.ac.in/

Finals || Table-Tennis || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Match: Azad vs LBS (3-0)

From the very beginning of the game, the heat was on whether it was on the field or off the field. The players on both the sides left no stone unturned to give the finals its full justice but with the first set won by Azad made a pressure on the opponent and following them, came another two sets in favour of Azad with a crushing defeat of 3-0 to the LBS. Hence, the final standings of the Inter-Hall Table-Tennis are as follows:

Gold: Azad
Silver: LBS
Bronze: LLR
 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners! Stay tuned for further updates.

Just a week ago, the UG Representative along with the Students' Welfare portfolio organized a sensitization program for all the freshers wherein there were valuable inputs from various deans, faculty and student representatives.
Before the freshers get into their very crucial second year, it's needed to get them acquainted with the facts which will help them in planning a proper career and successful stay at IIT KGP.
Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean SA), Prof. Sudhirkumar Barai (Dean, UGS), Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG), faculty members from the CDC, HMC and the program officers of EAA were present at the occasion and shared their valuable ideas with the students. Mr. Mayank Srivastava (Vice President, TSG) and Mr. Ksheera Sagar (UG Representative) also put in their efforts to conduct the program.
The Netaji Auditorium was jam-packed and students got benefitted by the valuable advice imparted by the dignitaries. While Prof. Somesh Kumar highlighted the importance of discipline in the KGP life and urged the students to come out and interact with their neighbouring students to know them better, Vice President, TSG has proposed to circulate a query form among students to take questions related to their academic problems. 
Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur, a newly formed body has also taken the initiative of a regular 'Random Acts of Kindness' on a daily basis which, for sure, would go a long way in harbouring harmony among the students.

Won’t you enjoy playing a counter-strike kind of game which has its landscape based on the KGP campus? We all would love to, Right?
Absolutely breathtaking and exhilarating experience! Yes, that’s what our reporters got when they experienced the high definition Virtual Reality simulation of Kharagpur campus and 'StarMan' driving the Roadster in space, developed by Virtual Reality Laboratory at the Industrial and Systems Engineering, IIT Kharagpur!
They were able to gaze through the enormous space including Earth, Moon, Mars, Sun and asteroids - all through the eyes of the Starman peeking through his window. Seeing planets rotating, passing by and the car just managing to avoid asteroids on its way - witnessing all these sitting in a chair in a small room but feeling as if you were actually an astronaut floating in the space! Getting the same thrilling experience while navigating the entire campus in virtual reality was a visual treat. They were even able to visit Tikka, drink coffee and throw the cup into the dustbin - all through motion sensors and trackers. 
Established and conceived in 2016 with the coordination of Partha P Chakrabarti (Director IIT Kharagpur), current Head of the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering Jhareswar Maiti and professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering Pabitra Mitra, this Virtual Reality laboratory got functional from May, 2016. It boasts of state-of-art world-class hardware and software facilities for 3D modelling, projection, navigation and tracking. 
While Prateek Srivastava has worked hard on the 'StarMan' project, other enthusiastic students are helping him out in the "Virtual KGP' project which is going to be completed very soon. And the credit goes to their mentors Anirban Santara and Manorama Jha as well. 
We often find out that most of us don't know about various research facilities available in the campus. This is an attempt to let the campus know about the exciting research opportunities that are available in this field of VR and simulation so that more enthusiastic students can join the team and carry forward the awesome work done by the current students.
There are many projects going on currently which include EOT crane accident modelling and simulation, Dumper accident modelling, Accident modelling for open reversible belt conveyor and Hospital fire safety modelling. 
We are thankful to the Safety Analytics and Virtual Reality Laboratory for inviting us and demonstrating some mind-blowing simulations!

"You should surely seek motivation from whatever good others are doing, but never go for comparison as everybody's life is unique and true inspiration lies within the self." These are the words of Mr. Gulzar Azad, Country Head of Connectivity, Google India as Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with him. He came to IIT Kharagpur as the chief guest for the opening ceremony of the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018. 

He drives Google's initiatives for Internet access and broadband in India. He joined Google India in 2006, with responsibility for launching a range of mobile products and partnerships including Search and Android in emerging markets.

In 2013, Gulzar began working on RailWire WiFi, a partnership initiative between Google and Indian Railways to bring high-speed public Internet access to millions of people visiting train stations across India.

RK Hall organized a farewell party for one the most beloved professors of our institute Prof. Navtej Singh this Saturday night. He joined our institute as a professor in the Department of Aerospace Engineering in 1984 and since then he has been one of the most enterprising and enthusiastic faculties on campus, winning numerous best faculty awards and is popular across all the years for his unique way of teaching and empathetic nature towards students.
Before being a professor, Prof Singh has completed his bachelors in Aerospace engineering in 1975, masters in 1977 and Ph.D. in 1982, all three from IIT Kharagpur and has spent 46 years of his life dedicated to this institution. During his stay as a student in KGP, he was a boarder of RK Hall of Residence and enthusiastically participated in extra-curricular activities and was highly active on the social front, too. As a professor, he served as the warden of RK Hall for 7 years. To know more about him, you can read the following article by Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur http://awaaziitkgp.org/navtej_singh.php from our 'Know Your Professor' Series.
In his honor, RK Hall will bestow a new award to one of its boarders this year onwards as "Shri Navtej Singh Trophy".
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes Professor Singh a blissful life after retirement.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos — with Rishabh Surana and 10 others.

message:
RK Hall organized a farewell party for one the most beloved professors of our institute Prof. Navtej Singh this Saturday night. He joined our institute as a professor in the Department of Aerospace Engineering in 1984 and since then he has been one of the most enterprising and enthusiastic faculties on campus, winning numerous best faculty awards and is popular across all the years for his unique way of teaching and empathetic nature towards students.
Before being a professor, Prof Singh has completed his bachelors in Aerospace engineering in 1975, masters in 1977 and Ph.D. in 1982, all three from IIT Kharagpur and has spent 46 years of his life dedicated to this institution. During his stay as a student in KGP, he was a boarder of RK Hall of Residence and enthusiastically participated in extra-curricular activities and was highly active on the social front, too. As a professor, he served as the warden of RK Hall for 7 years. To know more about him, you can read the following article by Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur http://awaaziitkgp.org/navtej_singh.php from our 'Know Your Professor' Series.
In his honor, RK Hall will bestow a new award to one of its boarders this year onwards as "Shri Navtej Singh Trophy".
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes Professor Singh a blissful life after retirement.

3rd place Play-off || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

3rd place Play-off: RP vs NH (Nehru won by 12 runs)

The scores were as follow: 
Nehru: 132/8 (20)
RP: 120/10 (19.2)

Batting first, Nehru kept losing wickets at regular intervals. But Arpit, with a contribution of 65 runs from 53 balls, held one end firmly and made sure that they reach a respectable total. Nehru managed 132 runs from their quota of 20 overs. Now it was RP's turn to chase but a poor start surely didn't help their cause. They tried to consolidate their position with a good 3rd wicket-partnership. But, then again losing wickets after regular intervals meant victory slipping away from their hand! Ultimately, they fell short by 12 runs resulting in Nehru's win.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the team for putting up a good fight and the winning team for securing the 3rd place!

Finals || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Final: MMM2 vs AZ (MMM2 won by 1 run in super over)

The scores were as follow:
Azad- 96/7 (20 overs)
MMM2-96/8 (20 overs)

Super Over: MMM2- 9/1 Azad- 8/1 

The cricket final between two extremely dominant sides of the tournament proved to be an absolute thriller. On a mildly sunny day, both the sides played their heart out and dished out a spectacle of a match, to an extent that a super over was needed to decide the winner.

Batting first, Azad's batsmen were kept pretty much in check by the bowlers of MMM yet they managed to score at a steady pace and reached a total of 96 runs. Chasing 97, MMM's batsmen were expected to make through easily but a relentless show by the bowlers from Azad applied brakes on the MMM line up as only three runs were scored in the twelve balls of the 15th and 16th over. At the end of 16 overs, the match looked quite in the balance as MMM needed to score 34 runs off the final 24 balls with 7 wickets in hand. However, MMM smacked a few boundaries in a row to come back into the game. Needing 8 off the final over, there were successive run-outs leading to three runs needed off the final ball. The batsmen scrambled for a double and tied the match at 96 runs.

The match went into the Super Over where MMM batting first, had scored only 1 run off the first three balls with one man down, just then 8 runs came off the next three giving Azad a challenging 10 runs to chase. Azad needed 4 off the final delivery but managed only a double. This meant heartbreak for Azad as they fell short by the narrowest of margins and MMM won the high-intensity final!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for giving their best and the winning team for becoming the champions!

Finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games
Final: NH vs LBS (72-65)

In a jam-packed basketball court, LBS took on Nehru in what was anticipated to be an extremely competitive final. Rightly so, till the last minute game could have gone in anyone's favour! But it was Nehru who held their nerves and came out with flying colours securing a  marginal 7 point win over their opponent. Though Nehru maintained the lead throughout but LBS were never out of the game. At the half-time scoreline read 28-34 in favour of Nehru. LBS played their heart out and tried their best to cut down the lead but were always left behind by small margins. Ultimately, Nehru won the final by 72-65.

Individual awards were as follow:-
Best Fresher- Apar Sharma (LBS)
Highest Scorer- Anurag Dhankhar (Nehru)
Best Player of the Tournament- Akash Rathi (Nehru)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a great show and the winning team for their extraordinary performance!

message:
Semi-finals || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 2: MMM2 vs RP (MMM2 won by 6 wickets)
The scores are as follow:
RP: 106/10 (20)
MMM2: 109/4 (14.4)

The 2nd semifinal didn't bring about much thrill as the crowd would have expected. MMM2 won the toss and decided to field first. RP had a bad start losing 2 wickets in their very first over. They could not build any strong partnership throughout the match and could manage a total of 106 runs. MMM2 had a good start with runs coming at a brisk pace. They didn't face many hurdles in chasing down the total. MMM2 sealed their victory in 14.4 overs, advancing to the final against Azad.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them all the best for the finals!

Semi-finals || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 1: AZ vs NH. (Azad won by 17 runs)
The scores are as follow:
Azad- 105/6 (20)
Nehru- 88/10 (19.5) 

Azad batted first, riding on the back of 28 runs by Pratik and some steady contributions by the other batsmen, scored 105 runs in their quota of 20 overs. While the total looked modest, a rather slow start from Nehru's top order led to their downfall and the match quickly fell out of their grip thereafter. There was some resistance shown by Arpit who scored 34 before he was run out. Azad's bowlers, Ramsingh and Ankit, bagged three wickets each and were assisted by some terrific catches and runouts that led to a comfortable victory for their team. With this win, Azad advances to the finals!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them all the best for the finals!

There was some resistance shown by Arpit who scored 34 before he was run out. Azad's bowlers, Ramsingh and Ankit, bagged three wickets each and were assisted by some terrific catches and runouts that led to a comfortable victory for their team. With this win, Azad advances to the finals!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them all the best for the finals!

IIT KGP and AIIMS to come together! "IIT Kharagpur and AIIMS are planning some unique joint initiatives in academics and research that will open new directions in education and take technology-enabled healthcare directly to the people at large," said Prof P P Chakrabarti, Director, IIT Kharagpur. Senior professors of both the institutions are in discussion to take the initiatives forward.The collaboration will include strengthening of ongoing activities through collaborative education programmes, research and collaboration for management and analysis of hospital data. Prof Randeep Guleria, Director, AIIMS Delhi, said the medical domain is becoming progressively technology intensive, which puts the matter of IIT Kharagpur providing medical and allied education in perspective.

Source- http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kgp-aiims-to-come-together-for-unique-joint-initiatives-118020801568_1.html

Semi-Finals || Men’s Badminton || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

Semi-Final 2: Patel vs MMM-2 
Singles: Saket Thavanani of Patel defeated Ketan Bapat from MMM-2.
Patel Won: 21-12, 21-8 

Doubles: With constant efforts of Deepak & George, MMM-2 made a comeback in the well-fought game after losing the first set of the doubles against Saket & Rohit from Patel.
MMM-2 Won: 17-21, 21-17, 21-18 

2nd Singles: Vinay from MMM-2 won easily by defeating Rohit from Patel and thus paving the way towards finals for MMM-2. 
MMM-2 Won :21-4, 21-2 

With this, MMM-2 proceeded to the Badminton Finals. MMM-2 will be playing against LLR in the finals. Match for the third Place is to be played between BRH and Patel.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and the players all the best for the upcoming matches.

Semi-finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 2: NH vs AZ (64-57)

In midst of a full house basketball court, the second semifinal witnessed a neck to neck fight between Azad and Nehru. While the first quarter was equally fought and ended with Nehru leading 29-26, it was in the second quarter that Nehru asserted dominance by stretching the lead to 44-32. However, men from Azad were in no mood of bowing down and made a brave fightback in the last quarter reducing the lead to just 49-51, at one point of time. But Nehru held its nerves bringing out the best game under pressure and a flurry of baskets made the score 59-50 in their favour.

 Holding on to the lead, the match ended on 64-57 with Nehru making way to what is expected to be a thriller final with LBS. 

Also, Azad will be taking on Patel for the third-place playoff.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a brilliant show and wishes the winning team all the best for the finals!

Semi-finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 1: LBS vs PH (58-56)

Living up to everyone's expectations, the first semi-final proved to be an absolute thriller! With the balance of game swinging every moment, it was LBS who held their nerves and emerged victorious. Till third quarter, the scoreline read 39-44 in favour of Patel. But in the last quarter, LBS made a comeback leveling the score to 50-50 and then taking a lead with the scoreline reading 55-50. Ultimately, LBS won by a narrow 2 point margin with the scoreline reading 58-56 and entered the finals!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a stellar performance and wishes the winning team all the best for the finals!

General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games || Women's Badminton Final

GOKHALE Vs SNV
Singles :
Nivedita from Gokhale defeated Udita from SNV convincingly with the scoreline reading 21-9,21-16.
Doubles :
Gokhale won the doubles, too, in straight sets by 21-15,21-12 as Nivedita and Shristi overcame the tough fight from Udita and Gurmeet.

There was no need for further matches as Gokhale Hall bagged the Gold in Women's' Badminton while SNV, despite putting a valiant show all through the tournament, had to settle for the silver.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the medal winners.

In Frame: The Gold and Silver Winning Teams

Recently, ‘Interaction Rooms’ were introduced by Technology Students’ Gymkhana in almost all the  halls of residence. Interaction Rooms were introduced to provide the students a method to express their problems and issues to others. The concept mainly focussed on reducing the rates of depression in the campus and promoting student welfare. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur invites the general student community to present their opinions through the poll for this week: ‘Interaction Rooms’. The poll aims to spread awareness about the facility and understand the progress of these rooms. 
Please follow the given link and cast your vote: 
http://awaaziitkgp.org/poll.php?page=poll

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group,IIT Kharagpur's post. Dear UG First year students! Before you get into your very crucial second year, we would like to remind you about your responsibilities and make you realize some forgotten and harsh facts which will help you in planning a proper career and successful stay at IIT KGP. The UG Representative along with the Students' Welfare portfolio is organizing a compulsory sensitization program for all the freshers where in there will be valuable inputs from various deans, faculty and student representatives. Please be on time and follow the seating pattern as shared with you by your EAA officer over mail. See you all in Netaji at 6pm!

General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Basketball

Quarter-final 4: PH vs MS
PH- 50 pts, MS- 36 pts

The fourth and the last quarter-final saw Patel emerging victorious over MS with a winning margin of 14 points. With this, we got our fourth team entering into the semis.

With LBS, Nehru, Azad and Patel into the semi-finals, the upcoming matches are expected to be an absolute treat to watch. Patel will be up against LBS whereas Nehru will compete against Azad to qualify for the finals. Stay tuned to our page for further updates!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team!

BRH vs VSRC
 Men's Singles :
BRH won the match easily, the scoreline reading 21-1, 21-5.
Men's Doubles :
BRH won the match easily in straight sets by 21-13, 21-10.

Patel vs HJB:
Men's Singles: 
The player from Patel got injured in the second set when scores were 21-16, 12-7 in the favour of HJB. As a result, HJB was given a walkover.
Men's Doubles : 
Despite losing the first set, Patel made a strong comeback winning the match by 15-21, 21-12, 21-16.
2nd Men's Singles:
Patel registered a quite convincing victory in straight sets by 21-3, 21-9.

Men's Singles :

LBS-1 faced no tough competition and went on to win by 21-12, 21-11.

Men's Doubles :
MS won a hard-fought match by 24-22, 17-21, 21-16.

Nehru registered a convincing victory by 21-6, 21-12 over their opponents.

SN registered an easy victory over their opponents by 21-6, 21-8

General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Basketball

Quarter-final 2: NH vs RK
NH- 56 pts, RK - 41 pts

The second quarter-final witnessed a good contest between both the teams. Nehru was trailing by 18-24 till the end of second quarter. But, they made a strong comeback taking a one-point lead at the end of third quarter, the scoreline reading 33-32. After that, they didn't look back and went on to register a win by a margin of 15 points. With this win, Nehru advances to the semi-finals of Basketball!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team!

General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Cricket
4th Quarter Finals Match: RP vs BRH

RP: 135/7 (20 Overs)
BRH: 133 /9 (20 Overs)
RP won the match and entered into semi-finals to play against MMM-2. 
Earlier, BRH won the toss and chose to field first. RP scored a challenging enough 135 runs in the first innings.BRH players started very well and were in a complete mood of attack. But suddenly, 2 wickets fell in succession getting  RP back into the game. The match was balanced throughout further and both the teams were performing well against each other. The last over of the match brought no less thrill to the show. BRH was in need of 10 runs with 2 wickets in hand. 5 runs were scored within the first two balls putting RP under pressure. Third delivery went dot and two singles came in another two balls. Finally, BRH was to score 3 runs in the last ball of the match. The last shot in desperate attempt went all in but was caught at the boundary and with this, RP advanced to the semis.

Here are the two matches to be held in semi-finals:
RP vs MMM2
Azad vs Nehru

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team wishes all the best to the players who will be playing in the semi-finals.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Jacob Blessings and Kaushal Jakhete.

GOK vs SNV (Women's Single)
GOK defeated SNV comfortably by 21-4, 21-10.

GOK vs SNV (Women's Double) 
SNV defeated GOK in straight sets by 21-8, 21-14.

SNV defeated GOK in a one-sided match by 21-5, 21-2.

LLR defeated MMM-1 in straight sets comfortably by 21-6, 21-11.

LLR defeated MMM-1 easily in straight sets by 21-9, 21-6.

NH defeated HJB in straight sets, winning the game by 21-9, 21-18.

NH vs HJB (Men's Doubles)
The match witnessed a tough fight by both the teams but NH were able to steal a victory from HJB by 24-22, 18-21, 21-18.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams!

A recent notice of an office order banning the sales/consumption/distribution of any form of tobacco products in the institute (https://www.facebook.com/awaaziitkgp/photos/a.146211918732505.22874.146188872068143/1728416217178726/?type=3&theater) created a wave among the students of the campus. A few days have passed since then, but there does not seem to be a change in the conditions even now.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur invites articles from the general student body under the series of ‘Your Perspective’ for the topic ‘Relevance and Efficacy of Ban on Tobacco Products in the Institute’. Articles can be mailed to our email id: editor@awaaziitkgp.org. Articles may be submitted by next Sunday.
Use of any type of slang words is discouraged in the article. 
Also, please provide your name, roll number and hall in the article. Articles, however, can be published anonymously if requested.

Quarter Finals | Cricket | General Championship 2017-18 | Sports and Games |

Quarter-final 3: NH vs JCB (20)

The third quarter-final was just the match that we would like to pay for watching. JCB won the toss and elected to bat first. After putting a decent total of 138 runs, it was Nehru's turn to chase. The match was equally balanced till the last over when Nehru needed 8 runs off the final over. That was not all, Ramakrishna brought down the gap to 6 runs needed in two balls. But, Nehru's batsman Vishwanth Teja had some other ideas! He scored a boundary off the 5th ball and sprinted for a couple on the final ball to go past JCB's total of 138 runs defeating them by 5 wickets.

The scores were as follow:
JCB: 138/7 (20)
NH: 139/5 (20)
With this win, NH advances to the Semi-finals of Cricket. For further updates, stay tuned to our page.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them all the best for their upcoming match!
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Priyansh Shah and Mihir Sampat.

The second quarter-finals witnessed MMM-2 getting past their hall mates MMM-1 by 7 wickets with ease. MMM-2 won the toss and decided to field first. MMM-1 batting first kept losing wickets at regular intervals which denied them to pose a big total. The scores were as follow:

||New Micro-Credit Course||
Ever wondered how will our world or country look like in terms of medical technology or healthcare services? What would be the role of emerging new technologies (e.g. ML/AI) in the development and transformation of the field? Are we ready for the upcoming challenges? 
Get an opportunity to listen directly from Professor Michael Friebe, a Distinguished Lecturer of the IEEE EMBS. He is an active contributor to this field through his research works & entrepreneurial skills and specialises in diagnostic imaging & image-guided therapies.

Professor M. Friebe is offering a 1 credit (additional) course named “INNOVATION, DISRUPTION, AND EXPONENTIAL DEVELOPMENT IN MEDICAL TECHNOLOGIES”.
The interested students must apply for this course through ERP by today only. The registration portal along with the syllabus and schedule can be found here: ERP>Academic>Students>Micro-Credit Registration.

For any query, contact Prof. P. K. Dan (pkdan@see.iitkgp.ernet.in) or Dr. Bhaskar Bhowmick (bhaskar@see.iitkgp.ernet.in).

Update on MCM Scholarship 

A significant chunk of the student population of IIT Kharagpur receives the Merit-cum-means scholarship and this year the recipients have not yet received their scholarship amount. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had earlier reported the reason for the delay (See post-https://www.facebook.com/awaaziitkgp/posts/1716731461680535). 

We found out that out of about 600 recipients, about 50-60 recipients have not updated their correct bank account details in the ERP despite several requests by the Institute, as a result of which, no one has yet received the MCM scholarship amount to their credit. 

One of our Executive Editors had a thorough meeting with the Officiating Deputy Registrar, Mr. Sarbeswar Nayak, regarding the withholding of the scholarship amount of those who have already submitted their details. Those students are not at all supposed to suffer due to the irresponsible behaviour by some of the students. The meeting concluded with the Officiating Deputy Registrar giving assurance that the students who have successfully updated their details will receive the scholarship amount in their bank accounts very soon, as the transaction is under process.
 
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the students who have not updated their details with the ERP, to update them as soon as possible, as it creates hurdles in such crucial processes.

Contributing to a child's smile is one of the noblest things to do! Don't you want to be one of the contributors? We all still crave for the feeling we got playing in our school playgrounds or the grounds near our house. The lessons learnt in these playgrounds cannot be taught in any classroom. The open ground removes all the boundaries from a child’s actions giving him the freedom to grow in all dimensions both mentally and physically. Apart from all these benefits let us not forget the unparalleled fun on the swings and slides!

Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Chapter is collaborating with Anthill Creations, started by IIT KGP alumni, where they make playgrounds for children in a unique way by using cost-effective practices such as industrial waste and localized sourcing techniques. They want your support for building a playground for the children of Amlatoria School to ensure that all children have fun and excitement in their lives. Currently, the Amaltoria School does not have a playground. CRY and Anthill Playscapes hope to raise INR 1,25,000 for their motive to spread smiles and cheerfulness for children and make the world a better place for children.
Support them here:
https://anthillcreations.ketto.org/fundraiser/CRYiitkgpAnthill?utm_source=campaigner&utm_medium=fbpageshare&utm_campaign=CRYiitkgpAnthill&utm_content=383481

Another proud moment for all KGPians. Our Alumnus of 2011 batch, Mr. Siddartha Khastgir has been named in the Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018- Industry List for research contributions which have delivered impact to the automotive industry. Mr. Khastgir is currently a Ph.D. Researcher at the University of Warwick where his research is focused on developing new methods and knowledge necessary to test driverless cars to ensure their dependability and to make them commercially viable and is consequently accelerating their introduction. He is also a UK Representative to the ISO Technical Committee for developing international standards in the field of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) and Automated Driving (AD). 
His passion for automobiles first came to notice when he founded TeamKART-Formula SAE Team of IIT Kharagpur, the first ever Formula Student/SAE project at IIT Kharagpur. Through his talent and dedication, he got the first breakthrough when he procured a funding of INR 1 million from the Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) IIT Kharagpur. This was the largest funding ever by IIT for a student-led project. Mr. Khastgir has also been awarded the TechWorks Young Engineer Under 30 Award 2017. Through his hard work fuelled by the right amount of enthusiasm, he becomes an inspiration for the youth all over the country.  
https://www.forbes.com/profile/siddartha-khastgir/

The KGPian Quizzers are absolutely on a roll! The team of Abhimanyu Bharade, Baibhab Pattnaik and Harsh Agarwal won the 'India Quiz' in the recently concluded Nihilanth - the Annual Inter IIT-IIM Quiz championship. After registering a thunderous sweeping win in Inter IIT Cultural Meet, their juggernaut went on to register one more victory against a formidable team of IIM Ahmedabad. Last year, they had finished last in the finals of India Quiz but they made amends for the same in the 15th edition of Nihilanth, hosted by IIM Ahmedabad from January 25-28, 2018. What makes this win more special is that they got past over mighty IIM Ahmedabad team to finish at the top.
This championship featured over seven quizzes for the institutes to slug it out for the coveted championship with the active participation of 450+ students from over 39 contingents (19 IITs, 20 IIMs). As far as overall rankings are concerned, IIT Madras was looking all set to win the championship for record 5th time in a row but was denied by a late comeback by hosts IIM Ahmedabad. IIM Ahmedabad bagged the championship and IIT Kharagpur finished joint 6th ahead of IIM Lucknow, IIT Kanpur and IIM Bangalore.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the participants for their wonderful performance!

The TN-JK Cultural Interspersion event is going to be organised under the banner of "Ek Bharat Shrestha Bharat", an MHRD initiative. The function will go on from 4 pm to 9 pm in Kalidas Auditorium on 30th and 31st January. Kashmiri and South Indian food stalls along with the stalls selling native merchandise shall be put up in the Tech Market from 4 pm to 11 pm.

Remember the times when you loved going to your grandparents’ village in your childhood? Panch Parmeshwar is all set to drive your nostalgia away bringing to you some of those funny and interesting situations which you encountered in your village.

सही और गलत के पार, 
बरगद के पेड़ तले,
मुकदमों को सुलझाते हुए,
पंच परमेश्वर है,
हम वहीं मिलेंगे।

Panch Parmeshwar is a fun event in which two teams are provided with a slightly complex & funny case [Depicting a situation of a village] to fight on verbally in front of the panchayat of the village. The team presenting more funny and relevant arguments is decided to be the winner. Be there in front of the HSS department tomorrow, 10 am onwards to have a burst of laughter and loads of fun.
Date: 10:00AM
Time: 27-01-2018
Veunu: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added an event.

message:
“WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC…”
It’s no one else but us who had taken this pledge long ago to make our country a better place not only in terms of lawfulness but also to achieve the transcendental goal of peace & harmony in the community which India comprises of. Our constitution is just a path towards building a good republic and with our honest intentions, we can constitute a healthy republic. Let’s commemorate the efforts of the historic intellectuals of our land in bringing out our nation to this level and put our efforts to head towards a better tomorrow.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy Republic Day!

‌Amidst the energetic spring, IIT Kharagpur celebrated the 69th Republic Day with great enthusiasm and warmth in the Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The celebrations unfolded with our honourable Deputy Director Sriman Kumar Bhattacharyya hoisting the national flag followed by the national anthem sung in unison. The NCC wings marched thereafter along with NSS volunteers cheering up the celebrations. Professor S K Bhattacharyya also addressed the students and the guests in the programme. Kids from schools such as DAV,  Kendriya Vidyalaya and Jagriti Vidya Mandir (JVM) depicted India's cultural diversity in their lovely performances. The programme also included a dance performance by students of Technology Dance Society (TDS) and a Nukkad Natak by students of Gopali Youth Welfare Society (GYWS).
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a warm Republic Day.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 9 new photos — with Vishal Mahato and Arvind Reddy Bora.

message:
Remember the times when you loved going to your grandparents’ village in your childhood? Panch Parmeshwar is all set to drive your nostalgia away bringing to you some of those funny and interesting situations which you encountered in your village.

सही और गलत के पार, 
बरगद के पेड़ तले,
मुकदमों को सुलझाते हुए,
पंच परमेश्वर है,
हम वहीं मिलेंगे।

Panch Parmeshwar is a fun event in which two teams are provided with a slightly complex & funny case [Depicting a situation of a village] to fight on verbally in front of the panchayat of the village. The team presenting more funny and relevant arguments is decided to be the winner. Be there in front of the HSS department tomorrow, 10 am onwards to have a burst of laughter and loads of fun.

In what comes as an awaited and impactful decision, the HRD ministry has approved one-time additional funding of Rs. 456.10 crores to the four IITs: IIT Kharagpur,  IIT Madras, IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi.
 
IIT Kharagpur has been allocated a significant sum of 151.19 crores of this money which has been allocated for development of lab infrastructure, equipments and other academic facilities.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with Dr. János Pach from Hungary. He came here to deliver a lecture on combinatorics in Kshitij 2018. Currently, he is a Professor at Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at New York University and EPFL Lausanne. 
He has been awarded Alfréd Rényi Prize from the Hungarian Academy of Sciences and has also been elected as a fellow of the American Mathematical Society for his contributions to discrete and combinatorial geometry and to convexity and combinatorics.
Have a look at this to know more about one of the best Hungarian Mathematicians

Don't we all get agitated due to the baseless links that pop up while reading some important news? A team of post graduate students and faculty members from IIT Kharagpur seem to have finally found a solution for these clickbaits, that is, webpages with luring titles but irrelevant content. IIT-KGP's solution is a browser extension named 'Stop Clickbait' that can detect and block clickbaits with more than 90% accuracy. Following this up, they are working with Microsoft to assess the relevance of the revenue models of such advertisements.

The team has analysed linguistic patterns and complemented it with tracking news and twitter posts of different national and international media channels over several months to develop this extension which already has over a 2000 downloads.

Prof. Niloy Ganguly, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur says, 
"Our primary aim is to offer a choice to the readers. If they like clickbaits, they are free to pursue them. If they don't like, our extension can come to the rescue."

Read the complete article at:
https://m.economictimes.com/industry/services/education/iit-kharagpur-develops-clickbait-blocker/articleshow/62609919.cms

Career Development Centre, IIT Kharagpur is organizing a workshop to be conducted by the Indian Air Force for final and pre-final year students. The workshop is intended to explain the process and skill set required to apply for a job in the Indian Air Force.

Date: 24 January 2018 ( Wednesday ) 
Time: 2:50 PM
Venue: Gargi Auditorium

Setting high benchmarks in the world of competitive coding, the team 'The Vindicators' that consists of three KGPians namely Pranjal Shankhdhar, Sandeep Kumar Pani and Mayank Khetan, has qualified for the prestigious ACM-ICPC 2018 World Finals. They showcased immense coding prowess to come second in ACM ICPC Amritapuri Regionals where 255 teams were battling for a spot in the finals.
In world finals, there will be around 130 teams eyeing for the ultimate top honours. ACM-ICPC 2018 World Finals will be conducted on April 19, 2018 and will be hosted by Peking University and CYSCC: The Children and Youth Science Center of CAST (Beijing, China).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team and wishes them best for the finals!
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Sandeep Kumar Pani and 2 others.

message:
IITs are well known as the premier institutes of the country for their work for the society. IIT Kharagpur proved the same yet again by boosting development of North-East through technological assistance. IIT Kharagpur has great capabilities in the Food Processing sector and has prepared the
ready-to-eat high energy food paste, which will be very beneficial for malnourished children between the age group of six months to six years.

The Agricultural and Food Engineering Department of IIT Kharagpur demonstrated the initiative of the development of technology and machinery for the production of ready-to-cook iron-fortified rice premix which is fully compatible with those of normal rice, catering to India's anemic population.
A patent has already been applied for producing rice from broken rice kernels using extrusion technology.
The Rural Technology Action Group (RuTAG) unit, led by Professor PB Singh Bhadoria of IIT Kharagpur will be the coordinating center for this mission of technologies for the North-East. 

"We are now planning for high-end value-added products including those from turmeric, ginger, etc, in collaboration with BARC,"
 IIT Kharagpur director Partha Pratim Chakrabarti said.
Source- http://www.millenniumpost.in/kolkata/iit-kgp-to-boost-devp-of-north-east-through-technological-assistance-280883

"वर दे, वीणावादिनी वर दे!

प्रिय स्वतंत्र- रव अमृत-मंत्र नव
भारत में भर दे!

काट अंध्-उर के बंधन-स्तर
बहा जननि, ज्योतिर्मय निर्झर
कलुष-भेद-तम हर प्रकाश भर
जगमग जग कर दे!

नव गति, नव लय, ताल-छंद नव
नवल कंठ, नव जलद-मन्द्र रव
नव नभ के नव विहग-वृंद को
नव पर, नव स्वर दे!

वर दे, वीणावादिनी वर दे।"

The fifteenth edition of Kshitij was inaugurated in Kalidas Auditorium last night.
The event began with the traditional lighting of the lamp, followed by the Director's welcome speech for all the participants, the guests of honour and the chief guest of the event, Mr. Kaushik Dutta, Joint General Manager of the title sponsors of Kshitij-2018, L&T Ltd.

Following the motivational words of the Director and Mr. Dutta for the excited participants, faculty member Prof. Jitendra Kumar delivered the vote of thanks to the guests and all the people who have burnt the midnight oil to make Kshitij a reality.

Dean of Student Affairs, Prof. Somesh Kumar introduced the audience to Dr. Rajendra Singh, who then delivered the introductory lecture. Dr. Rajendra Singh, who is a guest of honour for the event, is a water conservationist and is renowned as the Waterman of India.

IITians are well known for their innovative ideas which have always been helping the society. Mr. Prateek Sharma, an alumnus of IIT Delhi has proved the same in a louder voice. The team of IIT alumni including Mr. Sharma, professors and other students have developed an anti-pollution filter which costs only Rs.10. 
The motivation behind this unbelievably cheap product was his asthma-prone mother. She had to face suffocation with the  mask and apart from solving this problem, Nasofilters also protects people against allergies. These innovators had also won the ‘Startup national Award’ for their product in May 2017. For more details, follow the link below:
https://fit.thequint.com/fit/nasofilters-developed-by-iit-team

For last 3-4 years, it has been observed that the amount of MCM scholarship used to get credited to the students' bank accounts within the first week of the semester. But it has been around 16 days since the commencement of this semester and the MCM scholarship amount hasn't been credited yet. When our team tried to dig this matter up, what we found was something that reveals the sheer negligence of some of the students. Around 50-60 students haven't updated their bank details (Account numbers and other information) and since the MCM scholarship is credited batch-wise at once, incomplete bank details of some students are the reason why the amount hasn't been credited yet. 
These concerned students have been mailed and informed many times to update their bank details but to no avail! Due to some of the students, many students who used to pay their semester fees with the MCM scholarship money have not been able to register yet. Other students who are in dire need of financial assistance and MCM has been their only source for the same, are also facing difficulties of various degrees. As more details were revealed, it was found out that some students have also filled invalid contact numbers and account numbers (containing alphabets) such as MV34GK984P. 
This kind of sheer negligence and carelessness on students' part is gross irresponsibility on students' part and goes on to show that how insensitive have they become towards abiding by the rules and regulations. And their negligence has affected not only them but also many of the needy students who would have liked to get the scholarship as soon as possible. 
We would like to appeal to the student community to fill the necessary details as soon as possible. Also, we all should make efforts henceforth so that such kind of incidents do not get repeated in the future.
